Title: Ruling party weaponised MPs' suspension: Kharge
bottom_headline: Opposition MPs protest suspension of MPs

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Karnataka Minister Shivanand Patil raked up a row saying farmers wished for drought. Stating that the farmers have been getting free water, power, seeds, and fertilisers, he said they are wishing for a drought so that their loans would be waived. The Opposition has demanded Patil's resignation for insulting the farmers. He had earlier linked farmer suicides with compensation.
Title: Karnataka Minister says farmers want drought, sparks row
bottom_headline: Karnataka CM seeks ₹18,177 crore drought relief

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: The BBMP has set a 28 February deadline for all businesses to have 60% space on their name boards to have Kannada writings. The trade licenses of those failing to implement the order will be suspended. The BBMP's move came amidst Kannada Rakshana Vedike campaigning for Kannada. The BBMP directive extends to all businesses, including malls.
Title: BBMP sets 28 Feb deadline for 60% Kannada boards
bottom_headline: Siddaramaiah joins ‘Hindi imposition’ chorus

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: A transman was arrested for burning alive his childhood classmate, now a software engineer, at Thalambur, Chennai. The suspect, Vetrimaran, chained R Nandhini to a chair on the pretext of springing a birthday surprise, slashed her, and set her ablaze on Saturday. Both hailed from Madurai, the police said. The two had worked in a company in Chennai, they added.
Title: Transman held for burning alive childhood friend
bottom_headline: : Tamil Nadu court awards life sentence to four

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A woman aged around 70 was tied to an electric pole and thrashed by her son for allegedly stealing cauliflower from his farmland in Odisha's Keonjhar district. The son threatened the villagers who tried to intervene. The woman was rescued and sent to a healthcare centre. The pictures of the incident surfaced on social media.
Title: Son ties elderly mother to electric pole for stealing cauliflower in Odisha
bottom_headline: A case was filed against her son

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: Four coaches of the Ajmer-Sealdah Express got derailed while being taken to the yard for maintenance at Ajmer Junction, officials said on Monday. However, no casualties were reported in the derailment incident, officials added. Train movement is not disrupted and trains are passing through the second line, efforts are underway to bring coaches back on track, chief PRO said.
Title: 4 coaches of Ajmer-Sealdah Express derail in Ajmer; no casualties
bottom_headline: Visuals of the incident site surfaced

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: A 14-year-old boy collapsed on his teacher outside his classroom in a Jaipur school before dying of a suspected heart attack. "The school administration rushed him immediately to a nearby hospital, and from there he was referred to the SMS Hospital, but he could not survive," police said. The child's body was handed over to the family.
Title: 14-yr-old boy collapses on teacher, dies of heart attack in Jaipur school
bottom_headline: He was studying in Class 9

Author: Swarna Srikanth
Content: An X user who was about to enjoy a Christmas treat this festival season by ordering food online from an iconic restaurant from South Bombay was left disgusted after the order turned a messy meal. Identified as Ujwal Puri shared visuals from his food order claiming of shockingly receiving a medicine strip inside it.
Title: Tablet Strip Found In Chicken Meal From Mumbai's Leopold Cafe
bottom_headline: Swiggy responds, no answer from eatery

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: BJP shared a video purportedly showing state Sugarcane Development Minister Shivanand Patil saying there's free electricity and free water from Krishna river in Karnataka. "Farmers have only one wish—there should be drought year after year so that their loans get waived," he purportedly added. Earlier, Patil said farmer suicide rates had spiked after the state hiked compensation for such deaths.
Title: Farmers wish for drought to get loan waiver: Karnataka minister
bottom_headline: 'Siddaramaiah's Cabinet full of ignorant fools'

Author: Disha Jana
Content: Iran has rejected US' claim that it had targeted a chemical tanker on December 23 in Arabian Sea off the Gujarat coast, calling the accusation "baseless". The reaction came after the Pentagon said that a drone launched from Iran had struck the vessel in the Indian Ocean. No casualties were reported but the vessel sustained damage due to an explosion.
Title: Baseless: Iran on US' claim that it targeted tanker near India
bottom_headline: For more information

Author: News Desk
Content: Two tyres of a TSRTC Palle Velugu bus fell off mid-journey near Elkathurthy, on the Huzurabad-Hanamkonda route on Sunday, December 24. The rented TSRTC bus, with 42 passengers onboard, was moving at 40km/hour when the rear tyres of the vehicle dislodged. However, the alert driver managed to manoeuvre the bus to safety and the passengers escaped unhurt.
Title: Watch: Tyres of rented TSRTC bus fall off mid-journey in Telangana
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: BRS MLA Lasya Nanditha got trapped in a lift due to overloading in Telangana on Sunday. A picture from the incident showed six people posing with the MLA inside the stuck lift. Further, a video showed her staff and locals breaking open the lift door. Nanditha, who won the 2023 Assembly elections from Secunderabad Cantonment, was rescued safely.
Title: BRS MLA Lasya Nanditha gets trapped in overloaded lift, rescued
bottom_headline: Mishap occurred during her visit to an event

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: The Indian Navy on Tuesday said it has deployed three guided missile destroyers in the Arabian Sea "to maintain a deterrent presence". This came after merchant vessel MV Chem Pluto came under attack from a drone near India. Warships INS Mormugao, INS Kochi and INS Kolkata have been deployed in various areas, Navy said.
Title: India deploys 3 warships in Arabian Sea after drone attacks commercial ship
bottom_headline: Gabon-flagged oil tanker attacked in Red Sea
bottom_text: 25 Indian crew members are on board the tanker

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: A plane carrying 276 passengers, mostly Indians, that was grounded in France over human trafficking concerns landed in Mumbai early on Tuesday and pictures of the passengers surfaced online. As per French authorities, 25 persons, including two minors, expressed the wish to apply for asylum and remained in France. Meanwhile, two others were held and produced before a judge.
Title: Plane with 276 Indians held in France over human trafficking lands in Mumbai; 1st pics surface
bottom_headline: The plane was bound for Nicaragua

Author: Shree Lakshmi
Content: A Christmas celebration in Thiruvananthapuram's Poovar area took a distressing turn as a makeshift bridge collapsed on Monday night. The incident resulted in minor injuries to approximately seven individuals, all of whom were promptly taken to the hospital for medical attention. Emergency services responded swiftly to ensure the injured individuals received necessary medical care.
Title: Makeshift Bridge Collapse in Kerala; More Updates
bottom_headline: 7 People Injured

Author: FPJ Online Edit
Content: Indian Immigration at the Mumbai Airport said that 276 passengers were on board the flight that had been sent back by France while 25 individuals, including two minors, sought political asylum. A total of 303 passengers including 11 unaccompanied minors suspected to be illegal immigrants and victims of human trafficking were detained at Vatry airport near Paris on Friday.
Title: Airbus A340 Held In France Lands At Mumbai Airport
bottom_headline: The aircraft landed in Mumbai shortly after 4 am

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: EAM S Jaishankar held a meeting with leading representatives of the Russian strategic community on Monday. They discussed connectivity, multilateralism, big power competition and regional conflicts. They spoke about the importance of rebalancing and the emergence of multipolarity.
Title: Jaishankar meets leading representatives of Russia
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: President Droupadi Murmu gave assent to the three new criminal justice bills passed by Parliament. The Rajya Sabha on Dec 21 passed the three criminal bills–the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, 2023; the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, 2023; and the Bharatiya Sakshya Bill, 2023–replacing the IPC, the CrPC and the Evidence Act. The bills were earlier passed by the Lok Sabha.
Title: Three new criminal Bills get President’s assent
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: After the attack by a suspected drone on merchant vessel MV Chem Pluto on December 23, the Indian Navy deployed multiple Guided Missile Destroyers. They are INS Mormugao, INS Kochi and INS Kolkata in various areas of the Arabian Sea to maintain a deterrent presence. Moreover, long-range maritime reconnaissance P8I aircraft are also being regularly tasked to maintain domain awareness.
Title: IN deploys major warships to counter attacks in Arabian Sea
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A makeshift bridge set up for Christmas celebrations collapsed in Neyyattinkara town in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram on Monday. Several people have been injured in the incident and rescue operations are underway. Visuals that surfaced online showed several people gathered in the area as ambulances made their way to take the injured persons.
Title: Makeshift bridge collapses during Christmas celebrations in Kerala, several injured
bottom_headline: More details are awaited

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: A woman who accused an autorickshaw driver of raping her in Kerala has been found to have lied about the incident. The 19-year-old made false allegation to get her boyfriend's attention and to stop him from leaving her, police said. The woman claimed she had fainted in the autorickshaw on her way to a beach and woke up half-naked.
Title: Woman lies about auto driver raping her to get boyfriend's attention in Kerala
bottom_headline: She misused the law: Police

Author: Swarna Srikanth
Content: This Christmas, the Mumbai Police shared festival greetings in their quirky style. They uploaded two posts online wishing people a Merry Christmas. While one showed Santa riding his vehicle with a helmet and reflected on road safety, the other threw light on cybersecurity and password protection.
Title: Mumbai Police Wishes Merry Christmas In Santa Style
bottom_headline: "Keep your gifts & passwords a secret"
bottom_text: Tap to know what more Mumbai police said

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: A case was registered after a woman's Instagram account was hacked and obscene photos of her were made public before her marriage in Uttar Pradesh. According to the complaint, the photos were edited and a message posted from her account demanded ₹500 for viewing the videos. The woman's fiancé claimed it was a deliberate attempt to malign his would-be wife.
Title: Woman's Instagram account hacked, obscene pics posted before wedding in UP
bottom_headline: The case was filed under the IT Act

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: A notice has been installed outside Shree Ramnath Devasthan in Goa's Ponda about dress code for visitors. The board said people wearing shorts, mini skirts, sleeveless tops, low-waist jeans and short T-shirts won't be allowed to enter the temple. Notably, most temples in Ponda are likely to provide 'uparne' and 'lungi' to those not dressed as per their dress codes.
Title: Those wearing shorts, mini skirts can't enter: Board at Goa temple
bottom_headline: Dress codes to apply from January 1: Reports

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: AIMIM president Asaduddin Owaisi expressed concern over the alleged custodial torture of civilians in Jammu and Kashmir. What happened to Home Minister Amit Shah’s claim that after the repeal of Article 370  “everything has been sorted and that there is no terrorism?”, he asked. The Army has ordered a probe into the three alleged custodial civilian deaths in Poonch.
Title: AIMIM's Owaisi questions Shah over J&K custodial torture
bottom_headline: India united against scourge of terrorism

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: People's Democratic Party (PDP) claimed that party's chief Mehbooba Mufti has been put under house arrest ahead of her visit to J&K's Surankote where four soldiers were killed in a militant ambush on Thursday. On Sunday, Mufti took to social media platform X and said that the "ground reality" punctured the narrative of peace in Jammu and Kashmir.
Title: Mufti under house arrest, not allowed to visit terror attack site Surankote: PDP
bottom_headline: 3 soldiers were injured in the terror attack

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) released a list of coldest cities in northwest India on Christmas Day, with Churu in Rajasthan recording the lowest minimum temperature of 6.4°C. MP's Rajgarh recorded 7 degrees, Punjab's Amritsar saw 7.2 degrees and Haryana's Hisar recorded 7.3 degrees. Chandigarh, Meerut, Kota, Udaipur, Ambala, Karnal, etc are also among the coldest cities today.
Title: IMD releases list of coldest cities in northwest India today
bottom_headline: MP's Gwalior, Khandwa also coldest today

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Mysuru-Kodagu MP Pratap Simha's brother Vikram Simha has been booked for illegally felling several scheduled trees in Hassan district. The MP has been on the defensive after he reportedly issued passes to two men, who breached Parliament security on 13 December. Karnataka's Forest Minister Eshwar Khandre said he has ordered a detailed investigation, and assured prompt legal action.
Title: BJP MP Pratap Simha's brother booked for axing trees
bottom_headline: Congress stages protest for Simha’s arrest

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy on Sunday, reminded district collectors and police superintendents of the need to work 18 hours a day to deliver the Congress’s six guarantees to the beneficiaries. He offered to transfer any official unwilling to meet his expectations to remote places and warned the police against laxity in maintaining law and order.
Title: Work 18 hours to deliver guarantees: Revanth Reddy
bottom_headline: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy taunts KTR

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: BRS working president KT Rama Rao on Sunday presented a Swedha Patram, a “White paper” on the state’s progress under the BRS’s rule. Releasing the document in response to the White Papers by the government, Rao said the Congress has to implement all its assurances in 100 days. He also added that the BRS will form a shadow Cabinet.
Title: BRS to form shadow Cabinet in Telangana
bottom_headline: BJP dilemma in Andhra Pradesh

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: The BJP is in a dilemma over whether to ally with ruling YSRCP or the Opposition TDP in Andhra Pradesh ahead of the 2024 polls. The party that garnered less than 1 percent votes in the previous Lok Sabha polls, feels an alliance with either of parties would better its prospects. However, its leaders are divided on the possible partner.
Title: Hamletian dilemma for BJP in Andhra
bottom_headline: Prashant Kishor meets Chandrababu

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Anupama Chandran, whose baby was given in adoption — and later reunited — without her knowledge two years ago by her father and a few Kerala CPI(M) leaders, has petitioned the government to keep its promise of taking action against those who had taken away her son. However, she was prevented from meeting the chief minister in person.
Title: Illegal adoption: Young Kerala mother demands action
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: 'Bombay Begums', a Netflix drama series, has caught the attention of a group of Indian researchers for its masterful depiction of women's problems, including their physical and mental health. The scholars found the series holding a mirror up to the double lives of urban women and published an article on the educational takeaways from the show.
Title: 'Bombay Begums' — a window to women's health
bottom_headline: Women less serious about heart health

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy ordered financial assistance of ₹2 lakh for the family of Mohammaed Rizwan, a Swiggy delivery partner, who fell to his death from a Banjara Hills apartment in January. Rizwan was delivering a food packet when the customer's dog charged at him, leading to the fall. Reddy also announced a comprehensive plan for gig workers.
Title: Telangana announces relief for gig workers
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: PM Narendra Modi on Monday paid tribute to former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee on his 99th birth anniversary at the 'Sadaiv Atal' memorial in Delhi. "His dedication and service towards Mother India will remain a source of inspiration even in his immortal age," PM said. PM Modi was joined by other leaders including JP Nadda and Rajnath Singh.
Title: PM Modi pays tribute to ex-PM Atal Bihari on his birth anniversary
bottom_headline: Atal Bihari served as PM of India for six years

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: President Droupadi Murmu and PM Narendra Modi extended Christmas greetings on Monday morning and separately asked people to recall the teachings of Lord Jesus Christ. "Let's celebrate the spirit of harmony and compassion that Christmas symbolises, and work towards a world where everyone is happy," PM Modi said. Meanwhile, the President said, "Let's resolve to work…for well-being...of one and all."
Title: Recall the teachings of Lord Christ: President, PM Modi on Xmas
bottom_headline: 'May your hearts be filled with love'

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: Sena Medal recipient Lieutenant Colonel Karanbir Singh Natt has passed away eight years after he slipped into a coma after being seriously injured during a gunfight with terrorists in J&K's Kupwara. Lt Colonel Natt was shot in the lower jaw during a counter-insurgency operation in 2015. He breathed his last at the Military Hospital in Jalandhar on December 23.
Title: Lt Colonel in coma for 8 years after being shot by terrorists in J&K passes away
bottom_headline: Lt Col Natt was part of 160 Infantry Battalion
bottom_text: He was second in command during incident

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: Kerala reported the biggest jump in active COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours at 128, followed by Karnataka at 73, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Other states which saw an increase in active COVID-19 cases are Maharashtra (50), Rajasthan (11), Tamil Nadu (9) and Telangana (8). Total number of active cases in India stand at 4,054.
Title: Which states reported an increase in COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours?
bottom_headline: Kerala reported 1 death due to COVID-19

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Tamil Nadu BJP chief Annamalai shared screenshots of Tamil Nadu minister TRB Rajaa's purported old posts against Biharis. One of the purported posts read, "Biharis will remain at the bottom as long as the literacy rate remains [low]." Another post read, "Problem IS IN THE ENTIRE UP/BIHAR...Society & not just individuals." Annamalai claimed DMK continues to use such language today.
Title: Annamalai shares TR Rajaa's old 'Biharis will stay at bottom' post
bottom_headline: This comes after DMK MP Maran's video went viral

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: India on Monday recorded 628 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, of which 312 are active, Health Ministry data showed. Active COVID-19 cases in India have gone up to 4,054, whereas one death was reported in the last one day. Kerala recorded the most new infections with 128 new cases logged by the state.
Title: India records 628 new COVID-19 cases, active cases cross 4,000
bottom_headline: Karnataka recorded 73 new cases

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: A thick layer of fog engulfed the Delhi-NCR on Monday morning affecting flight services at Indira Gandhi International Airport as the visibility dropped to zero. The airport authorities asked passengers to contact airlines for assistance. Visibility in various parts of the city remained at 125 meters, as per IMD and the mercury dipped to 9.4 degrees Celsius.
Title: Flight operations affected at Delhi airport as fog brings down visibility
bottom_headline: Air quality remained in 'very poor' category

Author: Shree Lakshmi
Content: The unfortunate event happened on Sunday, affecting two elderly devotees, one from Sitapur (Uttar Pradesh) and the other from Jabalpur (Madhya Pradesh). Even though the police said there was no link between the deaths and the crowd at the temple, sources revealed that both women felt unwell inside the temple.
Title: Two Elderly Women Devotees Pass Away During Vrindavan Temple Visit
bottom_headline: Both women felt unwell inside the temple

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara said that state government will take a decision on Hijab issue after looking into the matter "deeply". "We have not made any orders regarding hijab," Parameshwara added. Parameshwara's remark comes after BRS leader KT Rama Rao said that Siddaramaiah government hasn't lifted ban on hijab yet and behaviour of Congress change after coming into power.
Title: Govt will decide after looking into it deeply: K'taka Min on Hijab issue
bottom_headline: 'We are thinking of withdrawing the decision'

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: PM Narendra Modi called Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin to inquire about floods in the state. Stalin said PM assured Centre's support and conveyed that he has deputed Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to assess the flood situation. This comes after state minister Udhayanidhi Stalin, while asking for disbursal of funds by Centre, said, "We're not asking for anyone's father's money."
Title: PM calls MK Stalin, deputes Sitharaman to assess Tamil Nadu floods
bottom_headline: 'Asking for share of tax paid by TN people'

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: A flight carrying 303 passengers including mostly Indians, that was grounded in France over suspected 'human trafficking', was allowed to leave on Monday, reports said. It's not yet clear if the Nicaragua-bound charter plane will return to India. The plane was grounded after authorities were reportedly alerted about the passengers likely being human trafficking 'victims' in an organised gang.
Title: Flight with Indians, grounded in France over 'human trafficking', allowed to leave
bottom_headline: 'Ten of the passengers requested asylum'

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: J&K police recovered arms and ammunition, including six IEDs and one grenade from a package that was dropped from a drone near LOC in the Akhnoor sector. The mortar shell was found lying in a field in Regal, a border village in Samba. Acting on the information, the bomb disposal squad reached the spot and recovered the mortar shell.
Title: J-K police recover arms, IEDs from drone-dropped package near LOC
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: EAM S Jaishankar is set to travel to Russia from December 25 to December 29. During his visit, he will meet his Russian counterpart Sergey Lavrov and Russian Deputy Prime Minister Denis Manturov. During the meeting, EAM Jaishankar and Russian Deputy PM and Minister of Industry and Trade Denis Manturov will meet to discuss matters related to economic engagement.
Title: EAM Jaishankar to visit Russia from December 25-29
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Disha Jana
Content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar recently said that there are a lot of complications involved in according dual citizenship to Indian nationals settled abroad. "There are security and economic challenges [in providing dual citizenship]...The OCI (Overseas Citizenship of India) [status] is the step to bridge the demand. But the debate [on dual citizenship] is still alive," he added.
Title: Dual citizenship poses challenges but debate still alive: EAM
bottom_headline: OCI card holders can't vote in India
bottom_text: They cannot contest elections here too

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A 25-year-old man was allegedly stabbed to death in Delhi's Nizamuddin and the body was set on fire using dry grass and clothes by three teenagers. One of the accused has alleged that the deceased had repeatedly tried to sexually assault him. The accused boys are aged between 16 and 17 years.
Title: 3 boys kill 25-year-old man, burn body to take revenge of sexual assault in Delhi
bottom_headline: A sharp-edged weapon, stones, sticks seized

Author: Varsha
Content: The Delhi Vigilance Secretary requested that the Health Secretary take out all non-standard medicines from the hospitals supply. The Vigilance Secretary referred to multiple lab reports from Delhi Drugs Testing Laboratory as well as additional reports from government-approved private laboratories concerning the Not of Standard Quality Drugs in his letter to the Delhi Health Secretary.
Title: Vigilance Secy Urges Seizure of Non-Standard Medicines
bottom_headline: The officer had previously been taken to court

Author: Varsha
Content: The most recent stealth guided-missile destroyer to join the Indian Navy, called Imphal, is scheduled to be placed into service on December 26 in front of Defense Minister Rajnath Singh. According to the Ministry of Defence, on October 20, Imphal, the first warship named after a northeastern city, was handed over to the navy.
Title: Indian Navy to Commission Stealth Destroyer ‘Imphal’
bottom_headline: The ship is equipped to fight

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: Sanjay Singh, the newly elected chief of Wrestling Federation of India that was suspended by the Sports Ministry on Sunday, has said he would speak to PM Narendra Modi over the decision. "We're seeking time from the Sports Minister and request that the suspension be lifted. If the issue isn't resolved through dialogue, we could explore legal options," he added.
Title: Will speak to PM, see legal options if issue not resolved: Sanjay Singh on WFI suspension
bottom_headline: Singh is ex-WFI chief Brij Bhushan's close aide

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: A video showing a man driving his car with the doors open, while a person could be seen hanging from the other door on Manali-Atal Tunnel road amid traffic jam went viral on social media. Reacting to the video, Kullu Police shared a picture of ₹3,500 challan issued against the car owner for the offence.
Title: Video shows man driving with open doors amid jam in Manali; police posts pic of challan
bottom_headline: To see the video

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: A massive traffic jam was seen outside the newly-opened Phoenix Mall of Asia in Bengaluru due to a huge influx of visitors on Christmas Eve. Traffic police advised airport-bound commuters to plan accordingly due to the heavy congestion. Several people took to social media to share pictures of the traffic chaos, with some getting stuck in the jam for hours.
Title: Pics show massive traffic outside new mall in Bengaluru on Christmas Eve
bottom_headline: Mall's parking can only fit about 3,500 vehicles
bottom_text: It has a footfall of 50,000-60,000 on weekends

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: Wrestler Bajrang Punia, who left his Padma Shri honour on a footpath near Kartavya Path, has said he won't take the honour back until justice is delivered. Wrestler Sakshee Malikkh quit wrestling after former WFI chief Brij Bhushan Singh's aide, Sanjay Singh, was appointed as the WFI chief. Notably, the newly elected body was suspended on Sunday by Sports Ministry.
Title: Won't take Padma Shri back until justice is delivered: Bajrang
bottom_headline: 'Haven't seen anything in writing'
bottom_text: Tap to read what Sakshee said

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: An assistant doctor and an associate doctor have been suspended after 18 patients' death in a hospital in Maharashtra's Thane in August. CM Eknath Shinde had ordered the constitution of a high-level committee to probe the matter. The report was tabled during the recent winter session of the assembly, an official said.
Title: 2 doctors suspended months after 18 patients died in a day in Maha hospital
bottom_headline: Thane is the home turf of Shinde

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: During a press conference, former WFI chief Brij Bhushan Singh claimed that a reporter was sent to such conferences to ask "inciting" questions. When asked to comment on Bajrang Punia leaving his Padma Shri honour on a footpath near Kartavya Path, Brij said he didn't want to comment on someone who had constantly "abused" him.
Title: You're sent to ask inciting questions, Brij Bhushan tells reporter
bottom_headline: PM will rule India for another 20 yrs: Brij

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: Regional Meteorological Centre, Chennai has said that the loss of lives in Tamil Nadu amid cyclone Michaung was averted due to world-class equipment. This comes after Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin had said that the India Meteorological Department failed to predict the accurate amount of rainfall in its forecast for several districts that witnessed 'historic' rains, which led to waterlogging.
Title: Loss of lives averted due to world-class tech: RMC Chennai on Stalin’s remark
bottom_headline: 'Such a remark hurt sentiments of employees'
bottom_text: Tap to read what RMC Chennai said

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: A 25-year-old female software engineer was chained and burnt to death allegedly by her lover, identified as a trans man, near Chennai. Blade injuries were found on her neck, hands and legs. Police said the duo had developed a friendship but a few months ago, the victim started seeing another man, following which the accused killed her on her birthday.
Title: Woman techie chained, cut with blade & burnt to death by lover on birthday near Chennai
bottom_headline: The accused has been arrested

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: More than 37,000 women from Ahir community performed Maha Raas in Dwarka, Gujarat, on Sunday. An aerial view of the women, who were dressed in traditional red attire, dancing in sync in huge circles around Lord Krishna's idol has gone viral. The event was organised in the honour of Usha, the daughter of Banasur and wife of Lord Krishna's grandson.
Title: Aerial view of thousands of women dancing in sync to perform Maha Raas in Gujarat goes viral
bottom_headline: To watch the video

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: Sanjay Singh, who was elected as the WFI President, has reacted to the newly elected body being suspended by the Sports Ministry. "Brij Bhushan Singh has retired, Sakshee Malikkh announced her retirement as well...the accused and the complainant have retired...they should let the federation run peacefully," Singh said. Sakshee announced her retirement following Singh's appointment as WFI chief.
Title: Sakshee & Brij have retired, both should let WFI run: Sanjay Singh
bottom_headline: Brij and I aren't relatives: Sanjay Singh

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan shared pictures of black tigers found in Odisha's Similipal National Park and wrote, "There are pseudo-melanistic tigers found in Simlipal. They are such due to genetic mutation & highly rare. Such beautiful creature." "The rare tigers were first officially discovered in STR in 2007. With time more were documented," he added.
Title: Pics of 'highly rare' black tigers in Odisha shared by IFS officer
bottom_headline: To see other pictures shared by the IFS officer

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: Thousands of people reached Manali for Christmas and New Year celebrations and pictures of the crowded market have surfaced on social media. Long queues of vehicles were also witnessed from Manali to Atal Tunnel. Meanwhile, snowfall was witnessed near the Atal Tunnel in Rohtang and its adjoining areas as well as in Keylong of Lahaul and Spiti.
Title: Thousands of tourists reach Manali for Christmas, pic from market surfaces
bottom_headline: People complained of traffic on social media

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: Students of a government school in Bengaluru were made to clean toilets, with a video of the incident also surfacing online. The video showed two students using a broom and other materials to clean a toilet barefoot. Parents of the students protested outside the school after the video went viral. The headmistress of the school was suspended following the incident.
Title: Students in B'luru made to clean school toilets, video goes viral
bottom_headline: We shouldn't misuse kids: Karnataka Deputy CM

Author: Brijesh
Content: An incredible event occurred at a Bihar railway station when a mother and her two kids narrowly avoided being hit by a fast-moving train. Social media users have taken to sharing a video of the terrifying incident, which shows the mother doing a heroic job of protecting her kids from the approaching train.
Title: Viral Video: Woman Shields Children from Speeding Train
bottom_headline: Husband took a daring leap from the moving train

Author: Mansi Agarwal
Content: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy has announced a ₹5 lakh accident insurance cover for gig workers such as food delivery executives and cab and auto drivers. Additionally, the state government will provide ₹10 lakh health cover to gig workers under the Rajiv Aarogyasri scheme, he stated. He added that the government would study the existing policy for gig workers in Rajasthan.
Title: Telangana to give ₹5 lakh accident insurance to gig workers: CM
bottom_headline: To know more

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: Sports Ministry has requested the Indian Olympic Association to constitute ad-hoc committee to manage and control affairs of the Wrestling Federation of India (WFI), hours after suspending the newly-elected body. BJP MP Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh's close aide Sanjay Singh was appointed as the new WFI chief on Thursday. "I've nothing to do with the sport now," Bhushan said.
Title: Sports Ministry requests IOA to form ad-hoc panel to manage WFI affairs
bottom_headline: To read more details

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: A 2019 video of DMK leader Dayanidhi Maran’s speech has pitted Opposition INDIA bloc parties against each other. The viral video showed Maran saying that people who learnt only Hindi in Bihar and Uttar Pradesh were engaged in menial jobs like cleaning toilets in Tamil Nadu. He was speaking against the imposition of Hindi at a party meeting.
Title: Dayanidhi's 2019 anti-Hindi speech riles INDIA bloc parties
bottom_headline: The controversial statement is from June 2019
bottom_text: Tap here to watch the video

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: A CCTV footage showing two thieves coming to a temple on a horse in UP's Kanpur and attempting to uproot the donation box of the temple surfaced. In the video, one thief can be seen sitting on horse, while the other attempts to steal donation box. Locals rushed to the spot hearing commotion following which the thieves fled the spot.
Title: Thieves arrive at temple on horse, attempt to steal donation box in UP; video surfaces
bottom_headline: No formal complaint registered yet: Police

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: Bengaluru is witnessing a wave-like situation, wastewater surveillance revealed. The positivity rate of SARS-CoV-2 from wastewater samples from 26 sewage treatment plants between 11 and 22 December was around 96 percent. The SARS-CoV-2 copies per ml which were 2,000 between 10 and 15 December, increased to over 3,000. In some South Bengaluru areas, viral load is more than 30,000 copies.
Title: Bengaluru wastewater tests reveal wave-like Covid situation
bottom_headline: More information about how it works

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: Uttar Pradesh Police have arrested a school van driver who allegedly raped a 12-year-old Class 6 girl inside his vehicle on the way to school in Kanpur on Friday morning, officials said. He later picked up other students from their houses. Police have also booked the school principal, manager and two teachers for allegedly trying to conceal the rape incident.
Title: Driver rapes Class 6 girl in school van in UP
bottom_headline: Girl's parents are speech and hearing impaired

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: A 35-year-old man allegedly killed a 65-year-old woman in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, police said. An argument ensued between them after the woman's dog allegedly barked at the man continuously while he was going home after closing his shop. The man allegedly kicked the woman in her abdomen and she fell on road, following which she died at a hospital.
Title: Dog barks at MP man, he kills 65-yr-old female owner amid argument
bottom_headline: Case of murder has been registered

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: The BRS is gearing up for a comeback in the upcoming Lok Sabha elections. Having reviewed the Assembly election results, the party is recalibrating its strategy for the polls. It plans to capitalise on instances of the Congress government faltering in implementing its six guarantees. A higher vote stare in the Assembly polls, too, has made the party optimistic.
Title: BRS gears up for Lok Sabha electoral battle
bottom_headline: KTR releases BRS’ ‘Swedha Patram’

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: Karnataka BJP has a whole new team of office-bearers to help the party prepare for the electoral battle. State BJP president BY Vijayendra, on Saturday, appointed state-level office-bearers, including 10 vice-presidents. While in Delhi attending the two-day BJP national office-bearers meeting, Vijayendra was hopeful of getting the high command's clearance for the new team.
Title: Vijayendra revamps Karnataka BJP unit
bottom_headline: Vijayendra appointed 10 vice-presidents

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: The Cyberabad Police Commissionerate recorded a quantum jump in money lost in cybercrime cases registered in 2023, while pegging the total reported loss at ₹232.34 crore. The police said 2023 saw a year-on-year increase of 248.52 percent in money lost to cyber fraudsters. The recovery rate, too, was higher in 2023, with the police taking back more than ₹46 crore.
Title: Cyberabad loses ₹232.34 crore to cybercriminals
bottom_headline: 5,342 cases in the current calendar year

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin ordered cash assistance ranging between ₹7,500 and ₹12,500 to 9,001 families affected by the oil spill in north Chennai. He also directed authorities to disburse ₹10,000 to each of the 787 affected boats. Due to Cyclone Michaung-triggered rains and floods, oil spillage surfaced in the Kosasthalaiyar River.  The oil spill affected 9,001 families.
Title: Oil spill: TN CM Stalin announces ₹8.68 crore aid
bottom_headline: CM directed to issue ₹10,000 to affected boats.

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: Political strategist-turned-politician Prashanth Kishor visited Vijayawada along with TDP scion Nara Lokesh and met party chief N Chandrababu Naidu on Saturday. The former I-PAC advisor was a strategist to YSRCP's Jagan Mohan Reddy during the last elections. I-PAC clarified on X that it will continue to work with the YSRCP for the upcoming elections.
Title: Ahead of Andhra polls Prashant Kishor meets Chandrababu Naidu
bottom_headline: The meeting gained political significance

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: Wrestler Bajrang Punia said government took the "right decision" by suspending the newly-elected Wrestling Federation of India (WFI). He said he'd take his Padma Shri back 'if government keeps Brij Bhushan and his aides away' from WFI. Punia had left the honour on a footpath near Delhi's Kartavya Path after he was stopped from returning it to PM Narendra Modi.
Title: Will take Padma Shri back if Brij Bhushan & his aides are kept away: Punia
bottom_headline: Trolls are calling us 'desh drohi': Punia

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A clerk working at the Chief Medical Officer's office in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia has been suspended after he allotted duty to a deceased employee during Governor Anandiben Patel's visit. The Chief Medical Officer said that the clerk also did not assign someone to test the food meant to be served during the event. Disciplinary action has been initiated against him.
Title: Dead employee assigned duty for Guv Anandiben's visit in UP, clerk suspended
bottom_headline: Patel had visited Ballia on November 26

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: A 34-year-old Bengaluru-based Keralite ran barefoot on streets of Dubai to raise awareness about climate change. Ultramarathon runner Aakash Nambiar, also known as 'Barefoot Mallu', covered 104 km in 17 hours and 20 minutes. His journey started from Love Lake and ended at Burj Khalifa at around midnight. He said he ran barefoot except for "last few stretches at night".
Title: 34-year-old Indian man runs 104 km barefoot in Dubai in 17 hours
bottom_headline: 'Why Dubai? Because COP28 just got over here'

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: The 1998 batch of IIT-Bombay has donated record ₹57 crore to the institution. More than 200 alumni contributed to this fund, which will be used to create hostels, set up a new AI lab, and to give scholarships. This is the highest combined contribution by a single class, breaking the previous record of ₹41 crore set by Class of 1971.
Title: IIT-Bombay gets ₹57 crore from Class of 1998, highest-ever by a single class
bottom_headline: Top global executives contributed to the fund
bottom_text: Tap here to know more about them

Author: Anmol Sharma
Content: IMD has issued dense to very dense fog warning for several states for next few days. It's very likely over Punjab and Haryana from December 25 to 28. It's likely over Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh on December 25 and 26. Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura may witness dense to very dense fog from December 26 to 28.
Title: Dense to very dense fog warning issued for several states, list released
bottom_headline: To view the full bulletin issued by IMD

Author: Swarna Srikanth
Content: Gone are the days when people believed that parties were boring without alcohol. These days, people continue to say cheers and chug a beer, however, to celebrate sober. There's a twist in the drinking trend that you need to know about. It's about people wanting to sip and dance with wine and whiskey but in a non-alcoholic way.
Title: Non-alcoholic beer, wine & mocktails set Gen Z party trend
bottom_headline: Here's what mixologists & tipplers say

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: The Haryana Police on Friday filed a case against Sameena Dalwai, a professor at privately-run OP Jindal Global University after she exhibited dating profiles of female students in class. In the complaint, the Haryana State Commission for Women Renu Bhatia accused her of outraging the modesty of students. The incident happened in September and no one has been arrested.
Title: Professor shows dating profiles of female students in class in Haryana, booked
bottom_headline: Bhatia visited campus in Nov over the incident

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: IIT Kanpur Dean of Students Affairs Sameer Khandekar was delivering a lecture on good health when he collapsed on the stage and passed away of a cardiac arrest on December 22, reports said. Professor Khandekar's final words were, "Take care of your health", Hindustan Times reported, citing people present there. He had reportedly been battling health issues since 2019.
Title: 'Take care of your health,' said IIT Kanpur professor moments before collapsing, dying
bottom_headline: 'We mourn the loss of a humble soul'
bottom_text: IIT Kanpur said on Khandekar's demise

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: Indian wrestler Sakshee Malikkh has reacted to the suspension of the newly elected WFI body, saying she hadn't seen anything in writing yet. "This has happened for the betterment of the wrestlers. We had been saying this was the fight of daughters and sisters," she said. Sakshee had announced her retirement from wrestling after Sanjay Singh was appointed WFI chief.
Title: Haven't seen anything in writing: Sakshee on WFI's suspension
bottom_headline: 'Have nothing to do with newly elected WFI body'
bottom_text: My focus is on 2024 LS polls: Brij Bhushan Singh

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: Younger brother of retired SSP Mohd Shafi who was shot dead while he was praying at a mosque in Baramulla said that Shafi was a regular at mosque for Aazan. "This morning, Shafi stopped suddenly in between his call for Aazan. At first, we thought microphone had stopped working. However, later we learnt....he had been fatally shot," Shafi's brother said.
Title: He stopped in between his Aazan call: Kin of ex-SSP shot in J&K
bottom_headline: 'Heard loud noise between Aazan call'
bottom_text: Tap to know what else the family members said

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra has shared latest pictures of the Ram Mandir site in Ayodhya on Sunday and wrote, "Pictures taken this morning at Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Mandir site." Ram Mandir's 'Pran Pratishtha' is scheduled to be held on January 22 and several dignitaries from across the country have been invited for it.
Title: Latest pics of Ram Mandir site released
bottom_headline: For more information

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: Former WFI chief Brij Bhushan Singh on Sunday said that he has nothing to do with the new WFI body. His remark came after the Sports Ministry suspended the new WFI body following the appointment of Sanjay Singh as its new chief. Brij added that he had shifted his focus to preparing for the 2024 Lok Sabha polls.
Title: Have nothing to do with new body: Brij as new WFI body suspended
bottom_headline: 'I have taken retirement from wrestling'
bottom_text: Tap to read what Brij said

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: BJP MLA Bhavya Bishnoi took to Instagram to share pictures after he married Gangtok Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM) Pari Bishnoi in Rajasthan's Udaipur on December 22. Bhavya is BJP leader Kuldeep Bishnoi's son and former Haryana CM Bhajan Lal's grandson. He is a lawmaker from Haryana's Adampur Assembly constituency while Pari is a Sikkim cadre IAS officer.
Title: BJP MLA Bhavya Bishnoi & IAS officer Pari Bishnoi get married, share pics
bottom_headline: Couple to have 3 wedding receptions

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: A video shared by Indian Express on Sunday showed a massive traffic jam on the Bengaluru-Mysuru Expressway near the toll plaza just before Christmas. The video purportedly shows dozens of cars moving slowly. "The traffic jam was because many headed towards Kerala...for Christmas and New Year celebrations," a local reportedly said. A massive jam was reported in Manali too.
Title: Video showing massive jam on B'luru-Mysuru Expressway before Christmas surfaces
bottom_headline: To watch the spot visuals

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: Visuals showing hundreds of cars stuck in traffic jam in Himachal Pradesh's Manali on Christmas eve have surfaced on social media. Long queues of cars amid slow vehicular movement could be seen in videos from the region. Several people on social media also complained of similar traffic congestion in other hill stations as well.
Title: Pics show hundreds of cars stuck in traffic jam in Manali on Christmas eve
bottom_headline: To watch the video of traffic congestion

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Congress leader and ex-state minister Sunil Kedar has been disqualified as Maharashtra MLA after being convicted in the ₹150-crore Nagpur District Central Cooperative Bank (NDCCB) scam case. Kedar has been sentenced to five years of rigorous imprisonment and ₹10-lakh fine has been imposed on him. Five other people were given same punishment in the case which dates back to 2002.
Title: Kedar loses Maha MLA post after conviction in ₹150-crore bank scam
bottom_headline: Court acquitted three people

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: West Bengal Minister Bratya Basu on Saturday accused Governor CV Ananda Bose of destroying the higher education ambience in the state. Basu's remark comes after Governor Bose removed Jadavpur University officiating vice-chancellor Buddhadeb Sau from his post on disciplinary grounds. Bose announced VC's removal on the eve of the annual convocation event of Jadavpur University.
Title: Guv destroying higher education ambience: WB Minister on JU VC removal
bottom_headline: 'He has stooped to new low'
bottom_text: Tap to know what else the Bengal Minister said

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: A team of Election Commission of India officers on Saturday reviewed Andhra Pradesh's preparedness for next year’s elections and directed officials to ensure that the electoral rolls are free of any errors and maintain transparency while conducting polls. The officers told the district officials to be ready to conduct elections without errors or untoward incidents, an official release said.
Title: ECI officials review Andhra's poll preparedness
bottom_headline: Naidu takes his fight on AP voters’ list to ECI

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: The Kerala Police have registered a case against state Congress chief K Sudhakaran, Opposition leader VD Satheesan, and senior party leaders in connection with the violence in Thiruvananthapuram on Saturday, during the party’s march to the DGP office. A separate case was registered against two security personnel of CM Pinarayi Vijayan for allegedly assaulting Youth Congress workers in Alappuzha.
Title: Kerala violence: Police book Cong leaders, CM's security officers
bottom_headline: Kerala CM justifies police booking journalist

Author: Disha Jana
Content: The 303 passengers, mostly Indians, of a plane detained by French authorities are set to appear before a judge on Sunday to decide on their continued detention. The passengers, who are staying at Marne's Vatry airport, were de-boarded there for suspected human trafficking on Thursday. The plane had taken off from Dubai and was headed to Nicaragua.
Title: France court to decide on stay of grounded passengers including Indians
bottom_headline: For more information

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: Kerala Congress (B) leader KB Ganesh Kumar and Congress (S) state president Kadannappalli Ramachandran will replace Antony Raju and Ahmed Devarkovil in Pinarayi Vijayan Cabinet. Transport Minister Raju and Ports Minister Devarkovil tendered their resignations at a Cabinet meeting on Sunday. The reshuffle is part of a 2021 post-poll agreement within the ruling LDF.
Title: Two Kerala ministers resign, Cabinet reshuffle soon
bottom_headline: Congress leaders, CM’s security personnel booked

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: After the Sports Ministry suspended Sanjay Singh-led Wrestling Federation of India, former WFI chief and BJP MP Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh said he has taken sanyas (retirement) from wrestling, adding, "Lok Sabha elections are coming and I'll have a lot of work." Sexual harassment accused Brij Bhushan's aide Sanjay Singh was recently elected as the WFI chief.
Title: I've retired from wrestling, working for LS polls: BJP MP Brij Bhushan after WFI's suspension
bottom_headline: Sakshee Malikkh quit after Sanjay Singh's win

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: Amid criticism of a delay in the heavy rainfall forecast, the Chennai Regional Meteorological Centre said it has world-class equipment and its warning prevented a huge loss of lives. Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin and a host of DMK leaders earlier claimed that the IMD's failure to predict the rainfall accurately led to severe flooding.
Title: Chennai Met centre says its forecast saved lives
bottom_headline: Sitharaman insulted TN people, says DMK

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: Activists of the pro-Kannada organisation Karnataka Rakshana Vedike were caught abusing non-Kannadiga traders for having signboards of their businesses in English or Hindi. The abusive language was used during a campaign demanding boards to dedicate 65% of its space to Kannada. Vedike's Chickpete president R Thyagaraj justified it saying the traders were ignoring their request for years.
Title: Pro-Kannada activists abuse non-Kannadiga traders during campaign
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: News Desk
Content: The TSRTC has invited tenders for commercial contracts such as fuel outlets, parking lots, and logistic services at various locations in Telangana. Interested parties can view the details on the TSRTC website and participate in the tender process. The move is part of the corporation's efforts to appoint contractors for a range of services at different locations in the region.
Title: Want to run canteens, stalls at Telangana bus stations? Here’s how
bottom_headline: To read the full story

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: On Sunday, BJP's Mysuru MP Mysuru Pratap Simha invoked goddesses Chamundeshwari and Cauvery, saying people would decide whether he was a patriot or traitor in the 2024 polls. He was under fire for issuing passes to two men, who breached Parliament security on 13 December. Simha refrained from divulging the details of the incident and the ongoing probe.
Title: People will decide if I am a traitor, says Pratap Simha
bottom_headline: HC stays order to give FIR copy to accused

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: Amid protests by sportspersons and citizens, the Sports Ministry on Sunday suspended the Wrestling Federation of India till further orders after the newly-elected body hastily announced the U-15 and U-20 nationals without following due procedure and not giving sufficient notice to wrestlers for preparations. The protests were over the election of the pro-Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh panel.
Title: Days after election, Sports Ministry suspends WFI
bottom_headline: Virender Singh to return Padma Shri

Author: News Desk
Content: The AICC has appointed former Union minister Deepa Dasmunsi as its party's charge for Telangana, replacing senior leader Manikrao Thakare in that role. She will also handle Kerala and Lakshadweep along with this additional role for Telangana. The move is seen as part of the preparations of the grand old party for the upcoming Lok Sabha elections in 2024.
Title: Ahead of LS polls, Deepa Dasmunsi made Congress Telangana incharge
bottom_headline: To read the full story

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: Veteran Congress leader Avinash Pande, who replaced Priyanka Gandhi Vadra as the general secretary in-charge of Uttar Pradesh, had been serving as Congress' in-charge for Jharkhand. The 65-year-old leader was a member of the Congress Working Committee. Pande is from Nagpur and has served as a Rajya Sabha MP from Maharashtra from 2010 to 2016.
Title: Who is Avinash Pande, Congress' new UP in-charge to replace Priyanka Gandhi?
bottom_headline: He began his career with Congress' student wing

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: Twenty-five Indians are present on the oil tanker that was attacked by a Houthi one-way attack drone in the Red Sea, Indian Navy officials said on Sunday. All the crew members are safe, they said, adding that the vessel was Gabon-flagged and not Indian-flagged. The US military said the attack took place on December 23.
Title: 25 Indians are on board oil tanker attacked by drone in Red Sea: Navy officials
bottom_headline: Houthi drones also attacked Norwegian oil tanker

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: The India Meteorological Department has released minimum temperature of cities in north west India on Sunday. While Punjab's Amritsar recorded minimum temperature of 6.2°C, Haryana's Hisar recorded 6.5°C, Delhi's Safdarjung recorded 7.6°C and Chandigarh recorded 8.1°C. UP's Meerut, MP's Gwalior, Rajasthan's Churu recorded 7.3°C, 7.5°C and 7.3°C, respectively.
Title: Which are the coldest places in north west India today?
bottom_headline: Indore recorded min temperature of 8.6°C

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: While upholding divorce granted to a couple on the grounds of cruelty by wife, the Delhi High Court said the man was "publicly harassed, humiliated and verbally attacked by his wife". Terming her behaviour as "extreme cruelty", High Court said his wife left "no stone unturned to portray him as a womaniser" at his workplace.
Title: Humiliating husband publicly, calling him womaniser is extreme cruelty: Delhi HC
bottom_headline: 'Successful marriage built on mutual respect'
bottom_text: Tap to know what more the High Court said

Author: Swarna Srikanth
Content: Curly Tales Founder Kamiya Jani responded to the controversy that broke out after she posted a video from her Puri Jagannath visit. She clarified on claim about her promoting beef. "I have broken no rules of temple. I am a Hindu who has neither consumed beef nor promoted it." BJP leader Jatin Mohanty earlier condemned her visit and demanded arrest.
Title: Kamiya Jani Eats Beef? Clarification On Temple Visit Controversy
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: Before the government suspended the Wrestling Federation of India, wrestler Sakshee Malikkh had said she was worried about female junior wrestlers after they called her to inform her that junior nationals would be held in Gonda. "Gonda is...stronghold of ex-WFI chief Brij Bhushan. Now imagine what kind of atmosphere the junior women wrestlers will be competing in," she added.
Title: Worried about female junior wrestlers: Sakshee Malikkh before govt suspended WFI
bottom_headline: Malikkh quit wrestling over Brij's aide election

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: Infosys' former CFO TV Mohandas Pai shared a social media post saying there is a need to install signboards in Kannada and Malayalam as well at Ayodhya's Ram Mandir. His reaction came after reports said that the temple authorities have installed signages in Telugu and Tamil for the sake of devotees who come from these southern states.
Title: Need Kannada, Malayalam signages too at Ram Mandir: Infosys ex-CFO
bottom_headline: Mohandas Pai tagged UP CM in his post

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A 23-year-old pregnant woman was killed and her four-year-old son was critical due to gas leak from a geyser in their house in Bengaluru. Her husband found the door locked when he came home. He heard the water flowing in bathroom and found his wife and son collapsed. He rushed them to a hospital, where the woman was declared dead.
Title: Pregnant woman dies, 4-year-old son critical as geyser gas leaks in Bengaluru
bottom_headline: A couple died in the similar incident in June

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: A man called Suresh was arrested in MP's Ratlam for allegedly setting his sister-in-law on fire, killing her, police said. Suresh blamed the victim, identified as 33-year-old Nirmala, for his younger brother Prakash's death by suicide, officials said. Nirmala's brother said Suresh called him and said, "We have set your sister on fire."
Title: 'We set her on fire,' man tells family of sister-in-law after burning her to death in MP
bottom_headline: Suresh beat Nirmala before setting her afire

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: Reacting to reports that Sports Ministry suspended newly-elected Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) body, Sanjay Singh, who recently won WFI polls, said that he was in flight and had not received any letter yet.  "First, let me see the letter...I heard that some activity has been stopped," he added. Singh is a close associate of WFI's ex-chief Brij Bhushan Singh.
Title: Haven't received any letter yet: Sanjay Singh on WFI's suspension
bottom_headline: He was elected on December 21

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma stated that unlike Pakistan, the Constitution of India has been written by those who believed in Vedas, Upanishads and Bhagavad Gita. These scriptures are the basis of the "secular" Constitution, he added while speaking at the International Gita Mahotsav in Haryana's Kurukshetra. Bhagavad Gita teaches people how to become a complete human being, he stated.
Title: Hindus who believed in Vedas, Gita wrote Constitution: Assam CM
bottom_headline: 'Work is worship'
bottom_text: This is what Bhagavad Gita teaches us: Sarma

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: Kerala has the highest number of active cases of COVID-19 at 3,000, followed by Karnataka (271), Tamil Nadu (123), Maharashtra (103) and Odisha (55). Gujarat (54), Telangana (38), Goa (32), Puducherry (24) and Delhi (24) are among the top 10 states with highest active infections, Health Ministry data on Sunday showed. India recorded 656 new infections in 24 hours.
Title: Which states have highest active COVID-19 cases as India records 656 new infections?
bottom_headline: Several states have no active cases
bottom_text: Tap to find list of such states

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: The Pentagon has said that an Iranian drone struck a chemical tanker in the Indian Ocean. An India-bound merchant vessel, MV Chem Pluto, with 20 Indian and one Vietnamese crew member on Saturday caught fire after it was attacked by a suspected drone. It was later secured by the Indian Coast Guard (ICG), the ICG said in an official statement.
Title: Pentagon says Iranian drone struck chemical tanker
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: After an Israel-linked merchant ship was attacked in Indian Ocean, officials said the Indian Navy is investigating whether the drone used in the attack was launched from long range or from a nearby vessel. MV Chem Pluto was carrying crude oil with around 20 Indian crew members when it was attacked. The USA claimed the drone was fired from Iran.
Title: Probing where drone was launched from: Navy on Indian Ocean attack
bottom_headline: Ship was destined for a port in Karnataka
bottom_text: INS Mormugao ascertained details of attack: Navy

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: EAM S Jaishankar expressed deep sorrow over the demise of Ambassador Hans Dannenberg of the Dominican Republic. Taking to X, Jaishankar conveyed his condolences, highlighting Dannenberg’s exceptional friendship with India and many individuals personally. "Deeply grieved to learn of the passing away of Ambassador Hans Dannenberg of the Dominican Republic," he added.
Title: EAM Jaishankar condoles demise of Dominican Republic’s ambassador
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: A video purportedly showed newly-elected BJP MLA Lalaram Bairwa threatening a female officer over an anti-encroachment drive in Rajasthan. He purportedly told Sub-Divisional Magistrate Neha Chhipa, "Nayi-nayi naukri hai, aapko takleef ho jaayegi, main phir keh raha hu (I'm warning you, you'll have problem in your job)." Claiming that she was "arguing" with him, Lalaram said, "Don't argue with me."
Title: I'm warning you, you'll have problem in job: BJP MLA to SDM in Raj
bottom_headline: 'Were you asked when encroachment was done?'

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: After US Central Command said that an Indian-flagged tanker was hit by a drone in the Red Sea, Indian officials clarified that the vessel was not Indian-flagged. They said MV Saibaba is a Gabon-flagged vessel and had received a certification from the Indian register of shipping. It carried nearly 25 Indian crew members, who are safe, officials added.
Title: Tanker attacked by drone in Red Sea is not an Indian-flagged vessel: Officials
bottom_headline: Drone was fired from Houthi areas of Yemen: US

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: Influencer Kamiya Jani said she visited the Jagannath Temple to seek blessings and highlight the infrastructure works being undertaken there. She also said as a practising Hindu, she never ate beef. Earlier, BJP called her a "beef promoter" and demanded her arrest. "I tell about...local cuisine...and that's what happened in Kerala video from where the screenshots were used," she added.
Title: I am a Hindu, visited Jagannath Temple to seek blessings: Influencer Kamiya amid row
bottom_headline: Have not violated any rules: Jani

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: While suspending the newly-formed Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) under Sanjay Singh, Sports Ministry said it's seemingly "in complete control of former office bearers in complete disregard to the Sports Code". WFI is being run from premises controlled by ex-officials, it said, adding that they're the same premises where wrestlers were allegedly sexually harassed by ex-chief Brij Bhushan.
Title: New WFI under 'complete control' of ex-officials: Govt on suspending wrestling body
bottom_headline: 'National championships announced hastily'

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: BJP MP Pratap Simha, in whose name visitor passes were issued to Lok Sabha intruders, said that people will ultimately decide whether he was a patriot or a traitor during the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "Not wanting to divulge anything regarding the incident and probe," he said, adding that he will leave the decision to gods and his reader fans.
Title: People will decide whether I'm patriot or traitor: BJP MP Simha
bottom_headline: 'People of Mysuru have seen my work for 9.5 yrs'
bottom_text: Tap to know what else he said

Author: Farida
Content: A political controversy arose earlier this week when YouTuber Kamiya Jani visited the Jagannath Temple in Puri, leading to accusations by the BJP against the state government for allegedly facilitating the entry of a beef consumption promoter. Jani, in response, issued a clarification asserting her identity as a practicing Hindu who has never consumed or promoted beef.
Title: YouTuber Denies Beef Link in Temple Visit
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: Sports Ministry on Sunday suspended the newly-elected Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) body led by Sanjay Singh until further orders. The announcement came after Singh announced that the U-15 and U-20 nationals will take place in UP's Gonda before the end of this year, reported ANI. Singh, a close associate of Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, was elected on December 21.
Title: Sports Ministry suspends newly-elected Wrestling Federation of India
bottom_headline: Sakshee quit wrestling after Sanjay Singh won

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: India has recorded 656 new COVID-19 cases and one related death in the last 24 hours, government data showed on Sunday. Of these, 128 cases were reported from Kerala, while Karnataka recorded 96 new infections. The total active COVID-19 cases have risen to 3,742, Health Ministry data showed.
Title: India records 656 new COVID-19 cases & 1 death in 24 hours
bottom_headline: India recorded 752 new infections on Saturday
bottom_text: It marked a seven-month high in single-day cases

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: Speaking about COVID-19 JN.1 variant, AIIMS ex-Director Dr Randeep Guleria said that we need a vaccine which covers a broader type of the virus. "We have had multiple mutations. Jn.1 is sub-lineage of Omicron," Guleria said, adding that vaccine made against Omicron will be effective against JN.1 variant. He further said that JN.1 variant isn't causing severe infections or hospitalisations.
Title: Need vaccine which covers broader type of virus: AIIMS ex-Director
bottom_headline: 'Variant specific vaccine not needed'
bottom_text: Tap to watch what else Dr Randeep Guleria said

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar has invited Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge to his official residence in Delhi on December 25 (Christmas) for interaction. In a letter to Kharge, Dhankhar said Opposition MPs deliberately created disorder in Parliament. He wrote, "Painfully I had to suffer in the House your stance 'rejecting' my offer for interaction." He added, "We need to move ahead."
Title: VP invites Kharge to his home on Xmas, says 'Need to move ahead'
bottom_headline: 'I am willing to engage in a meeting with you'
bottom_text: Kharge wrote in a letter to VP earlier

Author: Farida
Content: In a tragic incident, terrorists targeted and fatally shot retired Senior Superintendent of Police Mohammed Shafi Mir while he was praying at a mosque in Baramulla, Jammu and Kashmir. Mir, a resident of Gantamulla Bala village in Baramulla, fell victim to the assailants during the Azan at the mosque.
Title: Terrorists Gun Down Retired Police Officer at Baramulla Mosque
bottom_headline: Terrorists Kill Ex-SSP Mir in Mosque Attack

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: As per Ministry of Health data, Kerala saw a rise of 128 COVID-19 cases since yesterday, which took its active cases tally to 3,000. Karnataka's cases rose by 96, Tamil Nadu's by 6 and Maharashtra's by 35. In Delhi, Gujarat, Rajasthan and Telangana, active cases rose by 16, 10, 1 and 11 respectively.
Title: Which states saw an increase in COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours?
bottom_headline: Punjab saw a decrease in cases
bottom_text: Tap to see the full list

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: At least one person died and eight others were injured as several vehicles got sandwiched between two Bus Rapid Transit System (BRTS) buses on Saturday evening, police said. "A bus with four two-wheelers behind it applied brakes, and then another BRTS bus, which was behind the two-wheelers, rammed into them," DCP Pinakin Parmar said.
Title: 1 dead, 8 hurt after vehicles get trapped between 2 buses in Surat
bottom_headline: One of the driver was detained

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: A retired police officer, Mohd Shafi, was shot dead while he was praying at a mosque in Baramulla, the Kashmir Zone Police said on Sunday. The incident happened during the Azaan. "The area has been cordoned off...Further details are awaited," police said. Earlier this week, four soldiers were martyred when heavily armed terrorists ambushed two Army vehicles in Poonch.
Title: Retired police officer shot dead by terrorists while praying at J&K mosque
bottom_headline: To know more details

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Liquor shops will remain open from 10 am to 11 pm on Christmas Eve (December 24) and New Year's Eve (December 31) across Uttar Pradesh, the state Excise Department said. All authorised liquor outlets in the state usually close by 10 pm. The state government has asserted that the liquor "sale time extension" would only be for defined occasions.
Title: Liquor shops to remain open till 11 pm on Xmas eve & Dec 31 in UP
bottom_headline: To know more

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: COVID-19 JN.1 variant is "more transmissible" and is "spreading more rapidly, and gradually becoming a dominant variant", former AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria said. "It's causing more infections but the data also suggests that it is not causing severe infections or hospitalisations," he said. INSACOG chief Dr NK Arora, meanwhile, said no additional vaccine dose is needed against JN.1 yet.
Title: JN.1 COVID-19 variant spreading quickly, not causing severe infections: AIIMS ex-Director
bottom_headline: 'Older comorbid people need to be cautious'
bottom_text: Tap to know what more Arora said

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said billionaire Gautam Adani sent a ₹25-crore cheque for construction of a technology centre in Pune district's Baramati. "I must take Adani's name and thank him," Pawar said after inaugurating robotic lab in Vidya Pratishthan. He also thanked industrialist Vijay Shirke for donating ₹10 crore. Pawar said after he urged the two "colleagues", both offered assistance.
Title: Adani sent ₹25-crore cheque for tech centre in Pune: Sharad Pawar
bottom_headline: 'We are building this project now'
bottom_text: Tap to know what more Pawar said

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: A Gabon-owned and Indian-flagged crude oil tanker, M/V SAIBABA, was hit by a one-way attack drone in the Southern Red Sea, the US Central Command posted on X (formerly Twitter), adding that no injuries were reported. The drone was fired from Houthi-controlled areas of Yemen. This comes after a drone hit an Israel-linked ship near the Indian Coast on Saturday.
Title: Indian-flagged tanker hit by drone in Red Sea: US
bottom_headline: Iran behind attack on Israel-linked vessel: US

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: The US on Saturday condemned the vandalism of the Shri Swaminarayan temple in California, even as the police called it a "targeted act". "We welcome efforts by the Newark Police Department to ensure that those responsible are held accountable," said the US State Department's Bureau of South and Central Asian Affairs. Pro-Khalistani slogans were found written on the temple's walls.
Title: We condemn the vandalism of Hindu temple in California: US
bottom_headline: 'Our Consulate has filed a complaint'
bottom_text: S Jaishankar said on the vandalism

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: Three men who were picked by security forces for interrogation in connection to the ambush of two Army vehicles were found dead in J&K's Poonch. Subsequently, the Army said the matter is being investigated while adding, "Army stands committed to extending full support and cooperation in the conduct of investigations." Separately, the J&K government announced compensation for the victims' families.
Title: 3 civilians picked for interrogation found dead in J&K, Army says 'matter being probed'
bottom_headline: 4 soldiers were martyred in the ambush

Author: Farida
Content: A fire broke out on Saturday night inside a shopping mall in Tallakulam, Madurai, Tamil Nadu, causing panic among visitors. The incident occurred on the fourth floor, near the food court area.Fire and Rescue Services personnel promptly responded to an emergency call, deploying four fire tenders to extinguish the flames. A mechanical pump was utilized to disperse the smoke.
Title: Tamil Nadu Complex Fire, Emergency Exits Ensure Safe Rescue
bottom_headline: Mall Fire Evacuation; Boat Blaze Tragedy

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: The US said a drone fired from Iran hit an Israel-linked chemical tanker in the Indian Ocean on Saturday. The vessel carried 20 Indians. "The motor vessel CHEM PLUTO, a Liberia-flagged, Japanese-owned, and Netherlands-operated...tanker was struck...by a one-way attack drone fired from Iran," Pentagon said. Iran has publicly criticised Israel's actions in Gaza launched after Hamas' October attack.
Title: Drone fired from Iran hit merchant ship near Indian coast: US
bottom_headline: US said this is 7th Iranian attack since 2021

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: A prominent Hindu temple was vandalised with anti-India graffiti in the US state of California and police are investigating the matter as a possible hate crime. The Police of Newark, California said on Friday at approximately 8:35 am, they received a report of graffiti at the Shri Swaminarayan Mandir Hindu Temple. The probe’s for a possible hate crime, they said.
Title: Hindu temple vandalised with anti-India graffiti in US
bottom_headline: NIA cracks down on Khalistani terrorist

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: The Congress has constituted its Manifesto Committee for the 2024 Lok Sabha polls with former Union Minister P Chidambaram as its chairman. Former Chhattisgarh deputy CM TS Singh Deo is Convenor. The 16-member panel includes Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra. Anand Sharma, Jairam Ramesh and Shashi Tharoor are also in the committee.
Title: Siddaramaiah in Chidambaram-led Congress Manifesto Committee
bottom_headline: Congress gets into poll mode

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: A day after Olympic gold medalist Bajrang Punia returned the Padma Shri, Deaflympics gold medallist Virender Singh Yadav, better known as Goonga Pehelwan, has decided to return his Padma Shri to the government, in solidarity with the country’s top wrestlers. The awards were returned protesting the election of Sanjay Singh, a Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh loyalist, as president of WFI.
Title: Deaflympics gold medallist Virender Singh returns Padma Shri
bottom_headline: Why Sakshi Malik quits wrestling

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: An India-bound merchant vessel MV Chem Pluto with 20 Indian and one Vietnamese crew member caught fire. It was attacked by a suspected drone and was later secured by the Indian Coast Guard. The merchant vessel reportedly commenced its voyage from the UAE on Dec19 and was bound for New Mangalore port with an arrival date of Dec 25.
Title: ICG responds as drone strikes India-bound merchant vessel
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: Security forces have been deployed in the Bafliaz area of Poonch district as search operations are underway to nab terrorists in the forest area in the Rajouri sector. The Indian Army is conducting an inquiry into the deaths of three civilians in the Poonch-Rajouri sector. Militants launched an attack on army personnel on Dec 21 killing four soldiers.
Title: J-K: Security forces deployed in Poonch
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A video of a train passing over a woman and her two children at Barh Railway Station in Bihar has surfaced online. All of them are safe. They were pushed off the platform and fell on the track when people began boarding the Delhi-bound train. In the video, the mother could be seen crouching over the children on the track.
Title: Train passes over woman & her 2 kids who fell on track in Bihar, video surfaces
bottom_headline: All of them were pulled back to the platform

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A 20-year-old student allegedly died by suicide by hanging herself in her room in Kamla Nagar and a note has been found. The woman was pursuing graduation from Delhi University and lived with her mother. The student's mother works with the IB after her husband died by suicide around five years ago.
Title: 20-year-old Delhi University student dies by suicide, note found
bottom_headline: The body has been handed over to her family

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: Dr. Sameer Khandekar, a professor of mechanical engineering at IIT-Kanpur, died on stage while delivering a speech on Friday. He reportedly suffered a heart attack and collapsed while urging people to take care of their health. "We mourn the loss of a humble soul & pray that God gives his family & friends strength to bear this loss," IIT-Kanpur said.
Title: IIT-Kanpur professor Sameer Khandekar dies on stage while delivering speech
bottom_headline: He was the Dean of Student Affairs

Author: Brijesh
Content: A 45-year-old Gujarati man named Vijay Pandey is charged with the murders of his mentally ill daughter and sick wife in the Umargam community. The tragedy started on a fateful Wednesday afternoon when they were pushed into the Varoli river, which is close to Humran village, by Pandey.
Title: Man Pushes Ailing Wife and Mentally-Ill Daughter into River
bottom_headline: Pandey reportedly confessed to his heinous crime

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: Pictures showing a merchant ship after it was attacked by drone near the Indian coast on Saturday have surfaced. The vessel MV Chem Pluto, carrying crude oil, was going towards Mangaluru from a port in Saudi Arabia. The drone strike caused an explosion and fire on the merchant ship with around 20 Indian crew members, but no casualties were reported.
Title: Pics show ship after it was attacked by drone near Indian coast
bottom_headline: 'MV Chem Pluto to reach Mumbai by December 25'
bottom_text: ANI said quoting Indian Coast Guard officials

Author: Anmol Sharma
Content: A video surfaced online wherein DMK MP Dayanidhi Maran said people from UP and Bihar who know only Hindi migrate & clean roads and toilets in Tamil Nadu. Maran's remark came while he compared people who learn English and who only learn Hindi. "Do Nitish Kumar & Lalu Yadav agree with their...coalition partner's opinion?" BJP MP Giriraj Singh tweeted.
Title: People from UP & Bihar who know only Hindi migrate & clean roads, toilets in TN: DMK's Maran
bottom_headline: To watch the video that surfaced online

Author: Deepika Bhatt
