bottom_headline: Evaluating India's Manufacturing Leap in 2023

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: Influencer and Curly Tales Founder Kamiya Jani has said she has never eaten beef. Her clarification came after she visited Odisha's Jagannath Temple and the BJP demanded her arrest, calling her a "beef promoter". "Beef-eaters are strictly not allowed inside Jagannath temple," BJP said. "I've been visiting all the Jyotirlingas and char dham...and what a privilege it's been," Jani wrote.
Title: Have never eaten beef: Influencer Kamiya as BJP demands her arrest over Jagannath visit
bottom_headline: 'Strange' article questioned my Jagannath visit

Author: Ashley Paul
Content: A car collided with a truck in Telangana's Hanumakonda in the early hours of Friday, killing four people. Police said the truck, which was coming from the opposite direction, hit the car and led to three other people inside the car suffering injuries. The deceased were in the 16-72 age group.
Title: 4 people killed in car-truck collision in T'gana, video surfaces
bottom_headline: A video showed the car completely crushed

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: Several women caterers at a private birthday party in Uttar Pradesh were misbehaved with on Wednesday night, as some men harassed and physically assaulted them. The incident took place in a farmhouse in Kanpur, where the men forced the female caterers to dance with them and when their offer was refused, began ripping off their clothes and recording lewd videos.
Title: Kanpur assault case shows women business owners have a harder path
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Dharini Mudgal
Content: A 40-year-old Indian national in Singapore has been sentenced to 10 months in jail for recklessly driving a lorry and causing the death of an elderly woman. During the case's hearing, Sivalingam Suresh said he was the breadwinner of his family in India, which includes his two-year-old son and wife. The incident took place in February 2023.
Title: Indian man jailed in S'pore for 'reckless driving & causing death'
bottom_headline: For more details

Author: Swarna Srikanth
Content: In an unfortunate incident reported from Jamnagar in Gujarat, a hospital caught fire after a patient admitted to the intensive care unit (ICU) lit a bidi. The man on oxygen support was purportedly unaware of the deadly consequences of lighting a flame in the presence of the flammable apparatus which eventually led to the fire accident in the healthcare.
Title: Fire accident in Gujarat hospital after patient smokes bidi inside
bottom_headline: Patient Was Suffering From Respiratory Illness

Author: Ankush Verma
Content: Government has shared a video on ten moments when India "stunned the world" in 2023. The video includes India becoming 1st nation to reach Moon's south pole, PM Narendra Modi-led yoga session at UN creating Guinness record, Air India sealing world's largest aircraft deal and India becoming world's fastest growing economy. Video also lists world's largest office building in Surat.
Title: Govt shares 10 moments when India 'stunned the world' in 2023
bottom_headline: India topped in digital payments: Govt

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: Union Minister Rajeev Chandrasekhar has gifted a laptop to a nine-year-old boy, Sriram, whom he met during a journey from Thrissur to Kozhikode on Vande Bharat Express. "I had promised him a new laptop and today he gets his New Year gift in advance," Chandrasekhar said on Thursday. A video of Sriram getting the laptop also surfaced online.
Title: Union Minister Rajeev gifts laptop to 9-yr-old boy he met on Vande Bharat train
bottom_headline: Sriram studies in Class 4

Author: Dharini Mudgal
Content: On the COVID-19 situation in the state, Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak said, "There's no need to create panic." He said, "There're one or two cases...they're being treated at their homes...The people need to be alert." Notably, a Noida resident tested COVID-19 positive in the first case of the infection in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar district after several months.
Title: People need to be alert: UP Dy CM on COVID-19 situation
bottom_headline: Noida resident had recently travelled to Nepal

Author: Ashley Paul
Content: A total of five people have been rescued after a fire broke out at an apartment in Hyderabad's Panjagutta police station limits. A video of the rescue operation shows a police official breaking the door open, after which a few men entered the apartment to save those stuck inside. No casualties have so far been reported due to the fire.
Title: 5 rescued after fire breaks out in Hyd; rescue op's video surfaces
bottom_headline: The fire was later brought under control

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: Bengaluru commuters are better off checking for violations recorded against their vehicles by AI cameras that click photos on the go. Otherwise, a Bengaluru traffic cop might come knocking someday to collect hefty fines or seize vehicles. Lists of around top violators per jurisdiction, caught on AI cameras, have already been dispatched to the respective city traffic police stations.
Title: AI cameras catch traffic offences, cops land up at your place
bottom_headline: B'luru Police to tell firms employee violations

Author: Ankush Verma
Content: India recorded 640 new cases of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, with the number of active cases climbing to 2,997, according to the latest update by Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The COVID-19 death toll has climbed to 5,33,328. The number of people who have recuperated from the disease has increased to 4,44,70,887.
Title: India records 640 new cases of COVID-19
bottom_headline: Kerala has highest number of active cases

Author: Roshne B
Content: Swarnalatha J, Coimbatore-based disability rights activist, received the National Award for the Empowerment of PwDs. Despite facing a 90% disability, she leads impactful initiatives through Swarga Foundation, promoting accessibility and rehabilitation. Her journey, marked by resilience, inspires many, reflecting a life of purpose and progress.
Title: TN's Swarnalatha gets Sarvshresth Divyangjan Award from President
bottom_headline: Para-athlete advocates for increased inclusion

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: A 40-year-old woman in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda was given triple talaq by her husband through a WhatsApp text because she refused to take 40 lakh rupees from her brother for donating one of her kidneys. She has lodged an FIR against her husband and the Police have booked him under the Muslim Women (Protection of Rights on Marriage) Act, 2019.
Title: Man gives triple talaq to wife who donated kidney to her brother
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Dharini Mudgal
Content: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MPs raised the chants of 'Jai Shree Ram' as Prime Minister Narendra Modi entered Lok Sabha on Thursday. A video of the same has surfaced online. In the video, PM Modi can be seen greeting all MPs with folded hands as he continued to make his way towards his seat in the House.
Title: MPs chant 'Jai Shree Ram' as PM Modi enters Lok Sabha, video shows
bottom_headline: To watch the video

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: Scholars of Maulana Azad National Fellowship are demanding a hike on a par with other Union government fellowships. The students also want timely disbursal of their stipends — a long-pending demand. The "existing" fellows are distressed that unlike the UGC-regulated scholarships, their stipend, which was ₹8,000 per month, had not been revised for 17 years — since 2006.
Title: MANF scholars demand long overdue stipend hike
bottom_headline: Students dismayed as Azad fellowship scrapped

Author: Dharini Mudgal
Content: Congress has thanked the Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra Trust for the invitation to the consecration ceremony of the Ram temple in Ayodhya on January 22. On being asked whether the Congress leaders would attend the ceremony, Congress leader KC Venugopal said, "You will know about the party's stand. You will know on January 22 about the participation."
Title: You'll know on Jan 22: Congress on attending Ram Mandir event
bottom_headline: Sonia Gandhi has reportedly been invited
bottom_text: Mallikarjun Kharge also got invitation: Report

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: India has invited French President Emmanuel Macron to be the chief guest at the Republic Day celebrations on January 26, PTI reported on Friday citing sources. India had invited US President Joe Biden as the chief guest but he expressed inability to travel to New Delhi in January, the report added. Notably, Macron attended the G20 Summit in September.
Title: French President Macron to be chief guest for Republic Day 2024: Report
bottom_headline: To know more details

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: The Odisha wing of BJP demanded the arrest of influencer and Curly Tales Founder Kamiya Jani after she made a video at Jagannath Temple in Puri. BJP called her a "beef promoter". "Earlier, she...posted a video eating beef...Beef-eaters are strictly not allowed inside Jagannath temple," said BJP's Jatin Mohanty. She was seen with bureaucrat-turned-BJD leader VK Pandian in the video.
Title: BJP demands arrest of influencer Kamiya Jani over Jagannath visit, says 'she promotes beef'
bottom_headline: BJD remains indifferent to Odia sentiments: BJP

Author: Ankush Verma
Content: Kerala reported the biggest jump in active COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours at 265, followed by Tamil Nadu (15) and Karnataka (13), according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Active COVID-19 cases in Gujarat and Maharashtra jumped by 9 and 8, respectively. Kerala has the highest number of active cases in the country at 2,606.
Title: Which states reported the biggest jump in active COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours?
bottom_headline: Karnataka has 105 active cases

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: The Chhatisgarh High Court observed that the discriminatory outlook towards dark-skinned women in our society must change. The statement said that dark-skinned women are often portrayed as insecure until a fairness cream is handed over to them, which ensures their success. This outlook, the court observed, needs to change by tweaking the way we talk about these things at home.
Title: Societal Attitude Towards Dark-Skinned Women Must Change: HC
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: Even after facing the biggest strike in its history, Hollywood still managed to touch hearts globally while giving us a magical cinematic experience with these releases. Films like Killers of the Flower Moon, Barbie, Beau Is Afraid, Past Lives, and Wonka have to be the most comforting films of the year, which you should also give a watch to.
Title: Five Hollywood Films Of 2023 You Can Vibe WIth
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Ashley Paul
Content: A Noida resident tested positive for COVID-19 in the first case of the infection in Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar district after several months. The patient, a 54-year-old who works at an MNC, had recently travelled to Nepal and went to work at his Gurugram office after returning, District Surveillance Officer Dr Amit Kumar said. "Patient is asymptomatic," Kumar said.
Title: Noida reports 1st COVID-19 case in months as 54-yr-old tests positive
bottom_headline: His sample has been sent for genome sequencing
bottom_text: He had gone for the COVID-19 test on his own

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $10,000 (over ₹8 lakh)  for information about a 29-year-old student from India, Mayushi Bhagat, who has been missing since April 2019. She was last seen leaving her apartment in Jersey City. She came to the US on a student visa in 2016 and was studying at New York Institute of Technology.
Title: ₹8 lakh reward announced for info on 29-yr-old Indian student missing in US since 2019
bottom_headline: FBI put her on 'Kidnapping/missing' persons list

Author: Ashley Paul
Content: Another soldier has succumbed to his injuries after terrorists attacked two Army vehicles in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch region on Thursday. The toll due to the attack has now reached four. Indian Army personnel, who were going to reinforce a joint operation against terrorists going on in the area since Wednesday, had immediately retaliated after the attack.
Title: Soldier succumbs to injuries after attack on Army vehicles in J&K
bottom_headline: The vehicles were ambushed

Author: She The People Team
Content: Olympic medalist Sakshi Malik has announced her retirement from wrestling following the controversial election of Sanjay Singh as the President of the Wrestling Federation of India (WFI). She placed her wrestling shoes on the table during the announcement, a symbolic act marking the end of her illustrious career. Wrestler Vinesh, Sangeeta Phogat said women wrestlers 'will be harassed again'.
Title: Sakshi Malik quits as Brij Bhushan associate wins WFI polls
bottom_headline: Tap To Read The Full Story

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: Union Minister Smriti Irani, who earlier said period is not a handicap as she opposed a paid leave policy during menstruation, said she made the statement as she didn't want "more and more women to get harassed". "When I spoke in the Parliament, I spoke from my personal experience," she told ANI. RJD's Manoj Jha asked her about period leave.
Title: Didn’t want women to be harassed: Smriti on her 'period is not handicap' statement
bottom_headline: He didn't want to find solution for women: Irani

Author: Nandita Banerji
Content: A malaria vaccine manufactured by the Serum Institute of India has passed the next round of regulatory approval by the World Health Organization (WHO) on December 21, 2023. The R21/Matrix M malaria vaccine developed by University of Oxford and the Indian company has been added to the health agency's list of prequalified vaccines.
Title: Malaria vaccine made by Serum Institute passes WHO quality checks
bottom_headline: To read the full story on Down To Earth

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: Journalist bodies deplored the freezing of bank accounts of news portal NewsClick by the Income Tax Department and said the move, which violated laws, has in one stroke deprived nearly 100 media persons and their families of a steady source of income. NewsClick said its bank accounts were frozen and it will undertake legal measures against “unjust and cruel” action.
Title: Journalist bodies deplore freezing of NewsClick’s bank accounts
bottom_headline: Journalist Paranjoy Guha Thakurta on NewsClick

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: The Delhi High Court asked the Election Commission of India to take a decision as expeditiously as possible, preferably within eight weeks, on a notice it has issued to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for his alleged “pickpocket” jibe at PM Modi made during a speech delivered last month. The court was hearing a public interest litigation seeking action against Gandhi.
Title: ECI gets 8 weeks to decide on notice to Rahul Gandhi
bottom_headline: Parliament passes Bill on EC selection panel

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: The Sabarimala Greenfield Airport took a step closer to becoming a reality as the Kerala government issued an order to proceed with the acquisition of 2,570 acres of land in Kottayam. The airport is being developed on land in Erumeli South and Manimala villages. Decision to proceed with the land acquisition was made based on recommendations of an expert committee.
Title: Sabarimala Greenfield Airport gets land acquisition approval
bottom_headline: Proposed Sabarimala airport gets green signal

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: The Delhi police have taken into custody a youth from Bagalkote, Karnataka, and questioned another man from Mysuru in connection with the 13 December security breach in Parliament, official sources said on 21 December. Meanwhile, a Delhi court on Thursday extended till 5 January the police custody of four accused arrested in the Parliament security breach case.
Title: Parliament security breach: Mysuru salon owner questioned
bottom_headline: LS adjourned sine die before schedule

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: A central team visited the inundated areas in Tirunelveli on 21 December, to assess the extent of damage caused due to the torrential rain a few days ago in four southern districts of TN. The team visited the waterlogged area at Tirunelveli junction bus stand and interacted with the officials. TN CM Stalin visited the southern districts to take stock.
Title: Central team assesses flood damages in TN’s Tirunelveli district
bottom_headline: CM Stalin seeks ₹2,000 crore interim relief

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: The Lok Sabha passed a Bill which seeks to establish a mechanism to appoint the chief election commissioner and election commissioners. In effect, the Bill allows for the Chief Justice of India to be replaced by a Union Cabinet minister in the panel that selects the CEC and ECs. Prime Minister and Opposition Leader in LS are on the panel.
Title: CJI out, Cabinet minister in: Parliament passes EC selection Bill
bottom_headline: Bill regarding CEC selection panel tabled in RS

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: With tears in her eyes, Rio Olympic bronze medallist Sakshi Malik put her wrestling shoes on the table and announced her retirement from the sport as a mark of protest against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh loyalist Sanjay Singh winning the Wrestling Federation of India election for the top job, in New Delhi. Wrestlers Punia and Phogat also addressed the media.
Title: Brij Bhushan loyalist is WFI chief, Sakshi Malik quits wrestling
bottom_headline: Charge sheet filed against WFI’s Brij Bhushan

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: Despite 100 of its members being suspended and adjourning the House sine die before schedule, the Lok Sabha said it had achieved 74 percent productivity. The Lok Sabha passed 18 Bills in the Winter Session of Parliament, including three to replace the Indian Penal Code, the Code of Criminal Procedure, and the Evidence Act.
Title: With 100 Opposition MPs suspended, Lok Sabha passes 18 Bills
bottom_headline: LS adjourned sine die before schedule

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: Karnataka JD(S) president HD Kumaraswamy on Thursday, 21 December, said his party and the BJP will complete their talks regarding seat-sharing in the state for the 2024 Lok Sabha elections by the end of January 2024. Kumaraswamy, who met Prime Minister Narendra Modi along with JD(S) national president HD Deve Gowda, said that the matter was discussed during the meeting.
Title: JD(S) to ‘claim winnable seats’ for 2024 LS polls by January-end
bottom_headline: HD Deve Gowda, Kumaraswamy meet PM Modi

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: Of the 358 cases, Kerala reported 300 fresh Covid-19 infections and three deaths in the 24 hours preceding 8 am on Thursday, 21 December, according to the Union Health Ministry website, taking the active cases in the state to 2,341. Coming in a distant second is Karnataka, which reported 24 new Covid-19 cases on Thursday.
Title: 358 fresh Covid-19 cases in India; 3 more deaths in Kerala
bottom_headline: No Covid guidelines for New Year in Karnataka

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: Karnataka will not be issuing a separate advisory for New Year's in light of a spike in Covid-19 cases, CM Siddaramaiah said, after a review meeting on 21 December. However, he advised people to be careful and suggested wearing masks in crowded places. The Technical Advisory Committee asked those with comorbidities and senior citizens to wear masks while stepping out.
Title: No Covid guidelines for New Year's, but be cautious: Siddaramaiah
bottom_headline: Karnataka Health department’s Dos and Don’ts

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: On death penalty awarded to the 8 Indian ex-Navy personnel in Qatar, the MEA said that three hearings have taken place in the Qatar Court of Appeal. There has been no indication on how many Indians are there in the pardon list. The 8 Indian nationals have been imprisoned in Qatar since October 2022..
Title: No indication how many Indians were in pardon list
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: India and the delegation of the European Parliament Sub-Committee on Security and Defence (SEDE) held meetings with Defence officials. They highlighted their mutual interests in deepening India-EU defence cooperation along with greater collaboration in the Indo-Pacific. The SEDE delegation met with the Parliamentary Standing Committee on Defence and exchanged views on India.
Title: India-EU Parliament delegations highlight mutual interests
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: Calling the passage of three new criminal Bills in Parliament a ‘watershed moment’ in Indian history, PM Modi said that these Bills mark the end of colonial-era laws. The Rajya Sabha passed the three criminal bills — the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita Bill, the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita Bill, and the Bharatiya Sakshya Bill. Lok Sabha had earlier passed these Bills.
Title: “Watershed moment in Indian history”: PM Modi
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: India’s position is consistent on the issue of Canada. It hopes that Ottawa would take action on extremist elements that are misusing the freedom of speech and expression in their country. While addressing a weekly media, Bagchi said India has always highlighted that the core issue remains the space given to extremists, terrorists and anti-India elements in Canada.
Title: “India hopes Canada takes action against extremist elements…”: MEA
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Disha Jana
Content: Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has offered a $10,000-reward (approximately ₹8.3 lakh) for information on a missing Indian woman. The FBI has also sought inputs on identification, arrest, and conviction of the person(s) responsible for the absence of the woman, Mayushi Bhagat. She was reported as missing in 2019 and was last seen as she left her New Jersey apartment.
Title: FBI offers ₹8.3 lakh reward for info on missing Indian woman
bottom_headline: To know more

Author: Medhaa Gupta
Content: A video purportedly showing a police constable and his associates stealing a tyre from a parked car, which had been seized, outside a police station in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur has surfaced online. A senior police official said that an investigation is underway. While the incident took place last month, it came to light after the video surfaced.
Title: Video shows policeman, others stealing tyre from seized car in UP
bottom_headline: To know more

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: While hearing a case, Delhi High Court said, "Nothing can be a more harrowing experience for a husband than to see his wife act as a widow during his lifetime." The court said this while dismissing a woman's appeal challenging a family court's decision granting divorce in her husband's favour, holding that she acted with cruelty towards him.
Title: Nothing more harrowing for man than to see his wife act as a widow: Delhi HC
bottom_headline: 'An act of extreme cruelty towards the husband'
bottom_text: Tap to know what more the HC said

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: As the Parliament on Thursday passed the Bharatiya Nyaya (Second) Sanhita, 2023, the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha (Second) Sanhita, 2023, and the Bharatiya Sakshya (Second) Bill, 2023 on Thursday, PM Narendra Modi described it as a "watershed moment". The bills were passed in the Lok Sabha on Wednesday and in the Rajya Sabha on Thursday.
Title: Watershed moment: PM as 3 criminal law bills passed in Parliament
bottom_headline: Over 140 Oppn MPs have been suspended

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: A married policeman in Bengaluru died after his girlfriend allegedly set him on fire when he confronted her about her second lover. Police said the couple had a heated argument during which the policeman doused himself in petrol and warned her he'd set himself on fire if she refused to reconcile their relationship. Rani then set him ablaze, police added.
Title: Married policeman burnt to death after asking girlfriend about her 2nd lover in B'luru
bottom_headline: A case has been registered

Author: Brijesh
Content: TMC MP Kalyan Banerjee's video mimicking Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar has triggered a storm. President Murmu expressed dismay, while Prime Minister Modi dialled the Vice President and expressed pain over the abject theatrics of some Honourable MPs in the Parliament complex.
Title: Video Shows TMC's Kalyan Banerjee Imitating Vice President
bottom_headline: The video has met with an uproar online

Author: Anmol Sharma
Content: Minister of Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari has said that national highways in India will have satellite-based tolling systems by March. The announcement was made by Gadkari during a session in the Rajya Sabha. The pilot of the satellite-based toll collection has already been completed on the Delhi-Mumbai corridor.
Title: National highways to have satellite-based tolling systems by March: Gadkari
bottom_headline: 'It will help reduce govt's expenditure'
bottom_text: Tap to read what Gadkari said

Author: Anmol Sharma
Content: The IMD has issued dense to very dense fog warning for several states for the next few days. It is very likely over Punjab for the next four days and over Haryana for the next three days. Odisha, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura could witness dense to very dense fog over the next two days.
Title: Dense to very dense fog warning issued for several states, list released
bottom_headline: Dense fog likely in UP on Friday
bottom_text: Tap to view the entire bulletin

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: A video of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath's interaction with a momo seller at an event is going viral on social media. The video shows the CM asking the vendor if any of the BJP leaders ate at his shop, to which he replied actor-politician Ravi Kishan did. "Did he pay for the momo?" CM Yogi jokingly asked the vendor.
Title: CM Yogi asks momo seller about BJP leaders visiting his shop, says 'Did Ravi Kishan pay?'
bottom_headline: To watch the video of their interaction

Author: Medhaa Gupta
Content: BJP leader Subramanian Swamy has said that he and his law associates will challenge the Telecommunications Bill, 2023 if it is passed in the Rajya Sabha. This comes as the Bill was passed today. "It is in effect legitimising...Pegasus. I suggest [the PM Narendra Modi-led government to] wait till 2024 General Elections are over," he added.
Title: Legitimises Pegasus, will challenge it: BJP's Swamy on Telecom Bill
bottom_headline: Bill allows govt to take over mobile services
bottom_text: This can be done in view of national security

Author: Daisy Mowke
Content: A Mumbai-based Australian author called Air India's service "disorganised" after travelling from Mumbai to Melbourne. "Two hours of chaos in line...One hour stuck on...tarmac," Sharell Cook wrote. She added there was no in-flight entertainment and a man littered the floor. "We regret...your journey fell short of standards we aim to uphold. We take these concerns seriously," Air India apologised.
Title: Woman shares pics as she calls Air India's service 'disorganised', airline responds
bottom_headline: To read her full post

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi, while speaking on the death penalty to eight ex-Indian Navy personnel in Qatar, said, "This case is now in the court of appeal." He said three hearings have been done in the Qatar Court of Appeal. The first hearing was on November 23, the second was on November 30, and the third was on December 7.
Title: 3 hearings done in Qatar Court of Appeal: Bagchi on 8 Indians on death row
bottom_headline: 'Nothing more to share at this stage'
bottom_text: Tap to read what Bagchi said

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: The Rajya Sabha on Thursday passed the Bharatiya Nyaya (Second) Sanhita, 2023, the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha (Second) Sanhita, 2023, and the Bharatiya Sakshya (Second) Bill, 2023. The amended bills, that will replace IPC, CrPC and Indian Evidence Act, were passed in Lok Sabha on Wednesday. This came after over 140 Opposition MPs were suspended from the Parliament.
Title: Parliament clears 3 new criminal law bills
bottom_headline: Sedition repealed, terrorism defined in bills
bottom_text: Tap to know more about them

Author: Gaurav Bhargava
Content: TODAY, a Delhi court extended the police remand of four of the accused persons in the recent Parliament security breach case by 15 days. A case under Sections 16 (punishment for terrorist act) and 18 (punishment for conspiracy, etc.) of the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, (UAPA) 1967 has been registered against the four of them and their two accomplices.
Title: Parliament breach case: Delhi court extends remand of four accused
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: Three soldiers were martyred and three others were injured after terrorists ambushed two Army vehicles in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch region, officials said. Indian Army troops also immediately retaliated after being attacked by terrorists, officials added. The troops were reportedly going to reinforce a joint operation against terrorists that was going on since Wednesday.
Title: 3 soldiers martyred after terrorists attack Army vehicles in J&K
bottom_headline: For more information about the attack

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: The Drugs Controller General of India has banned the administration of a combination of anti-cold drugs in children under four years. The regulatory body issued a letter to all states, directing them to update the package inserts for products containing the combination of chlorpheniramine maleate and phenylephrine. It mandates that drug manufacturers must label their products with a warning.
Title: India bans use of combination of anti-cold drugs in kids under 4
bottom_headline: Cough syrups under the scanner

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: A White Paper on the power sector, presented to the Telangana Assembly, put the accumulated losses of electricity Distribution Companies at ₹62,461 crore as of 31 March 2023. Presented by Deputy Chief Minister Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka on 21 December, it revealed that the Discoms have a debt burden of a whopping ₹81,516 crore as of 31 October 2023.
Title: BRS’ failure pushed Discoms into debt trap: DyCM Bhatti Vikramarka
bottom_headline: BRS misled financial institutions

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: The High Court of Karnataka has quashed a bribery case pending against former BJP MLA from Channagiri, Madal Virupakshappa. The case was registered after his son, Prashanth Madal, a KAS officer, was caught accepting a bribe of ₹40 lakh allegedly on behalf of his father. “Prima facie, it is the son who has to answer the allegations,” the court said.
Title: Karnataka HC quashes bribery case against ex-BJP MLA Virupakshappa
bottom_headline: Madal Virupakshappa granted conditional bail

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Former PM and Janata Dal Secular (JDS) patriarch HD Deve Gowda and his son and former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy, met Prime Minister Modi on 21 December. The meeting assumes significance in the backdrop of both parties officially beginning the process of seat-sharing discussions for the upcoming Lok Sabha elections. JD(S) wants to contest at least 4 Lok Sabha constituencies.
Title: Deve Gowda, Kumaraswamy meet PM Modi, LS seat-sharing talks on
bottom_headline: Mysuru becomes bone of contention in alliance

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Karnataka Revenue Minister Krishna Byre Gowda said the state government’s ₹18,171 crore drought relief proposal will be taken up by a high-level central committee on 23 December. CM Siddaramaiah met PM Modi and HM Amit Shah and requested early release of the drought relief to the state, he said. They sought an input subsidy of ₹4,663.12 crore from the NDRF.
Title: K'taka has to wait for Central panel’s decision on drought relief
bottom_headline: Crops in 48.19 lakh hectares affected

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Tension prevailed at Calicut University on 21 December after workers of the SFI prevented the entry of a section of Senate members, over their alleged “Sangh Parivar background”. The protesters blocked the gates of the hall of the university when the members reached there to attend the meeting. However, they allowed the entry of other Senate members.
Title: SFI blocks hall gates to ‘stop entry of pro-Sangh Senate members’
bottom_headline: Vijayan, Governor Khan, and minority politics

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: A New Delhi Special Cell police team, probing into the Parliamentary Security Breach case, has picked up a retired DSP’s son from Bagalkot. The detainee — Saikrishna Jagali — is a software engineer and an independent app developer. He was picked up from his house in Vidyagiri. He was a collegemate of Manoranjan, one of the accused in the case.
Title: Ex-cop’s techie son from Karnataka held in Parliament breach case
bottom_headline: Police recover pieces of burnt phone

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: The TN Consumer Court has ordered MIOT Hospital in Chennai to pay ₹20 lakh as compensation for the death of a patient during the 2015 Chennai floods. Shanthi Kalaiarasan alleged that her husband had died of negligence on the part of MIOT. The hospital’s ICU, on the ground floor, was inundated in the rains that lashed the city in 2015.
Title: 2015 Chennai flood: 8 years,18 deaths later MIOT to pay ₹20 lakh
bottom_headline: Kerala hospital ordered to cough up ₹50 lakh

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: In a huge setback to the DMK government in TN, Higher Education Minister K Ponmudy has been sentenced to three years imprisonment in a disproportionate assets case. Justice Jayachandran of the high court sentenced Ponmudy and his wife Visalakshi to imprisonment and imposed a fine of ₹50 lakh each. BC Welfare Minister RS Rajakannappan will gain Ponmudy's portfolio.
Title: Madras HC sentences TN Minister K Ponmudy to 3 years imprisonment
bottom_headline: Madras HC convicts TN Minister Ponmudy

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: The government on Thursday shared a video of a Kashmiri man kissing PM Narendra Modi's life-size cutout on World Pheran Day. "In a touching moment...at the iconic Ghanta Ghar in Srinagar, a Kashmiri man in a gesture of deep respect, not only kisses the statue of PM Modi but also drapes it with a traditional Kashmiri Pheran," the government wrote.
Title: Govt shares video of man kissing PM Modi's life-size cutout in Kashmir
bottom_headline: To see govt's post

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy poked fun at former minister KT Rama Rao without taking his name. Intervening in the debate on a White Paper on the state’s finances, Reddy said he understood BRS’s pain over being out of power. He taunted KTR saying “everyone is aware of the story of Aurangzeb. BRS is bringing family quarrels to the House.”
Title: ‘Story of Aurangzeb’: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy taunts KTR
bottom_headline: Don’t tarnish image of Telangana

Author: Medhaa Gupta
Content: Former WFI chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh has reacted to his aide Sanjay Singh being elected as the new chief of the wrestling federation, saying, "I hope that after the loss faced by wrestling in the last 11 months...the new federation will resume the wrestling events." He added that this isn't a "win for him" but for the nation's wrestlers.
Title: Not mine, it's win for wrestlers: Brij as aide elected as WFI chief
bottom_headline: Singh met Brij at his home after being elected

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: Wrestler Vinesh Phogat has reacted to Brij Bhushan Singh's close aide, Sanjay Singh, becoming the chief of WFI. "It's unfortunate that such people are getting elected to such positions in the country. Now, girls will be harassed again," she said. Sakshee Malikkh quit wrestling after the announcement and left her boots on a table during a press conference.
Title: Girls will be harassed again: Phogat as Sanjay becomes WFI chief
bottom_headline: I have nothing to do with this: Brij

Author: Daisy Mowke
Content: The Indian Institutes of Management (IIMs) have declared the result for the Common Admission Test (CAT) 2023. A total of 14 students have scored 100 percentile. This year, a total of over 2.88 lakh students took the test. The examination was conducted on November 26 in 375 test centres across 167 cities.
Title: CAT 2023 result declared, 14 students score 100 percentile
bottom_headline: Engineers have dominated the top ranks

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: A video has surfaced online, showing a mother-daughter duo on a scooty being chased by stray dogs in Chandigarh. The video shows the woman increasing the scooty's speed to escape the dogs. Unable to control the scooty, the woman rammed the vehicle into a house with parked cycles and flower pots. Both women fell upon collision with the cycles.
Title: Chased by stray dogs, woman rams scooty into parked cycles in Chandigarh
bottom_headline: To watch video of the incident

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: Wrestler Vinesh Phogat broke down during a press conference after sexual harassment accused Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh's aide Sanjay Singh was elected as the new President of the Wrestling Federation of India (WFI). "There are minimal expectations but we hope that we get justice. It's saddening that the future of wrestling is in the dark," she said.
Title: Vinesh Phogat breaks down after Brij Bhushan's aide Sanjay Singh becomes WFI chief
bottom_headline: We are still fighting: Phogat

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: An Indian Army truck was ambushed by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district on Thursday. This is said to be the second terror attack on the Army in the region in less than a month. Reinforcements have reportedly been sent to the area that has been cordoned off following the attack. More details in the incident are awaited.
Title: Army truck attacked by terrorists in J&K
bottom_headline: Firing is being reported in the area

Author: Gaurav Bhargava
Content: Parliament clears new election commissioner Bill that removes CJI from the appointment committee. The new Act provides a three-member committee consisting of the Prime Minister (PM), a Union cabinet minister of his choice and Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha, all but ensuring that the choice of the PM always goes through.
Title: Parliament clears new election commissioner Bill
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: News Desk
Content: With Telanganas power distribution companies reeling under Rs 81,516-crore debt, as per Congress whitepaper, providing the promised free electricity will be a major challenge for the Congress-led state government. Congress guarantee to provide 24-hour free electricity to Telanganas farmers and 200 units of free power monthly to all households is estimated to cost Rs 27,055 crore per year.
Title: Free power promised by Cong to cost Telangana Rs 27K cr per yr
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Rupesh
Content: A new COVID-19 subvariant, JN.1, has emerged in India, with 2,669 active cases reported. Originating from BA.2.86 lineage, JN.1 is considered a variant of interest by WHO. Symptoms include fever, sore throat, and muscle fatigue. Experts advise precautions like booster shots, especially for those with weakened immune systems, and stress the importance of masks and hygiene.
Title: JN.1: New COVID-19 Subvariant Emerges in India
bottom_headline: Understanding JN.1: Precautions & Symptoms

Author: Rupesh
Content: The Rajya Sabha passed the Telecommunications Bill, 2023, with minimal debate due to the suspension of 143 opposition MPs. The bill, replacing colonial-era laws, allows government control over telecoms in emergencies & mandates biometric authentication for users. Critics express concerns over privacy and government overreach, fearing its broad scope could impact content creators and social media.
Title: Telecom Bill Passed Amid Opposition MPs' Suspension
bottom_headline: New Telecom Bill Raises Privacy Concerns

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Jamyang Tsering, BJP MP from Ladakh, said in the Lok Sabha that the new Criminal Bills are going to reform the age old laws of the British era. He claimed Congress had kept the "dark" laws of the British era in India even after independence. "Therefore, I feel that there's not much difference between Britishers and Congress," he added.
Title: Not much difference between Britishers, Congress: Jamyang Tsering
bottom_headline: 'Provisions for sedition have been repealed'

Author: Swati Dubey
Content: In a significant development for Indian H-1B visa holders, the US has reinstated the domestic renewal of non-immigrant visas, a process discontinued since 2004. Online applications will be accepted from January 29 to April 1, 2024, with a $205 MRV fee. The move aims to ease uncertainty for US companies with temporary workers on petition-based visas.
Title: H-1B visa pilot program to open for Indians from Jan 2024
bottom_headline: To know more

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: A man who sued Railways and IRCTC for lapses after his elderly parents were fined despite having AC first-class tickets, has won a compensation of ₹40,000. Bengaluru-based Alok Kumar's parents were told the status of their confirmed tickets was "no room" while travelling in Rajdhani Express in March 2022. The ticket checker tagged them as "ticketless" and fined them ₹22,300.
Title: Man sues Railways as parents wrongly fined for 'ticketless travel', wins ₹40,000
bottom_headline: Court ordered ₹30,000 payment for harassment

Author: News Desk
Content: Hyderabad reported six fresh cases of COVID-19 on Wednesday, following four cases recorded the day before. The emergency has led the Telangana health ministry to make masks mandatory, and not wearing one will be punishable by a fine. Children under 10 years of age, pregnant mothers, and elders above 60 years are advised to avoid going outdoors unless mandatory.
Title: Hyderabad records fresh COVID-19 cases; masks become mandatory
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: Delhi High Court on Thursday said Congress MP calling PM Narendra Modi a "pickpocket" in his speech on November 22 was "not in good taste". It said this on a plea seeking registration of an FIR against Rahul over his speeches calling PM Modi "panauti" and "pickpocket". The plea also sought directions for framing of stricter laws on the issue.
Title: Rahul Gandhi calling PM Modi 'pickpocket' not in good taste: Delhi High Court
bottom_headline: HC directed EC to decide the matter in 8 weeks

Author: Daisy Mowke
Content: A man gave triple talaq to his wife over WhatsApp after she told him that she donated a kidney to her sick brother. The wife lives in Uttar Pradesh while her husband lives in Saudi Arabia. The man became furious over the kidney donation and demanded ₹40 lakh from her. Upon her refusal, he sent her a triple talaq message.
Title: Husband gives UP woman triple talaq over WhatsApp after she donates kidney to brother
bottom_headline: The woman filed a complaint with the police

Author: News Desk
Content: Hyderabad police have reportedly shut the sexual assault case filed by an EFLU student, that sparked protests between Oct & Nov. The incident occurred on Oct 18, after a protest for the reconstitution of the SPARSH committee. Authorities cited a lack of evidence to substantiate the student's claim, mentioning inconclusive medical examinations after she was taken to the hospital post-assault.
Title: Hyderabad police to shut case of sexual assault of EFLU student
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: Road safety influencer and activist Piyush Dhanani was beaten up by people in the middle of a busy road in Gujarat's Surat. A video of the incident is being widely circulated on social media. Dhanani is known for posting videos in which he stops vehicles moving in the wrong direction and asks them to take a U-turn.
Title: Road safety influencer Piyush Dhanani thrashed by people on busy Guj road; video surfaces
bottom_headline: To watch the video of the incident

Author: News Desk
Content: Goshamahal BJP MLA, Raja Singh, criticized the Telangana govt for allocating funds, Rs 2.45 crore, for the Tablighi Jamaat congregation. He questioned the decision, asking why Congress supports an organization banned in several countries, including Kazakhstan, Russia, and Saudi Arabia. Alleging controversial teachings, he stated that Tablighi Jamaat's practices led to prohibition in these nations.
Title: Raja Singh reacts to Telangana govt funding Tablighi event
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Jay Pandya
Content: The government has decided to hand over the 'comprehensive' security of the Parliament building complex to the Central Industrial Security Force in the wake of the recent breach of the safety ring, official sources said on Thursday. The CISF is a central armed police force that currently guards many central government ministry buildings in Delhi.
Title: Government ropes in CISF for security of Parliament complex
bottom_headline: Parliament's security was breached on Dec. 13

Author: Medhaa Gupta
Content: Three more Congress MPs were suspended from Lok Sabha today, taking the total number of Opposition MPs suspended from Parliament to 146. The suspended MPs include DK Suresh, Nakul Nath and Deepak Baij. The three MPs showed "utter disregard" to Lok Sabha and Chair's authority by displaying placards and entering into Well of the House, Union Minister Pralhad Joshi said.
Title: 3 more Oppn MPs suspended from Parliament, total rises to 146
bottom_headline: Joshi has moved the motion for suspension

Author: News Desk
Content: Residents in Hyderabad and several Telangana districts experience a winter chill as night temperatures drop, reaching as low as 6.6 degrees Celsius. A report from TSDPS reveals nighttime temperatures below 15 degrees Celsius in parts of the city. With Hyderabad reaching 11.9 degrees Celsius, residents resort to warm clothing during nights and early mornings, expecting the trend to persist.
Title: These areas in Hyderabad shiver as night temperatures dip
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Nandita Banerji
Content: A study looking into the drivers of widespread flooding in seven Indian subcontinental river basins found that peninsular basins are more likely to flood than transboundary rivers like the Ganga and Brahmaputra. The Narmada basin has the highest probability (59 percent) of widespread flooding, followed by Mahanadi (50 percent), Godavari (42 percent), Krishna (38 percent) and Cauvery (19 percent).
Title: Peninsular river basins in India more likely to face flooding
bottom_headline: To read the full article by Down To Earth

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Election Commission of India (ECI) asked political parties to avoid using derogatory words for persons with disabilities (PwDs) in public discourse. "Common examples of ableist language are words like dumb (gunga), retarded (pagal, sirphira), blind (andha, kana), deaf (behra) [and] lame (langda, lula)," ECI said. Public speeches and campaigns of parties must also be accessible to all, it added.
Title: Avoid saying pagal, andha, behra & gunga: ECI to political parties
bottom_headline: 'Promote respect towards PwDs'
bottom_text: Tap to know what more ECI said

Author: News Desk
Content: The energy sector whitepaper disclosed that Telangana's power distribution firms held a debt of Rs 81,516 crore with accumulated losses reaching Rs 62,461 crore. The Congress-led government, a day after presenting a financial whitepaper, tabled the energy sector report. Despite borrowing Rs 30,406 crore as working capital, discoms still owe Rs 28,673 crore in generation and transmission dues.
Title: Telangana discoms in debt of over Rs 81K cr: Whitepaper on energy
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Swarna Srikanth
Content: In an incident reported from Sector 38 in Chandigarh, stray dogs fiercely followed a scooter ridden by a mother and her daughter. Fearing a dog attack, they rushed the vehicle into a nearby house and rammed into the parked cycles there. However, the dogs soon walked away from the spot without causing any harm to the women.
Title: Chandigarh: 3 Dogs Chase Mother-Daughter Duo Riding Scooty
bottom_headline: CCTV Video from incident surfaces

Author: Daisy Mowke
Content: A 16-year-old boy in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi was forced to drink alcohol, stripped and thrashed by his classmates after the class 10 student asked one of them to return ₹200 he had borrowed. The boy told police that the suspects hit him with belts and sticks, recorded the assault on their phones and circulated the visuals.
Title: 16-yr-old UP boy forced to drink alcohol, stripped & beaten up by classmates over ₹200
bottom_headline: He said they had an altercations 2 months back

Author: Rupesh
Content: A study in Gujarat's Saurashtra reveals 63% of migrant workers' children aged 6-14 don't attend school, and 94% under six miss out on anganwadis. Factors include distance, language barriers, and household duties. The study highlights the challenges in accessing education for these children, raising concerns about the effectiveness of existing educational policies and schemes.
Title: Gujarat's Migrant Kids Face Schooling Crisis
bottom_headline: Educational Gap for Migrant Children

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Minister Hardeep Singh Puri started answering in Lok Sabha in English on Thursday. Speaker Om Birla said, "Can I request something? When you know Hindi, answer in Hindi." As Puri started speaking Punjabi, Birla said he'll have to give in writing for speaking Punjabi. Thereafter, Puri said, "Okay, I'll answer in Hindi. I'll give a touch of Bhojpuri to it."
Title: Answer in Hindi: Speaker as Puri starts speaking in English in LS
bottom_headline: To know more about Lok Sabha proceedings

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: A 23-year-old Indian student, who had been missing since December 15, has been found dead in London's Canary Wharf. Gurashman Singh Bhatia was last seen in the South Quay area, police said while appealing for help to piece together his last movements. His body was reportedly found in a lake by police divers on the afternoon of Wednesday (December 20).
Title: 23-year-old missing Indian student found dead in London
bottom_headline: BJP leader Sirsa earlier sought help for Bhatia

Author: Farida
Content: In a setback for the DMK government in Tamil Nadu, the Madras High Court sentenced the state Minister for Higher Education, K Ponmudy, to three years in jail and imposed a fine of Rs 50 lakh in a disproportionate assets case. The court overturned a previous acquittal by a lower court in 2016.
Title: 3-Year Jail for Tamil Nadu Minister Ponmudi
bottom_headline: Ponmudy Faces Assets Probe

Author: Medhaa Gupta
Content: Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi has approved CM MK Stalin's recommendation to hand over the Higher Education portfolio, which was being dealt with by K Ponmudy, to Backward Classes Welfare Minister RS Rajakannappan, as per a press release. This comes after Madras High Court sentenced Ponmudy to three years of imprisonment in connection with ₹1.79 crore-disproportionate assets case.
Title: Rajakannappan gets Higher Education portfolio as HC jails Ponmudy
bottom_headline: HC had suspended Ponmudy's jail term for 30 days

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: Amid rising cases of COVID-19, several states have reported zero cases so far, according to the data released by the Health Ministry. Bihar, Chandigarh, Chhattisgarh, Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu, Himachal Pradesh, Ladakh, Lakshadweep, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland, Odisha, Sikkim, Tripura, Uttarakhand and West Bengal are the states and Union Territories with zero active cases.
Title: Which states have zero cases of COVID-19?
bottom_headline: Kerala has highest active cases at 2,341

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: Sanjay Singh was on Thursday elected the President of the Wrestling Federation of India (WFI). Singh got 40 out of 47 votes against Commonwealth Games gold medallist Anita Sheoran. He is believed to be a close aide of former WFI chief and BJP MP Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, who was accused of sexually harassing female wrestlers.
Title: Brij Bhushan's aide Sanjay Singh elected Wrestling Federation of India chief
bottom_headline: Sanjay Singh has been with WFI for 12 years
bottom_text: He was elected WFI Joint Secretary in 2019

Author: Ankush Verma
Content: The Rajya Sabha on Thursday passed the Telecommunications Bill, 2023, which was passed by the Lok Sabha a day earlier. The bill, introduced by Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on December 18, aims to amend and consolidate the law relating to development, expansion and operation of telecommunication services and telecommunication networks, assignment of spectrum and connected matters.
Title: Parliament passes The Telecommunications Bill, 2023
bottom_headline: To know more about the bill

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: As per reports, Home Ministry has directed Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) to take over the security of the Parliament building and its premises from Delhi Police. This comes days after two men intruded into Lok Sabha and opened smoke canisters. Delhi Police will reportedly continue to protect the exterior perimeter of the Parliament. CISF comes under the central government.
Title: CISF to take over Parliament's security from Delhi Police after security breach: Reports
bottom_headline: Intruders have been arrested

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: The Lok Sabha has passed Chief Election Commissioner and Other Election Commissioners (Appointment, Conditions of Service and Term of Office) Bill, 2023. It regulates the appointment of the CEC and top officials by constituting a three-member selection committee comprising the PM, Leader of the Opposition and a Cabinet Minister. Earlier this month, it was passed by the Rajya Sabha.
Title: Bill to regulate appointment of top 3 election officials passed in Lok Sabha
bottom_headline: For more information about the Bill

Author: Devika Kapoor
Content: The consecration ceremony for the Ram Temple in Ayodhya will be held on January 22, 2024. It can be safely said that the crusade for the construction of the Ram Temple was one of the most significant events in the history of independent India, and the consecration will mark the culmination of a struggle of decades.
Title: 9 interesting facts about Ram Mandir in Ayodhya
bottom_headline: 9 interesting facts about Ayodhya’s Ram Mandir

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: BJP MLA Raja Singh said Congress government in Telangana has sanctioned ₹2.45 crore for a congregation of Tablighi Jamaat. "Don't you know Tablighi Jamaat's history?" he asked CM Revanth Reddy. He added that the organisation is associated with Godhra tragedy, in which 59 Hindu pilgrims were burnt alive. "Why is Congress embracing an organisation banned in several countries?" Singh questioned.
Title: T'gana govt sanctioned ₹2.5 cr for Tablighi Jamaat meet: BJP MLA
bottom_headline: 'This raises questions about Congress' motives'
bottom_text: Tap to know what more Singh said

Author: Bhana Neur
Content: A man in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly bit his wife's nose over demand for dowry. The wife has been injured and has lodged an FIR against her husband and in-laws for dowry harassment. The wife, who goes by the name Ajmi, is 22. On December 15, the in-laws allegedly beat her up and the husband injured her by biting her nose.
Title: UP man held for biting wife's nose over dowry harassment
bottom_headline: Tap To Read Full News

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: A massive fire broke out at the Gopaldas building located on Delhi's Barakhamba road on Thursday. According to reports, at least 15 fire tenders were rushed to the spot to douse the fire that broke out on the eighth floor of the building. A video shared by ANI showed smoke billowing from the top of the building.
Title: Fire breaks out at Gopaldas building near CP in Delhi, visuals surface
bottom_headline: No casualties have been reported yet
bottom_text: Tap to watch video of the incident

Author: Bhana Neur
Content: In a significant move responding to global concerns over the alarming link between cough syrups and child fatalities, India's drugs regulator has imposed a ban on the use of an anti-cold drug combination for children aged below four. This decisive action follows at least 141 deaths globally, raising serious questions about safety of such medications for the vulnerable age group.
Title: Why has India banned cough syrups for kids aged under four?
bottom_headline: Tap To Read More

Author: Bhana Neur
Content: V. Mohini Giri, a renowned women's rights activist passed away following a brief illness on Tuesday, her aide announced. She was 85 years old and is survived by her son and daughter. The Padma Bhushan laureate dedicated her life to advocating for women's rights, gender equality, and social justice. Her journey towards activism began amidst personal tragedy.
Title: How personal grief sparked Mohini Giri's women's rights activism
bottom_headline: Tap To Read The Full Feature

Author: Bhana Neur
Content: A computer science graduate from Uttar Pradesh was held by Delhi Police for scamming 904 families of missing children under the pretence of having found them. Shyamsundar Chauhan from Mau used police databases to prey on grieving families in Delhi-NCR and told them that he had found their children in a different city, posing as a police official.
Title: UP Man Held For Conning 904 Families Of Missing Kids
bottom_headline: Tap To Read The Full News

Author: Rupesh Pandit
Content: In 2023, Indian warehouses integrated advanced technology to meet increasing demand. Investments in logistics parks and warehouse automation, including automated storage & retrieval systems, have surged. This shift, driven by e-commerce growth & efficiency needs, involves robotics, intelligent warehousing, & automated management systems, significantly transforming India's warehousing landscape.
Title: Indian Warehousing Embraces Tech & Automation in 2023
bottom_headline: Tech Revolution in Indian Warehousing

Author: Swarna Srikanth
Content: You must have witnessed that people are pushing bikes, cars, buses, and other vehicles. However, have you ever witnessed an incident where people were seen pushing a helicopter? A video has hit the internet in which police officers are seen pushing a stationed helicopter in an open ground. Reports state that the helicopter belonged to Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami.
Title: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami's Helicopter Pushed By Cops
bottom_headline: Video of incident goes viral

Author: Rupesh Pandit
Content: Welspun Living, led by CEO Dipali Goenka, is focusing on B2C expansion in India. Aiming for a Rs 15,000 crore sales target by 2026, the company is leveraging its flooring business for growth. With a strong global presence, Welspun is adapting to market challenges, emphasizing sustainability and innovation in its diverse product range.
Title: Welspun Prioritises B2C Growth, Targets Rs 15,000 Cr by 2026
bottom_headline: Welspun's Bold B2C Expansion Strategy

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Priyanka Chaturvedi said intruders entered the Parliament recently as they had a letter signed by a BJP MP to come inside. "Should that MP not be held responsible?" she questioned. She further said, "Imagine if [the intruders] had toxic gas. What would've happened?" "Security comes under Deputy Speaker... Who's the Deputy Speaker...right now? Nobody!" she added.
Title: Intruders entered Parliament with BJP MP's letter: MP Priyanka
bottom_headline: 'Pannun had threatened to attack the Parliament'
bottom_text: I raised the issue, it was sidelined: Priyanka

Author: Bhana Neur
Content: It is no surprise that finding the "right" help has also become a pressing need. This is why many women now are on the hunt for the right therapist who understands their concerns and fits their needs. As building a rapport with a therapist has become a top priority for many women, some may say, "It's better than finding love!"
Title: Not Soulmates, Women Now Look For The "Right Match" In Therapists
bottom_headline: Tap To Read The Full Feature

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: A 45-year-old woman's brother and mother were found living with her body in their house, four-five days after her death, in Hyderabad, police said. Locals informed police about a foul smell coming from the house after which officials arrived and found the dead woman on a cot. Her family members said they weren't aware of her death, an official said.
Title: Woman's mother, brother found living with her body in Hyd; say 'didn't know she died'
bottom_headline: Mother, brother suspected to be mentally unsound

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Three police personnel were injured during President Droupadi Murmu’s visit to Pochampally in the Yadadri Bhuvanagiri district of Telangana. According to sources from the department, the injuries were caused due to high air pressure during the landing of her aircraft. An Assistant Commissioner of Police and two other police personnel were injured during the landing of the President’s aircraft.
Title: Police personnel injured during Prez Murmu’s Pochampally visit
bottom_headline: Union govt recognises 2 villages from T'gana

Author: Bhana Neur
Content: 2023 has been a year of continued transformation in the workplace, with trends driven by factors like the lingering effects of the pandemic, shifting employee priorities, and technological advancements that have altered a working culture by adapting these 'this is the new cool' workplace trends this year.
Title: Were You A Part Of These Five Workplace Trends In 2023?
bottom_headline: Tap To Read The Full Feature

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: It would be good if Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge becomes PM candidate of the Opposition bloc INDIA, but there is a need to first face practical challenges ahead, his son and Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge said. He stressed the need for Congress and INDIA bloc to gain a majority in LS, calling it a major challenge before the Opposition formation.
Title: "Good if Kharge is PM face, but..." Karnataka minister Priyank
bottom_headline: Mamata, Kejriwal propose Kharge as PM face

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Both Houses of Parliament passed several crucial Bills that were tabled, amidst the suspension of 97 Opposition members from Lok Sabha and 44 members from Rajya Sabha. The Bills include three criminal reform Bills, Telecom Bill, Provisional Collection of Taxes Bill, Bill related to unauthorised colonies in Delhi, and Bill to raise cap on age of GSTAT president, members.
Title: List of Bills passed in Parliament with 143 MPs in suspension
bottom_headline: Lok Sabha passes revised criminal reform Bills

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: On the day the Telangana Assembly witnessed a heated debate over the state’s financial condition, AIMIM MLA Akbaruddin Owaisi led the Opposition’s charge against the Revanth Reddy-led Congress government. The Congress, led by Deputy CM Bhatti Vikramarka, presented a White Paper on the state’s finances, including outstanding debt, alleging fiscal mismanagement by the previous BRS government.
Title: Akbaruddin Owaisi fact-checks Congress on White Paper on finances
bottom_headline: BRS misled financial institutions, says Revanth

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: The Karnataka Criminal Investigation Department has invoked provisions of the Karnataka Control of Organised Crimes Act (KCOCA) of 2000 against 12 people involved in exam malpractices. The dozen include prime accused Rudragouda Devendrappa Patil alias RD Patil, the alleged kingpin in the PSI recruitment scam. KCOCA previously has been used in cases like Gauri Lankesh's murder.
Title: KCOCA invoked against 12 in Karnataka exam malpractice cases
bottom_headline: HC issues guidelines to be followed on KCOCA

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: BJP and the VHP have claimed that the Muzrai (Endowments) Department had issued notices to 162 private temples across state for taking over their administration and financial affairs. Claims were made citing an order copy issued by the HR&CE department to one temple in Ballari. Minister Ramalinga Reddy deemed the claim false and challenged BJP-VHP to provide list as proof.
Title: BJP-VHP claims Karnataka govt taking over 162 private temples
bottom_headline: Sharda temple builds bridges between faiths

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: The Karnataka government has taken a significant stride towards fulfilling its pre-poll promise of a safety net for gig workers. It issued an order copy introducing a comprehensive insurance scheme for gig workers and persons engaged in the newspaper deliveries. The schemes offer substantial convenience, life insurance, accident insurance, and medical facilities, and will benefit 2.3 lakh people.
Title: K'taka rolls insurance for gig workers, newspaper delivery agents
bottom_headline: Karnataka announces interim relief for drought

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Chandrababu Naidu and Pawan Kalyan set the tone for their approach to Andhra Pradesh polls in a display of camaraderie in front of a huge gathering at the culmination of the Yuva Galam padayatra by Nara Lokesh in Vizianagaram. The two leaders are expected to release a joint manifesto for the upcoming Andhra Pradesh assembly elections in January.
Title: Naidu, Kalyan set tone for Andhra polls at Yuva Galam finale
bottom_headline: TDP looks to anti-incumbency

Author: Rupesh
Content: Lok Sabha passed 3 critical criminal reform bills replacing century-old laws like Indian Penal Code. Amid suspension of 97 Opposition MPs these bills were virtually unopposed. The reforms focusing on Indian jurisprudence & technological advancements have sparked debate over human rights concerns & law enforcement excesses. The Centre emphasizes their citizen-friendly & reform-oriented nature.
Title: India Passes Key Criminal Reform Bills Amid MP Suspensions
bottom_headline: New Era in Indian Criminal Law Reform

Author: Shweta
Content: Lok Sabha has passed three Bills to update old criminal laws. The Bills will replace old laws of Indian Penal Code. Home Minister Amit Shah says these laws focus on justice, not just punishment. These changes are for the betterment of terrorism, sedition, and mob violence laws. Although people are worried about these changes, the government promises to prevent misuse.
Title: Lok Sabha passes 3 criminal law amendment bills
bottom_headline: To know more about the changes in Criminal Laws.

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: In an interview with British daily FT, PM Narendra Modi addressed criticisms against him and his government. Talking about 'opponents' worries' that his government could amend the Constitution to make India a "Hindu Republic", PM said, "Any talk of amending the Constitution is meaningless." He said the "most transformative steps" by his government were undertaken without changing the Constitution.

Author: Ankush Verma
Content: A 45-year-old Mumbai-based assistant director of a web series has filed a complaint against an unknown woman for allegedly befriending him on a dating site and later extorting money from him. He said the woman took off all her clothes during a call and induced him into taking off his clothes, and recorded the video without his knowledge.

Content: December 21 is a day that no avid champion of human rights and public interest litigation can let go without remembering the late P.N. Bhagwati,17th Chief Justice of India, who had a tenure of 17 months. His 102nd birth anniversary was filled with national and international homages for his pioneering efforts in the development of human rights jurisprudence and PIL.

Content: A 108-foot long incense stick (agarbatti) is being prepared in Gujarat's Vadodara ahead of the Ram Temple consecration ceremony in UP's Ayodhya next month. Pictures and videos of the same have been shared online. The stick, that is made from five elements, will be taken to Ayodhya in a Shobha Yatra and it will remain lit for 1.5 months.

Content: Madras High Court has sentenced Tamil Nadu minister K Ponmudy to three years of imprisonment. Ponmudy and his wife P Visalakshi, who are accused of amassing ₹1.79 crore disproportionate to their known sources of income, will also pay ₹50-lakh fine each. The court suspended the sentence for 30 days for Ponmudy as he is currently holding Higher Education Department portfolio.

Sadhguru said, "Hindustan means...the land of Hindus not the land of Hindi language." "Linguistic division of states was done with the wisdom that all languages in [India] will have same status," he added.

He added, "ED should withdraw this summons...It's politically motivated. I've lived my life with honesty." Notably, he's likely to skip ED appearance scheduled for today as he's presently at a Vipassana meditation centre in Punjab.

Content: Jharkhand Assembly again passed a bill that proposes to fix land records of 1932 as basis for domicile in the state. As per the bill, people who've their names or their ancestors' names in land records of 1932 or before will be considered Jharkhand's local inhabitant. Domicile status is mandatory to apply for Class III and Class IV government jobs.

Content: A software engineer from Karnataka has been detained in connection to the Parliament security breach, multiple reports said on Thursday. The engineer, identified as Saikrishna Jagali, is the son of a retired Deputy Superintendent of Police from Karnataka's Bagalkote. The security breach was reported on the anniversary of the 2001 Parliament attack on December 13.

Content: In a shocking incident, a husband beheaded his wife over a delay in serving him his morning tea. The incident happened on Tuesday, December 19, 2023, in Bhojpur village of Ghaziabad. The husband has been taken into custody, and the body of the wife has been sent for a post-mortem.

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: Lok Sabha on Wednesday passed three new criminal law Bills, which made mob lynching a separate offence with death penalty as the maximum punishment. The offence of sedition has been omitted but acts against the nation will be punishable. Terrorism has been defined and included as a separate offence. Community service has been introduced as a form of punishment.

Content: Gurugram Police have deployed drones equipped with specialised optical cameras on Delhi-Gurugram Expressway in an effort to curb rash driving. Content: The Telangana High Court issued an order on Tuesday instructing the State government to take immediate action and install at least one sanitary napkin dispensing machine in every government junior college throughout the state. A bench led by Chief Justice Alok Aradhe and Justice Anil Kumar Jukanti issued the order while hearing a PIL petition.

Author: News Desk
Content: Telangana government on December 20 tabled a white paper in the Assembly stating that the state is drowning in a debt of Rs 6 lakh crore that has gone up from 72,658 crore in 2014-15. According to the white paper, the increase in the debt has created an enormous fiscal stress on the state
Title: White paper on Telangana debt tabled in assembly
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Microbiologist Dr Gagandeep Kang speaks about how a majority of JN.1 infections are expected to be asymptomatic despite ability to spread at a faster rate. Based on the data we have of other variants, this virus is going to continue to evolve, she says, adding, this strain is spreading in the country and it is very likely to infect people.

Author: News Desk
Content: Former deputy mayor of Hyderabad Baba Fasiuddin and former Kondangal Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) MLA Patnam Narender Reddy have been booked by the Kosgi police in the Narayanpet district for allegedly attempting to murder a person for supporting the Congress. The case against the duo, alongside seven named others, was booked in November, ahead of the Telangana Legislative Assembly elections.

Author: News Desk
Content: Telangana on Tuesday reported four COVID-19 cases, director of Public health and family welfare of the state said. The director also appealed to the public to remain cautious amid a recent surge in COVID cases in neighbouring states. Children less than 10 years of age, pregnant women and elders are advised to avoid going outdoors unless mandatory.

bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Medhaa Gupta
Content: Arrested gangster Amritpal Singh was shot dead after he opened fire at police while trying to escape in Punjab's Amritsar. One official was injured in encounter and another narrowly escaped after a bullet pierced his turban, police said. Amritpal was brought to Jandiala Guru to recover hidden narcotics, however, he didn't disclose he also hid a weapon there, police added.

Author: Rupesh
Content: A video showing a crowd around a structure resembling Ayodhya's Ram Temple is now viral falsely claiming that it shows the original temple. BOOM found that it shows a Durga Puja pandal in Kolkata, replicating the temple. The pandal was built by the Santosh Mitra Square Puja Committee this year. The real Ram Temple's inauguration is set for January 2024.
Title: Video Of Kolkata Durga Puja Pandal Viral As Ayodhya Ram Temple
bottom_headline: No, This Video Does Not Show Ram Temple In UP

Author: Rupesh
Content: A video depicting a burqa-clad woman discussing hijab use at a dentist's, claiming she'd only remove it if the dentist closed his eyes during the treatment is revealed as scripted. Shared misleadingly as real, it's from a Kannada TV Vikrama interview. The video, aimed at spreading awareness, features actors Keerthi and Mumthas, debunking false claims about Muslim women's hijab practices.
Title: Scripted Hijab Interview Video Misleads Viewers
bottom_headline: Debunking Scripted Hijab Interview Myths

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: Czech Republic's Justice Ministry said Indian judicial authorities have "no jurisdiction" in the case of Nikhil Gupta, who was charged by US for plotting to kill Khalistani separatist Gurpatwant Pannun, The Indian Express reported. Gupta's family moved Indian Supreme Court alleging he was arrested without a warrant. They also alleged he was forced to eat meat, despite being a vegetarian.

bottom_headline: Gupta was allegedly also denied consular access
bottom_text: SC to hear matter on January 4

Author: FPJ Online Edit
Content: The BKC police have not made any effort to arrest steel magnate Sajjan Jindal in a rape case despite an FIR being filed against him last week. This is in gross violation of the 14-page Standard Operating Procedure laid down by the Bureau of Police Research and Development for the investigation and prosecution in rape cases.
Title: Sajjan Jindal rape: BKC police's delayed FIR under scrutiny
bottom_headline: BKC police's delayed FIR under scrutiny

Author: Daisy Mowke
Content: Twenty cases of COVID-19 sub-variant JN.1 have been found across the country, Indian Express said while citing Indian SARS-CoV-2 Genomics Consortium (INSACOG) data. Of these, 18 have been traced in Goa and one each in Kerala and Maharashtra, it added. India recorded 614 new coronavirus infections, the highest since May 21, according to Union Health Ministry data updated on Wednesday.

Author: Rupesh
Content: Delhi University announced a committee to oversee staff's social media use, sparking protests from teachers' associations. The panel, aimed at promoting responsible online conduct, is seen as an attack on academic freedom and expression. Critics argue it's part of a broader move towards privatisation and self-financing, threatening the essence of academic autonomy.
Title: Delhi University Forms Panel for Staff Social Media

"Deathly silence on Manipur [and] on Parliament security breach. But Rashtrapati Bhavan tweets on mimicry. Priorities. Priorities," she said. She also posted a clip of PM Narendra Modi making gestures, adding, "Mimicry is...art form practised by Masters."

Author: Medhaa Gupta
Content: Mumbai Police have issued preventive orders under Section 144 of Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC) for 30 days from today, that is December 20, 2023 to January 18, 2024. As per the order, it is likely that terrorist and anti-national elements might make use of drones, paragliders, etc, in their attacks and thereby target VVIPs and endanger the general public.

Author: Rupesh
Content: A misleading video circulating on social media suggests Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah reneged on poll promises due to lack of funds. Inspired by the film 'Phir Hera Pheri', the fraudsters set up a company named 'Curative Survey' and cheated several people of at least ₹59 crore. They cheated people under the pretext of doubling their investment within two weeks, officials said.

Content: Rajya Sabha MPs from BJP and its allies were seen standing in the Upper House on Wednesday to show solidarity with Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar, who was mocked by TMC MP Kalyan Banerjee. Author: Rupesh
Content: The Indian government has issued an advisory following the detection of the Covid sub-variant JN.1. Author: Rupesh
Content: Bumble's 2024 dating trends, based on a survey of 25,000 singles, highlight a shift towards self-acceptance and emotional vulnerability. Rejecting the pursuit of perfection, singles now value partners who engage in social issues and prioritize mental health. The trend encourages authenticity, open-hearted masculinity, and 'slow dating', focusing on mental well-being and genuine connections.

Content: The Opposition INDIA bloc will hold a nationwide protest on Friday, 22 December, against the suspension of 141 MPs from Parliament, Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge announced on Tuesday. Content: The Railway Board has sanctioned automatic signalling between Yesvantpur and Arsikere given the surging demand for commuter rail services in Bengaluru and Mysuru divisions. Content: By naming Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge as INDIA bloc’s PM face, Mamata Banerjee may be watching how parties react to the name. A Dalit leader taking on Narendra Modi from an extremely backward class is a credible narrative for the block. Content: On December 19, 2023, the Indian Parliament descended into chaos as 141 Members of Parliament faced suspension, triggering a vigorous debate on democracy, governance, and parliamentary decorum. Author: Sumavarshak
Content: The WHO has declared JN.1 as a separate “variant of interest” from its parent lineage BA.2.86. Despite its rapid spread, the health risk posed by JN.1 is “low”. Studies indicated that vaccines, particularly the XBB.1.5 monovalent vaccine, are likely effective against JN.1.

Content: By opening a new war-front with the Governor, Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan conveys to minorities that he is better equipped than Congress to fight BJP-RSS in 2024. Author: Summit
Content: In 1921, the British laid the foundation for the first Parliament House in India. A century later, in 2020, PM Modi laid the foundation for a new Parliament House. Content: Smt. Pratibha Devi Singh Patil, born in 1934 in Maharashtra, India, was the first woman president of India. In 2007 she became India's 1st woman president which marked a historic milestone in establishing the role of Indian women in politics.

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Several unnecessary hysterectomies are taking place in Karnataka despite the SC and Union government's directive to regulate unnecessary uterus removals.
