The accused complained about running out of fuel faster than expected, after which they were put under watch on suspicion of theft, the FIR said. Containers filled with diesel worth ₹36,000 were recovered from the accused drivers, police said.
Title: Drivers working on bullet train project steal 400 litres of diesel, pics surface
bottom_headline: Drivers were deployed by Larsen & Toubro
bottom_text: L&T had won contract for bullet train project

Author: Disha Jana
Content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday extended his congratulations to Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi on his re-election for the third time. "Look forward to working with you to further deepen India-Egypt Strategic Partnership," PM Modi wrote on X. El-Sisi won the elections with over 89% of the votes and was competing against three other candidates.
Title: PM Modi congratulates El-Sisi as he secures 3rd term as Egypt Prez
bottom_headline: Polling was held between December 10 and 12

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: After alleging that a man with a gun stopped his car in Noida, stand-up comedian Sundeep Sharma told police that it might be a mobile phone, not a gun. "This man was holding a mobile in his hand and suddenly he came in front of my car on the road. Due to which my friend...got scared," Sharma said.
Title: It might be a mobile phone: Comedian Sundeep Sharma on being held at 'gun-point'
bottom_headline: He was travelling with comedian Saurab Pandey

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: While attending an event in Varanasi, PM Narendra Modi asked a woman if she would want to contest elections. Reacting to the woman's speech, the PM said, "You speak so well...have you ever fought elections?" PM Modi asked the woman about her educational qualifications and said his dream is to make 2 crore village women 'lakhpatis'.
Title: Will you fight polls? PM asks woman speaking at event in Varanasi
bottom_headline: Are your kids studying well? PM Modi

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: A diamond merchant from Surat has unveiled a necklace on the theme of the Ram Mandir in Ayodhya, Uttar Pradesh. The necklace was made using 5,000 American diamonds and two kg of silver. It also features idols of Lord Ram, Lord Lakshman, Goddess Sita, and Lord Hanuman. It took 40 artisans a period of 35 days to craft the necklace.
Title: Ram Mandir-themed necklace made using 5,000 diamonds & 2 kg silver in Surat
bottom_headline: 'We want to gift the necklace to the Ram Mandir'
bottom_text: Director of company that made the necklace said

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A picture of a railway track hanging and surrounded by floodwater in Tamil Nadu's Tuticorin has surfaced online. The track was hanging as the ballast has been washed away.  Around 800 passengers were stuck at the Srivaikuntam railway station in the district after the station was surrounded by water on all sides.
Title: Railway track left hanging, surrounded by floodwater in Tamil Nadu, pic surfaces
bottom_headline: The release of surplus water from dams continued

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: A series of earthquakes jolted Ladakh and Jammu and Kashmir within an hour on Monday, according to the National Center for Seismology. Regions in Ladakh were hit by earthquakes of 5.5 magnitude, 3.8 magnitude and 3.4 magnitude between 3.48 pm and 4:44 pm. Meanwhile, regions in Jammu and Kashmir were hit by 4.8 and 3.6-magnitude earthquakes.
Title: 5 earthquakes hit Ladakh and J&K in 1 hour
bottom_headline: Some tremors were felt in nearby states

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: Surveillance has been stepped up in Maharashtra and district health authorities have been directed to evaluate hospital readiness amid a rise in COVID-19 cases in Kerala. "So far, we have not reported any case of JN.1 sub-variant," said Dr Pratapsingh Sarnikar, Joint Director of Health, Communicable Diseases. Isolation wards have been established in government hospitals in Maharashtra.
Title: Surveillance stepped up in Maha as COVID-19 cases rise in Kerala
bottom_headline: Masks to be made mandatory for elderly in K'taka

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: In an advisory issued for states amid rising COVID-19 cases in some states, the Centre advised states to take measures to minimise risk of transmission. "Considering the upcoming festive season, states were advised to put in place requisite public health measures...to minimise risk of increase in transmission of the disease by adherence to maintenance of respiratory hygiene," it stated.
Title: For festive season, states should take steps to reduce COVID-19 risk: Govt as cases rise
bottom_headline: There are 1,828 active COVID-19 cases in India

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: The Centre on Monday asked states to monitor and report district-wise influenza-like illness and severe acute respiratory illness cases in all health facilities on a regular basis. This comes amid rising COVID-19 cases in some parts of the country and the detection of the first case of the new JN.1 variant in Kerala. India reported 260 COVID-19 cases on Monday.
Title: Report influenza-like illness: Centre to states as COVID-19 cases rise
bottom_headline: States advised to increase RT-PCR tests

Author: Mansi Agarwal
Content: Delhi Police have written to Meta to access the social media accounts of the six people arrested in the Parliament security breach case, PTI reported. WhatsApp chats are among the details sought by the police, the report said. Authorities have reportedly also sought details of a now-deleted Facebook page 'Bhagat Singh Fan Page' where the accused allegedly met each other.
Title: Police ask Meta for details of Parliament breach accused: Report
bottom_headline: The breach took place last week

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A total of 78 MPs were suspended from Rajya Sabha and Lok Sabha for creating ruckus on Monday. This is the highest number of MPs suspended from Parliament in a day. Rajya Sabha suspended 45 MPs and Lok Sabha 33 MPs. In 1989, 63 Opposition MPs were suspended from Lok Sabha in a single day during the Budget Session.
Title: 78 MPs suspended from Parliament, highest in a day
bottom_headline: 'Murder of democracy,' said Opposition leaders

Author: Varsha
Content: In a case of road rage, a middle-aged taxi driver was thrashed to death by two cousins in west Delhi area, said an officer, adding that the accused youths have been arrested. According to police, on Sunday evening, at around 5:30 p.m., a road rage incident took place near Tagore Garden Metro Station in the Rajouri Garden police station area.
Title: Delhi Taxi Driver Thrashed to Death; 2 Held for Road Rage
bottom_headline: The car was tracked and the CCTV were examined.

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: The Karnataka High Court on Monday invoked the mythological character Draupadi from the Mahabharata while hearing the case of assault of a woman in Belagavi. "Listen Draupadi! Pick up your weapons; now Govind will not come," the court said. The woman was assaulted, paraded naked, and tied to an electric pole after her son eloped with a girl.
Title: Listen Draupadi, pick up your weapons: HC as woman paraded naked in Karnataka
bottom_headline: It is collective cowardice: HC

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: A hippopotamus in Lucknow's Nawab Wajid Ali Shah Zoological Garden has killed one 40-year-old zoo employee and injured another while they were clearing its cage on Monday. Zoo director Aditi Sharma said an inquiry into the incident is being conducted. The hippopotamus had recently been shifted to the Lucknow zoo from Kanpur, according to reports.
Title: Hippopotamus kills man in Lucknow zoo
bottom_headline: Deceased survived by wife and 2 kids

Author: News Desk
Content: The Auto & Taxi Drivers Association of Hyderabad has launched an ONDC powered ride booking application Yaary. This is perhaps the only application which offers a driver-centric approach to auto-hailing services with plans for further expansion in Hyderabad. With ONDC protocols, drivers are offered complete control over their business operations without any commission fees.
Title: Commission-free ride-hailing app on ONDC launched in Hyderabad
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: The Centre has issued an advisory to states in view of the recent surge in COVID-19 cases in some states and the detection of the first case of the new JN.1 variant. The new variant of COVID-19 was detected in a sample taken from a 79-year-old woman with mild symptoms from Kerala. India reported 260 COVID-19 cases on Monday.
Title: Centre issues advisory to states as new COVID-19 variant JN.1 found in Kerala
bottom_headline: India has 1,828 active COVID-19 cases

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, on Monday, 18 December, said that he will be meeting Prime Minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi on Tuesday, to discuss the drought situation. He will also be meeting the Congress leadership during the visit to discuss preparations for Lok Sabha polls and the appointment of party legislators and workers to state-run boards and corporations.
Title: Siddaramaiah to meet PM on Karnataka drought
bottom_headline: Karnataka announces interim relief for farmers

Author: News Desk
Content: Telangana's Kamareddy district is shaken by a chilling case of suspected serial murders involving six members of a single family, including two minors, orchestrated over a period of two weeks. Police have filed a case into the incident and investigations are underway. Kamareddy SP, Sindhu Sharma, said, We have registered a case. However, no arrests have been made so far.
Title: Telangana: Six of a family killed in bid to usurp house
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: Kerala’s Wayanad district is witnessing a protest, on Monday, 18 December, after the Forest Department captured a tiger, suspected to have killed a dairy farmer 10 days ago. The Forest Department is yet to establish if the same tiger had killed a dairy farmer 10 days ago and yet residents are baying for the big cat's blood.
Title: ‘Man-eater’ of Wayanad captured, locals want tiger killed
bottom_headline: Life in the shadow of sabre-toothed predators

Author: Rachel
Content: A study spanning more than three decades shows that one in five Indian girls marry below the legal age—i.e 18. The rate for boys is one in six. Overall rate of child marriage for girls has declined from 49% in 1993 to 22% in 2021. The rates are highest in Bihar, Bengal, Uttar Pradesh and Maharashtra.
Title: Data on child marriage in India
bottom_headline: The overall rate of child marriage has declined
bottom_text: Read such interesting headlines only on splainer

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A 23-year-old woman was allegedly raped by her husband and his two friends in Mumbai. The husband, who is jobless, allegedly committed the crime as his friends offered him money which he needed to pay house rent. The victim alleged that she was gagged by her husband when the other two men raped her. All the accused have been arrested.
Title: Husband rapes 23-year-old wife with 2 friends for money in Mumbai, arrested
bottom_headline: The couple is married for 5 years & has 2 kids

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Opposition MPs created a ruckus in Rajya Sabha as BJP MP Kanta Kardam noted that a woman was stripped and paraded naked in Karnataka's Belagavi. Amid ruckus, House Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar told MPs, "You're forcing me to name you." Further, he named Congress' Jebi Mather and CPI's Binoy Viswam. Gesturing Viswam to sit down, Dhankhar said, "Mr Binoy Viswam, down."
Title: Mr Binoy Viswam, down: Dhankhar as MPs create ruckus in Parliament
bottom_headline: Dhankhar adjourned the House

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: Underworld don Dawood Ibrahim's aide Chhota Shakeel has dismissed media reports and told CNN-News18 that he is "alive and healthy". Earlier, reports claimed that Dawood, who is on India's most wanted list, has been hospitalised in Karachi after being poisoned by unknown men. It was also reported that he is in hospital amid tight security.
Title: Dawood Ibrahim is alive, healthy: Underworld don's aide Chhota Shakeel on poisoning reports
bottom_headline: Dawood is mastermind of 1993 Mumbai blasts

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: As Opposition MPs created a ruckus in Rajya Sabha, Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar asked them to take their seats. "Don't be agitated. [Congress MP KC] Venugopalji, conserve your energy for the right occasion," Dhankhar said. Further, he claimed some MPs were creating "grave misconduct". Ruckus had erupted as Dhankhar rejected Opposition MP's call to discuss the recent Parliament breach.
Title: Don't be agitated; Venugopalji, save your energy: Dhankhar in RS
bottom_headline: House was briefly adjourned

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: Four people who were arrested for allegedly leaking ICMR data also claimed to have stolen data of the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) and Pakistan's Computerised National Identity Card (CNIC), Indian Express reported. Personal data of more than 81 crore Indians was put on sale on the dark web in October. It was called the biggest data breach in India.
Title: 4 held for India's 'biggest data breach' claim they stole FBI, Pakistan's data too: Report
bottom_headline: '4 men met on a gaming platform, became friends'
bottom_text: They then decided to earn quick money: Report

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: In a shocking incident, a team of health officials found a 22-week-old female foetus in the dustbin of a private hospital in Karnataka. The hospital's owner-cum-doctor, Srinivasa, was arrested along with two nurses, a housekeeping staff, and a technician. Last month, a huge illegal abortion racket that conducted over 900 foeticides was busted in Karnataka's Mysuru and Mandya.
Title: KA Foeticide Scandal: Will Task Force Curb Corrupt Mindsets?
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: 'Pushpa' actor Jagadeesh has confessed to blackmailing a woman with her private pictures before she died by suicide, according to reports. Jagadeesh was taken into custody by Telangana police earlier this month, produced in court and sent to Chanchalguda Central Jail. The woman had died by suicide on November 29, following which her father filed a police complaint.
Title: Actor Jagadeesh admits blackmailing woman with pics before she died by suicide: Report
bottom_headline: He reportedly knew the woman for 5 years

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: Pravina, a resident of Sakdara in Rajasthan's Pali district, fought her way through several turmoils since childhood to become the sarpanch (head of the village) of seven villages by just the age of 19. From having an alcoholic father who died when she was young, to being married off as a minor, here's Pravina's story.
Title: Married Off As A Minor, This School Dropout Became Sarpanch At 19
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: Vicky Jain and Ankita Lokhande's relationship was challenged yet again as Jain confronted his wife, causing her emotional distress. His questioning of their marital bond emerged during their ongoing struggles. The repeated clashes between Vicky and Ankita echo the struggles of any typical couple. However, what stands out is the level of disrespect they show toward each other in anger.
Title: Why Ankita Lokhande, Vicky Jain's Fights Are Irking Housemates
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: In the year 2023, several extraordinary women in the United States made history, breaking barriers and achieving remarkable milestones in their respective fields. From sports and entertainment to politics and activism, these women have left an indelible mark on the fabric of American society. Let's take a closer look at their achievements.
Title: Lookback 2023: 5 Women In The US Who Made History
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: Ayesha Khan made an entrance into the Bigg Boss 17 house as a wild card contestant, with a video introduction highlighting her history with contestant Munawar Faruqui. She revealed her dismay over Faruqui’s behaviour, claiming that he portrayed himself differently off-camera and questioned his sincerity towards women in his life. Here's all we know about actor Ayesha Khan.

Content: Around 800 passengers were stuck at the Srivaikuntam railway station in Tamil Nadu's Thoothukudi district due to flooding amid heavy rains in the state. Content: Over 40 Opposition MPs were suspended from the Rajya Sabha for disrupting proceedings in the House on Monday. The members who have been suspended from the House include Congress' Jairam Ramesh, Randeep Surjewala and KC Venugopal. Earlier in the day, 33 Lok Sabha members were suspended.

Author: Debaroti Adhikary
Content: The government on Monday said that under the Stand Up India Scheme, loans collectively worth around ₹47,073 crore were sanctioned till November 24. The scheme offers loans to women and members of the SC and ST categories to promote entrepreneurship. The government in April had said that over 1.44 lakh loans were already sanctioned to women.
Title: Women, SC, ST entrepreneurs got ₹47,000-cr under Stand Up India
bottom_headline: The scheme was launched in April 2016

Author: News Desk
Content: Five individuals were apprehended by Hyderabad Police in connection with the gangrape of a woman in Tarnaka, Secunderabad, on December 7. The main accused took the victim to a secluded area on the pretext of offering her a ride on his two wheeler. Subsequently, he invited his friends. Following the victim's complaint, the police identified and arrested all accused.
Title: Woman gang-raped in Hyderabad, 5 arrested
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: Thirty Opposition MPs were suspended from Lok Sabha on Monday for the remainder of the Winter Session, while three were suspended pending the report of the Privileges Committee. The members include Congress leader in the House Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury, Gaurav Gogoi, Anto Antony, DMK's A Raja, TR Baalu and Dayanidhi Maran. TMC's Kalyan Banerjee and Saugata Roy were also suspended.
Title: Who are the 33 MPs suspended from Lok Sabha in one day?
bottom_headline: 3 members had climbed on the Speaker's podium

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Haemophilia and Health Collective of North (HHCN), in collaboration with NHM, has proposed guidelines recommending prophylaxis treatment in haemophilia patients to prevent them from bleeding as the standard of care in line with global clinical best practices. The new guidelines underline the need for comprehensive care including timely diagnosis, physiotherapy and multidisciplinary care.
Title: Prophylaxis treatment rules for haemophilia patients

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: The SFI in Kerala on Monday, 18 December, intensified its ongoing battle with Kerala Governor Arif Mohammad Khan by putting up banners against him in colleges across the state. One banner said Khan as Chancellor should be working for the universities and not the Sangh Parivar. The Governor claimed on Sunday this was the handiwork of Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan.
Title: SFI’s anti-Governor banners come up across Kerala colleges
bottom_headline: Collapse of Constitutional machinery: Guv

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Speaking at an interactive session on a book co-authored by him at the Indian School of Business (ISB) in Hyderabad, on Sunday, 17 December, he asked how could the country become a developed one when malnutrition is prevalent. “You must be joking about becoming a developed rich country by 2047 with 35 percent malnutrition today”, he said.
Title: India can’t progress while malnutrition exists: Raghuram Rajan
bottom_headline: Malnutrition cuts across social class in India

Content: The opening portion of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s address at the Kashi Tamil Sangamam in Varanasi was translated real-time using AI for visitors from Tamil Nadu. Content: Ex-MLA Shakil Aamir's son Raheel escaped after crashing his BMW into police barricade in Hyderabad on Christmas Eve. As per a report, Raheel had consumed liquor. Content: Dense fog engulfed Delhi-NCR on Wednesday morning as the visibility dropped to 50 metres, Safdarjung Observatory reported. Content: Most of the around 300 Indian passengers, on the Romania-based Legend Airlines flight that was recently grounded in France, had return tickets, the airline's lawyer told NDTV. The 'donkey flight' to Nicaragua was grounded for days over 'human trafficking' suspicions. "They had hotel reservations and return tickets...I don't know for when...But not for next day," said the lawyer Liliana Bakayoko.

About 17 crimes are registered against him and he was wanted in cases of kidnapping, fraud and online betting, police stated.

Content: The discounts on traffic challans in Telangana, available until January 10, 2024, do not apply to all violations. Yesterday, the Telangana Transport, Roads & Buildings (Tr-I) Department issued Government Order No. 659, providing discounts on pending traffic challans in Telangana from December 26 to January 10, 2024.

Content: A video has shown people stealing chickens from a lorry that crashed amid dense fog on the Agra-Delhi highway in Uttar Pradesh. At least 12 vehicles crashed on the Yamuna Expressway on Wednesday morning, with visuals of the pile-up being widely shared online.

Author: Jay Pandya
Content: 40 more cases of the Covid-19 sub-variant JN.1 were recorded, with the tally of cases of the new variant across India till Dec. 26 rising to 109, official sources told PTI. 36 cases were detected from Gujarat, 34 from Karnataka, 14 from Goa, nine from Maharashtra, 6 from Kerala, 4 each from Rajasthan & Tamil Nadu, and 2 from Telangana.

Author: Varsha
Content: The world clock that a vegetable vendor in Lucknow created can tell the time in nine different nations. Ahead of the Ram temple consecration in Ayodhya on January 22, the vendor has donated the first clock as a sign of respect to the temple. 2018 saw the creation of the world clock by 51-year-old Anil Kumar Sahu.

bottom_headline: He said he got the idea from reading newspapers

Content: Agra Police came across a case where a husband complained of his wife consuming 'gutkha' and spitting it all across their home. Content: The AIADMK urged the DMK government to take legal steps for the premature release of Muslim prisoners who have been in prison for over 20 years. Author: Sumavarshak
Content: As Christmas draws to a close, epicureans of Kerala have cause for celebration. After a prolonged hiatus, their beloved Kuttanadan duck has reclaimed its spot on the festive menu. This absence, a consequence of recurrent bird flu outbreaks compounded by the Covid-19-induced lockdowns, left Christmas platters bereft of the coveted Kuttanadan delicacies — a void keenly felt in Kuttanad.

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: An ammonia gas leak at a fertiliser manufacturing unit in Ennore resulted in several people being hospitalised, official sources said on 27 December. Following the leak, at about 11:45 pm on 26 December, an odour causing discomfort spread across the neighbourhood. Over 25 people in surrounding residential neighbourhoods experienced uneasiness, nausea, faintness, and they were taken to hospital.
Title: Ammonia gas leak at Ennore fertiliser unit; residents hospitalised

Content: As Andhra Pradesh braces for the 2024 Assembly and Lok Sabha elections, the ruling YSRCP may have an ace up its sleeve — albeit a controversial one. Title: Questionable 'official' system accused of voter-profiling in AP

Content: After ammonia gas leaked from an undersea pipeline of Coromandel International Limited in Chennai's Ennore, Tamil Nadu Environment Minister Meyyanathan Siva said the fertiliser manufacturing factory will be shut till further orders. Content: The year 2023 marked a mixed phase for Indian businesses. While some sectors rebounded post-pandemic, others struggled. Key CEOs like T Koshy (ONDC) and Bhavish Aggarwal (Ola Electric) made headlines for positive reasons, whereas Naresh Goyal (Jet Airways) and Hari Om Rai (Lava International) faced legal challenges. Content: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy and Deputy CM Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka urged PM Narendra Modi to accord national-project status to the Palamuru Rangareddy Lift Irrigation Scheme (PRLIS). Author: Swarna Srikanth
Content: Netizens are discussing how, in digital times, consent is often taken for granted violating one's privacy. The topic created a buzz after an X user identified as 'Lolo' clicked a male metro passenger's picture and shared it online, purportedly without taking his permission for it. "Saw this handsome guy in metro, crush updated," she captioned the photo post.

Content: Several pro-Kannada groups including Karnataka Rakshana Vedike held protest in Bengaluru on Thursday demanding immediate implementation of BBMP's order regarding Kannada nameplates. The protestors wearing red and yellow scarves vandalised hotels and tore English signboards. On December 25, BBMP ordered commercial stores in Bengaluru to install 60% Kannada language nameplates by February 28.

Content: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari in a recent conclave said India will see "new freedom" when it no longer imports petrol and diesel. "The import bill for petrol and diesel stands at ₹16 lakh crore now. If we reduce this import, the money...will go to the poor," he said. "Until this import is stopped, terrorism won't stop across world," he added.

Content: Two days after Vikram Simha was accused of illegal felling of hundreds of trees and smuggling wood from a village in Hassan district, his brother and BJP MP Pratap Simha denied these allegations. Content: The BJP in Karnataka was left embarrassed after one of its MLAs, BP Yatnal, alleged irregularities of ₹40,000 crore in Covid-19-related procurement during party senior leader BS Yediyurappa’s tenure as the chief minister. Following Yatnal’s allegation, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah appealed to the Vijayapura City MLA to submit evidence in support of his claim to the Nagamohan Das Committee.

Content: The crime team of the Bahadurpura police in the South Zone of Hyderabad City apprehended two persons in connection with a kidnapping case and rescued a one-and-a-half-year-old girl within five hours. Content: For around 15 girls of Indaragi, school is a memory of good times, snatched away before they could soak in it. Content: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday met Bajrang Punia and other wrestlers amid a row over the now-suspended Wrestling Federation of India (WFI). Rahul met with the wrestlers at the Virender Arya Akhara in Haryana's Jhajjar, with visuals of the meeting being shared online. "He (Rahul) came to see our wrestling routine...He did wrestling," said Punia.

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Ex-MLA Shakil Aamir's son Raheel escaped after crashing his BMW into police barricade in Hyderabad on Christmas Eve. As per a report, Raheel had consumed liquor. Later, an SHO was suspended for falsely implicating another person after FIR was registered against a man who works for Raheel's family. In 2022, Raheel was sitting in a car which killed a toddler.

bottom_headline: He was with friends during the recent accident

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: Dense fog engulfed Delhi-NCR on Wednesday morning as the visibility dropped to 50 metres, Safdarjung Observatory reported. Meanwhile, Delhi Airport issued an advisory stating that while landing and takeoffs continue, flights not compliant with CAT III (Category III) standards may face disruptions. Several trains were cancelled due to foggy conditions in the national capital, reported PTI.
Title: Dense fog in Delhi-NCR brings down visibility to 50 metres; pics surface

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: Most of the around 300 Indian passengers, on the Romania-based Legend Airlines flight that was recently grounded in France, had return tickets, the airline's lawyer told NDTV. The 'donkey flight' to Nicaragua was grounded for days over 'human trafficking' suspicions. "They had hotel reservations and return tickets...I don't know for when...But not for next day," said the lawyer Liliana Bakayoko.
Title: Most flyers on 'donkey flight' grounded in France had return tickets: Airline's lawyer
bottom_headline: 'Client was responsible for checking papers'
bottom_text: They had hired the plane, crew: Lawyer

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: The Israeli National Security Council (INSC) has issued a travel advisory for its citizens in India following an explosion near Israeli embassy in Delhi on Tuesday. Calling it a "possible terror attack", the INSC warned Israeli nationals against visiting crowded places and openly displaying Israeli symbols in India. It also told Israelis to avoid posting travel itineraries and pictures online.
Title: Israel calls blast near embassy in India 'likely terror attack', issues travel advisory
bottom_headline: 'Incident being probed by local authorities'

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: EAM Jaishankar said that while there have been ups and downs in relationships between all countries, the only constant in global politics has been the ties between India and Russia. He also emphasised that countries only cooperate with those with whom they have a “high degree” of trust. He confirmed that he will hold a meeting with his Russian counterpart.
Title: India-Russia relationship the only constant in world politics
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: In a joint operation at Panzu and Gamiraj in Pulwama district, the Indian Army and J-K Police arrested three individuals with two pistols and other war-like stores. According to the information from the Chinar Corps, a Joint Cordon & Search Operation was launched by the Indian Army. Jammu and Kashmir Police at Panzu and Gamiraj in Pulwama on Dec 25.
Title: J-K: Indian Army recover arms, arrest three in Pulwama

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: The Chief of Naval staff, Admiral R Hari Kumar on Tuesday introduced the Indian Navy’s latest stealth-guided missile destroyer ‘INS Imphal’. The first warship to have been named after a city from the northeast. Warship Imphal, which can fire extended-range supersonic BrahMos missiles, was commissioned into the Indian Navy in Mumbai in the presence of Defence Minister Rajnath Singh.
Title: “INS Imphal, India’s first warship named after northeast city
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Anmol Sharma
Content: Conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar's WhatsApp messages to actress Jacqueliene Fernandez from jail have been leaked. In one of the messages, he told Jacqueliene a prominent filmmaker will approach her soon as part of a "deal" with him. In another message, he asked Jacqueliene to wear a "black kurta" for "court date". "You are going to be a superstar," read another message.
Title: Wear black kurta for court date: Sukesh to Jacqueliene in leaked WhatsApp chats from jail
bottom_headline: Sukesh is main accused in ₹200-cr extortion case

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A man ran over a couple after a fight broke out between them at a party in Jaipur, Rajasthan, on Tuesday. The girl was declared dead when she was rushed to a hospital, while the man was injured. The accused, who was allegedly drunk, passed comments on the girl, which led to the fight.
Title: Couple run over by man after fight at party, girl dies in Jaipur
bottom_headline: Visuals from the spot have surfaced

Content: Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw shared a video showing the look and features of the first Amrit Bharat train and wrote, "Amrit Bharat train of Amrit Kaal." He said the train will save at least two hours on long routes due to its advanced technology and improved acceleration. "Every seat has charging points...The train features newly designed toilets," he added.

Content: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has announced a three-year age relaxation for candidates applying for recruitment of 60,244 police constables in the state. Yogi Adityanath on X said, "Your government is fully committed to interests of youth and their bright future." The application process for the recruitment would begin on December 27 and continue till January 16.

Content: Actor Jay Bhanushali has criticised Akasa Air after his flight from Goa to Mumbai was delayed by three hours without any communication. "Dear Akasa Air, just wanted to wish you get well soon, because mismanagement is the second name of Akasa airline...You have lost me as a customer," he said. The airline said the delay was due to bad weather.

Content: A 40-year-old Gujarati film actor and producer has been arrested for allegedly molesting a 17-year-old girl at a hotel in Mumbai. As per reports, the accused committed the crime on the pretext of offering the girl an opportunity to work in a film. A case has been registered against him under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act.

Content: A letter addressed to the Israeli ambassador has been found near the country's embassy in Delhi where a blast was reported on Tuesday evening. As per reports, the letter is typed and "abusive" in nature. The embassy has confirmed that a blast was reported near its premises in Chanakyapuri area at around 5.10 pm.

Content: A four-year-old boy, who was kidnapped and sold for around ₹3 lakh to a couple, was rescued on Christmas in Jharkhand's Hazaribag district. Six people have been arrested in this connection. The couple who bought him allegedly wanted a child. A Special Investigation Team was formed to trace the boy.

bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: The Israel Embassy has confirmed that a blast was reported near its premises in Chanakyapuri area at around 5.10 pm on Tuesday. "Delhi Police and the security team are still investigating the situation," it added. The police team present at the spot said that they have not found any explosives so far.
Title: Israel Embassy confirms blast near its premises in Delhi
bottom_headline: Search operation is still on

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Kamal Kishore, a 24-year-old employee of the Karachi Bakery in Hyderabad, succumbed to burns sustained when a fire broke out in the establishment's baking unit earlier this month. The police said Kishore died on Monday, the day on which three others were discharged from hospital. Several people suffered burns in the incident. Five employees were hospitalised with 60% burns.
Title: Karachi Bakery employee succumbs to burns
bottom_headline: 15 workers of Karachi Bakery injured in blaze

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: The revenue collection at Sabarimala crossed ₹200 crore as the first leg of the two-month-long annual pilgrimage season is set to end with the Mandala Puja on Wednesday. The TDB said that the temple received ₹204.30 crore as revenue in 39 days till Monday. Board president PS Prashanth said the revenue would increase after coins received as “kanikka” were counted.
Title: Sabarimala revenue crosses ₹200 crore
bottom_headline: Police prepare for crowd management

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: Raghuram Rajan in a recent podcast interview revealed that his annual salary as RBI Governor was ₹4 lakh. He said the biggest perk was the house. "You get a really big house...a few blocks away from Dhirubhai Ambani's house in Mumbai," Rajan revealed. He further said that according to his earlier calculations the house would sell for around ₹450 crore.
Title: My yearly salary was ₹4 lakh as RBI Governor, biggest perk was the house: Rajan
bottom_headline: Rajan served as RBI Governor from 2013 to 2016
bottom_text: Tap here to know what more he said

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Indian scientists have made an important discovery on how tuberculosis bacteria can stay undetected inside a person’s body for many years. Disease-causing bacteria, Mycobacterium tuberculosis, hides in deep oxygen-limiting pockets of the lung and remains in dormancy without dividing and metabolically inactive. This helps it to hide from the immune system and TB drugs, the IISc researchers found
Title: Indian scientists find how TB bacteria remain undetected
bottom_headline: India's 1st MDR test in TB elimination program

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: A meeting of Karnataka Cabinet sub-committee and Technical Advisory Committee decided to implement a slew of measures to check Covid-19. It made a seven-day isolation mandatory for Covid-19 positive patients. Hospitals have been to set up exclusive Covid-19 wards. All employers were told to provide seven day's leave for those in home isolation.
Title: COVID19: Karnataka makes 7-day isolation mandatory
bottom_headline: Additional public health risk by JN.1 is low

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: On Tuesday, Minister Kiren Rijiju called for setting up more observatories for better forecasts. He was speaking against the backdrop of unprecedented torrential rains that pummelled Tamil Nadu. Rijiju said there were no measures to prevent heavy downpours that Tamil Nadu receive in December. As many as 31 people were killed in rain-related incidents in the state's southern districts.
Title: More observatories needed for better forecast: Kiren Rijju
bottom_headline: Minister Thangaraj questions performance of IMD

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah will reach Hyderabad on 28 December to formulate the BJP's strategies for the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. The party is upbeat over its increased vote share in the Assembly elections and hopes to win seven to eight Lok Sabha seats. Shah's roadmap for the party might include a Telangana-specific narrative to connect with the people.
Title: BJP hopes to win 8 LS seats in Telangana
bottom_headline: Bandi likely to return as T'gana BJP chief

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: The Delhi Police on Tuesday received a call about a blast near the Israel Embassy in the Chanakyapuri area but did not find any explosive. "So far, nothing has been found at the location," said Delhi Fire Services Director Atul Garg. A crude bomb went off near the embassy of Israel in January 2021.
Title: No explosive found: Police after receiving call about blast near Israel Embassy in Delhi
bottom_headline: More details are awaited

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: The government has shared the number of followers on PM Narendra Modi's different social media accounts and said, "Once again it is proven, PM Narendra Modi is the ultimate Social Media sensation!" "He is now the first world leader whose YouTube channel has crossed 2 crore subscribers," it added. He's the most followed leader on Instagram with 8.3 crore followers.
Title: Govt calls PM Modi ‘social media sensation’, shares number of his social media followers
bottom_headline: PM Modi most popular world leader on FB: Govt

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: 'Donkey route' is an illegal immigration method used to enter countries like the US, UK and Canada. It's used by thousands of Indians and is risky and expensive as it involves multiple stops in other countries. Flights to Nicaragua (like the one that was grounded in France) or other countries, where obtaining travel documents is easy, are called 'donkey flights'.
Title: What is the illegal 'donkey route' method used to immigrate to other countries?
bottom_headline: 'Donkey flight' landed in Mumbai on Tuesday
bottom_text: It was stopped for suspected human trafficking

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: As a huge number of people reached Himachal Pradesh for New Year celebrations, CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu said that drunk tourists will be sent back to their hotels, not jails. "I urge all the tourists to follow rules and regulations," he added. Thousands of tourists have reached Shimla, Manali, and Lahaul and Spiti in the state for celebrations.
Title: Drunk tourists will be sent back to hotels: Himachal CM Sukhu amid festive rush
bottom_headline: Want to promote tourism in the state: CM

Author: Rupesh
Content: In 2023, the Supreme Court of India delivered significant judgments, including 18 by Constitution Benches. Key rulings covered demonetization, free speech for politicians, UAPA membership, EC member selection, marriage breakdown as divorce grounds, Delhi governance, and J&K's special status. The court balanced case disposal with impactful decisions, shaping India's legal landscape.
Title: SC's Landmark 2023 Judgments: A Year of Decisive Rulings
bottom_headline: 2023: A Pivotal Year for India's SC

Author: Rupesh
Content: A fabricated screenshot falsely claims Kapil Sibal threatened suicide over the Ram Mandir construction. BOOM's investigation found no credible evidence of such a statement. The claim resurfaces as the temple's consecration nears, but searches, including archived tweets, debunk it. Sibal's past statements which show respect counter the fake narrative.
Title: Fake Sibal Tweet on Ram Mandir Debunked
bottom_headline: Debunking Kapil Sibal's Fake Tweet

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: Mumbai Police launched an investigation after RBI received a threat email on Tuesday, claiming 11 bombs had been planted in different locations in Mumbai. The mail demanded resignations from RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das and Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. Police said they went to all these places and investigated but did not find anything.
Title: RBI gets bomb threat demanding FM Sitharaman's resignation, Mumbai Police launch probe
bottom_headline: 'Case has been registered, probe is underway'

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: The tiger that had wandered into a village in UP's Pilibhit, causing a massive crowd of spectators to gather, has been tranquilised and captured after around 10 hours. A video showing Forest Department officials capturing the tiger and putting it in a cage went viral. The tiger was earlier seen resting on the wall of a house.
Title: Tiger tranquilised and caught after entering village in UP, video goes viral
bottom_headline: Tiger wandered in from Pilibhit Tiger Reserve

Author: Debaroti Adhikary
Content: A sessions court has overturned summons issued by magistrate in June to Indian unit of Chinese smartphone company Huawei, its CEO and other top executives in a case filed by the Income Tax department. The court said summoning "is a serious matter and should not be done mechanically". The court added the magistrate "got swayed away" with IT department's perspective.
Title: Court overturns summons to Huawei India in case filed by IT dept
bottom_headline: IT dept alleged Huawei India evaded taxes

Author: Gaurav Bhargava
Content: On November 1, 2023, the Kerala government had also filed a writ petition in the Supreme Court challenging the inaction of the governor of Kerala, Arif Mohammad Khan, on various Bills pending before him for assent. The petition had contended that the actions of the governor were threatening the basic foundations of our Constitution.
Title: Article 200 of the Constitution and the powers of the governor

Content: A video has surfaced on social media that shows rats running on the beds of patients at Rampur District Hospital, Uttar Pradesh. In the video, the patients can be seen sleeping on the beds with blankets while the rats are moving near them. A similar incident was reported at an Aligarh hospital where rats were seen running on the floor.
Title: Rats seen running on patients' beds in UP hospital, video surfaces
bottom_headline: There was no immediate reaction from hospital

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: Restrictions have been imposed in Bengaluru for New Year's celebrations. Bengaluru Police Commissioner B Dayananda said vehicular movement will be restricted on Brigade Road on December 31. He added pub owners have been directed to collect KYC details from customers. MG Road metro station will be closed from 11 PM to 2 AM to avoid stampede-like situation on December 31.

bottom_headline: Additional CCTVs to be installed on Dec 31

Content: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav celebrated Christmas with his family on Monday. A video showed him dancing with his nine-month-old daughter Katyayani to Christmas tune with a Christmas tree and a dummy Santa in background. Rachel Godinho, who was renamed Rajshree Yadav after marrying Tejashwi, was also seen dancing with Katyayani. Tejashwi's mother, ex-CM Rabri Devi, was also seen celebrating.
Title: Tejashwi celebrates Xmas with Rabri, dances with 9-month-old daughter
bottom_headline: 'A wish for happiness, warmth, love and light'

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: A woman died and 135 other people were hospitalised for suspected food poisoning after consuming the prasad (offering) at a temple in Bengaluru. Police said that an investigation for the exact cause of the incident is still underway, but they suspect that the temple in Hoskote, Bengaluru Rural district, offered unsanitary prasad, leaving the devotees severely ill.
Title: Bengaluru woman dies after eating prasad; 135 people sick
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: Reacting to CPI(M)'s decision not to attend the Ram Temple event in January, Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi said, "Those called by Lord Ram will only reach (Ayodhya)." CPI(M) general secretary Sitaram Yechury said he had received an invitation to attend the event but won't and accused the Centre of mixing politics with religious beliefs.

Content: Former CM of J&K Farooq Abdullah on Tuesday called for talks between India and Pakistan. "If we do not resolve it through talks, I'm sorry to say that we will face the same situation as happening with Palestinians in Gaza who are being bombarded every day," he added. He said if we have friendly relations with neighbours, both will prosper.

bottom_headline: Why are we not ready for talks: Abdullah

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: PM Narendra Modi has become the first world leader to cross 2 crore subscribers on YouTube. His channel has more than 23,000 videos with over 453 crore views in total. PM Modi's YouTube channel had crossed 1 crore subscribers in February last year. In comparison, US President Joe Biden has 7.94 lakh subscribers, while Volodymyr Zelenskyy has 11 lakh subscribers.
Title: PM Modi becomes 1st world leader to cross 2 crore subscribers on YouTube
bottom_headline: Most seen video on PM's channel has 7.5 cr views

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: During an interview, SP MP Shafiqur Rahman Barq said he won't attend inauguration of Ram Mandir in Ayodhya. The temple is being built where Babri Masjid once stood, he stated, claiming this is against the law, the Constitution and humanity. "I pray to Allah, that the Babri Masjid which was snatched from us be given back to us," he added.
Title: Allah, may we get back the Babri Masjid snatched from us: SP MP

Author: News Desk
Content: Telangana's Transport Department issued GO No. 659, offering discounts on pending traffic challans from Dec 26 to Jan 10, 2024. Discounts include 80% for two-wheelers, 90% for TSRTC buses, and 60% for other vehicles. Payment via the e-challan website entitles users to avail these discounts based on vehicle categories.
Title: Telangana issues GO on discount on traffic challans
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: India's standing in the Global Hunger Index (GHI) for 2023 is nothing short of a dire catastrophe. The numbers paint a grim picture, revealing a situation that demands urgent decisive action. With this stagnant reality laid bare, the question remains: how do we rewrite this narrative of hunger, and finally turn the tide for those who need it most?
Title: Why India’s fight against hunger remains in dire catastrophe

Content: Dense fog enveloping Hyderabad is causing visibility challenges for city commuters. Yesterday, the Hyderabad airport diverted a dozen flights due to the prevailing weather conditions. Content: The online sale of tickets for the Sunburn music festival on New Year Eve in Hyderabad has been stopped after Cyberabad police booked a case for selling the tickets without obtaining police permission for the event. Author: News Desk
Content: India, the worlds largest energy consumer, for the first time in history paid the United Arab Emirates in rupees for the purchase of crude oil. It was a strategic step to improve the rupee's global standing and gradually phase out dependence on the petrodollar. Moreover, India also plans to establish similar deals with other suppliers and promote rupee internationalisation.
Title: In a first, India pays in rupee to buy crude oil from UAE

Content: An engagement ceremony that is believed to have taken place in November turned vile when guests from the boy's side of the family complained as there was no mutton bone marrow present on the non-vegetarian menu. Content: After two commercial ships, MV Chem Pluto and MV Sai Baba, were attacked last week, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said, "We will find those who executed recent attacks on merchant navy ships even from depths of seas and take strict action." bottom_text: MV Sai Baba was attacked in Red Sea

Author: Rupesh
Content: A digitally altered Toronto Sun report falsely claimed human faeces were found near a Hanuman statue in Brampton. Author: Rupesh
Content: In Jharkhand's Latehar district, local communities face severe climate challenges. With national and state plans overlooking these areas, grassroots initiatives emerge as crucial. The Birjia tribe, battling extreme heat and water scarcity, exemplifies the need for localized adaptation strategies in the face of inadequate government support and complex bureaucratic processes.
Title: Local Initiatives: A Key in Climate Change Adaptation
bottom_headline: Grassroots Action in Climate Adaptation

Author: Rupesh
Content: In 2023, India's government extended the PMGKAY scheme, providing free foodgrains to over 800 million people. Despite economic growth, many Indians struggle to afford a healthy diet. Experts urge expanding PMGKAY coverage, citing rising inflation and stagnant wages. The scheme's integration with NFSA reduces foodgrain quantity for priority households, highlighting the need for increased support.
Title: Govt Urged to Boost Free Foodgrain Coverage in 2023
bottom_headline: Expanding Food Aid: A 2023 Priority

Author: Rupesh
Content: In 2023, India faced health challenges from lifestyle diseases, TB & climate change. COVID-19 no longer a global emergency, focus shifted to noncommunicable diseases like heart disease, diabetes & cancer alongside TB's high incidence. Climate change exacerbated health issues with rising temperatures & pollution levels. Efforts included improving routine immunization & expanding healthcare access.
Title: 2023: India's Health Battled TB, Climate & Lifestyle Diseases
bottom_headline: Health in 2023: TB, NCDs, Climate Impact

Content: Actor Dino Morea on Tuesday shared pictures of the Christmas event he attended at PM Narendra Modi's house in Delhi on Monday. Author: Rupesh
Content: A viral screenshot claimed Arvind Kejriwal, in a 2012 X (then Twitter) post criticized leaders for evading ED and CBI summons. BOOM found that the screenshot is fabricated. "Dear Akasa Air, just wanted to wish you get well soon, because mismanagement is the second name of Akasa airline...You have lost me as a customer," he said. The airline said the delay was due to bad weather.
Title: You've lost me as a customer: Jay Bhanushali to Akasa Air after being stuck in Goa
bottom_headline: An SMS & email has been sent: Airline

Author: Anmol Sharma
Content: A 40-year-old Gujarati film actor and producer has been arrested for allegedly molesting a 17-year-old girl at a hotel in Mumbai. As per reports, the accused committed the crime on the pretext of offering the girl an opportunity to work in a film. A case has been registered against him under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act.
Title: 40-year-old Gujarati actor-producer molests 17-year-old girl in Mumbai hotel, arrested
bottom_headline: Further investigation is underway

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A letter addressed to the Israeli ambassador has been found near the country's embassy in Delhi where a blast was reported on Tuesday evening. As per reports, the letter is typed and "abusive" in nature. The embassy has confirmed that a blast was reported near its premises in Chanakyapuri area at around 5.10 pm.
Title: Abusive letter found near Israel Embassy in Delhi after blast: Reports
bottom_headline: A search team is on the spot

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A four-year-old boy, who was kidnapped and sold for around ₹3 lakh to a couple, was rescued on Christmas in Jharkhand's Hazaribag district. Six people have been arrested in this connection. The couple who bought him allegedly wanted a child. A Special Investigation Team was formed to trace the boy.
Title: 4-year-old boy kidnapped & sold for ₹3 lakh, rescued on Christmas in Jharkhand
bottom_headline: 6 mobile phones were found from the accused

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: Delhi Police on Tuesday received a call that a blast had been carried out near the Israel Embassy in the Chanakyapuri area this evening. However, officials said that nothing as such was found at the spot of the incident. The call was received by the Delhi Fire Services at around 6 pm.
Title: Delhi Police receives call of ‘blast’ near Israel Embassy
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: The Israel Embassy has confirmed that a blast was reported near its premises in Chanakyapuri area at around 5.10 pm on Tuesday. "Delhi Police and the security team are still investigating the situation," it added. The police team present at the spot said that they have not found any explosives so far.
Title: Israel Embassy confirms blast near its premises in Delhi
bottom_headline: Search operation is still on

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Kamal Kishore, a 24-year-old employee of the Karachi Bakery in Hyderabad, succumbed to burns sustained when a fire broke out in the establishment's baking unit earlier this month. The police said Kishore died on Monday, the day on which three others were discharged from hospital. Several people suffered burns in the incident. Five employees were hospitalised with 60% burns.
Title: Karachi Bakery employee succumbs to burns
bottom_headline: 15 workers of Karachi Bakery injured in blaze

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: The revenue collection at Sabarimala crossed ₹200 crore as the first leg of the two-month-long annual pilgrimage season is set to end with the Mandala Puja on Wednesday. The TDB said that the temple received ₹204.30 crore as revenue in 39 days till Monday. Board president PS Prashanth said the revenue would increase after coins received as “kanikka” were counted.
Title: Sabarimala revenue crosses ₹200 crore
bottom_headline: Police prepare for crowd management

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: Raghuram Rajan in a recent podcast interview revealed that his annual salary as RBI Governor was ₹4 lakh. He said the biggest perk was the house. "You get a really big house...a few blocks away from Dhirubhai Ambani's house in Mumbai," Rajan revealed. He further said that according to his earlier calculations the house would sell for around ₹450 crore.
Title: My yearly salary was ₹4 lakh as RBI Governor, biggest perk was the house: Rajan
bottom_headline: Rajan served as RBI Governor from 2013 to 2016
bottom_text: Tap here to know what more he said

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Indian scientists have made an important discovery on how tuberculosis bacteria can stay undetected inside a person’s body for many years. Disease-causing bacteria, Mycobacterium tuberculosis, hides in deep oxygen-limiting pockets of the lung and remains in dormancy without dividing and metabolically inactive. This helps it to hide from the immune system and TB drugs, the IISc researchers found
Title: Indian scientists find how TB bacteria remain undetected
bottom_headline: India's 1st MDR test in TB elimination program

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: A meeting of Karnataka Cabinet sub-committee and Technical Advisory Committee decided to implement a slew of measures to check Covid-19. It made a seven-day isolation mandatory for Covid-19 positive patients. Hospitals have been to set up exclusive Covid-19 wards. All employers were told to provide seven day's leave for those in home isolation.
Title: COVID19: Karnataka makes 7-day isolation mandatory
bottom_headline: Additional public health risk by JN.1 is low

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: On Tuesday, Minister Kiren Rijiju called for setting up more observatories for better forecasts. He was speaking against the backdrop of unprecedented torrential rains that pummelled Tamil Nadu. Rijiju said there were no measures to prevent heavy downpours that Tamil Nadu receive in December. As many as 31 people were killed in rain-related incidents in the state's southern districts.
Title: More observatories needed for better forecast: Kiren Rijju
bottom_headline: Minister Thangaraj questions performance of IMD

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah will reach Hyderabad on 28 December to formulate the BJP's strategies for the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. The party is upbeat over its increased vote share in the Assembly elections and hopes to win seven to eight Lok Sabha seats. Shah's roadmap for the party might include a Telangana-specific narrative to connect with the people.
Title: BJP hopes to win 8 LS seats in Telangana
bottom_headline: Bandi likely to return as T'gana BJP chief

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: The Delhi Police on Tuesday received a call about a blast near the Israel Embassy in the Chanakyapuri area but did not find any explosive. "So far, nothing has been found at the location," said Delhi Fire Services Director Atul Garg. A crude bomb went off near the embassy of Israel in January 2021.
Title: No explosive found: Police after receiving call about blast near Israel Embassy in Delhi
bottom_headline: More details are awaited

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: The government has shared the number of followers on PM Narendra Modi's different social media accounts and said, "Once again it is proven, PM Narendra Modi is the ultimate Social Media sensation!" "He is now the first world leader whose YouTube channel has crossed 2 crore subscribers," it added. He's the most followed leader on Instagram with 8.3 crore followers.
Title: Govt calls PM Modi ‘social media sensation’, shares number of his social media followers
bottom_headline: PM Modi most popular world leader on FB: Govt

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: 'Donkey route' is an illegal immigration method used to enter countries like the US, UK and Canada. It's used by thousands of Indians and is risky and expensive as it involves multiple stops in other countries. Flights to Nicaragua (like the one that was grounded in France) or other countries, where obtaining travel documents is easy, are called 'donkey flights'.
Title: What is the illegal 'donkey route' method used to immigrate to other countries?
bottom_headline: 'Donkey flight' landed in Mumbai on Tuesday
bottom_text: It was stopped for suspected human trafficking

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: As a huge number of people reached Himachal Pradesh for New Year celebrations, CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu said that drunk tourists will be sent back to their hotels, not jails. "I urge all the tourists to follow rules and regulations," he added. Thousands of tourists have reached Shimla, Manali, and Lahaul and Spiti in the state for celebrations.
Title: Drunk tourists will be sent back to hotels: Himachal CM Sukhu amid festive rush
bottom_headline: Want to promote tourism in the state: CM

Author: Rupesh
Content: In 2023, the Supreme Court of India delivered significant judgments, including 18 by Constitution Benches. Key rulings covered demonetization, free speech for politicians, UAPA membership, EC member selection, marriage breakdown as divorce grounds, Delhi governance, and J&K's special status. The court balanced case disposal with impactful decisions, shaping India's legal landscape.
Title: SC's Landmark 2023 Judgments: A Year of Decisive Rulings
bottom_headline: 2023: A Pivotal Year for India's SC

Author: Rupesh
Content: A fabricated screenshot falsely claims Kapil Sibal threatened suicide over the Ram Mandir construction. BOOM's investigation found no credible evidence of such a statement. The claim resurfaces as the temple's consecration nears, but searches, including archived tweets, debunk it. Sibal's past statements which show respect counter the fake narrative.
Title: Fake Sibal Tweet on Ram Mandir Debunked
bottom_headline: Debunking Kapil Sibal's Fake Tweet

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: A Chhattisgarh woman who was sold to a Haryana-based man by her cousin sister at 16, and raped and tortured by the man and his father, has escaped after five years, police said. The woman was sold to the accused for ₹2 lakh. She was forced to marry him and repeatedly raped by him and his father over years.
Title: Woman sold at 16 & raped by man & his father in Haryana, escapes after 5 yrs
bottom_headline: Woman gave birth to baby boy
bottom_text: FIR filed against her cousin, 2 accused

Author: Ankush Verma
Content: Delhi's Palam and Haryana's Bhiwani recorded dense fog (50 meter visibility) on Tuesday, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD). Very dense fog (visibility 25 meter) was recorded in Haryana's Ambala, Hisar and Karnal, and Punjab's Amritsar, Ludhiana and Patiala. Meanwhile, Hisar saw a minimum temperature of 7°C and Ludhiana recorded minimum temperature of 7.2°C.
Title: Which places in India recorded dense and very dense fog today?
bottom_headline: For more updates from the IMD

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: A few people were injured when a makeshift bridge constructed as part of Christmas celebrations at Poovar in Thiruvananthapuram collapsed on Monday night. A senior police officer said seven to eight persons were injured and one of them, a woman, sustained a major leg fracture. The bridge slanted to one side when more people exceeding its capacity stepped onto it.
Title: Several injured as temporary Kerala bridge collapses
bottom_headline: Midnight masses, festivities mark Christmas

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Karnataka MLC BK Hariprasad recently said those labelling the Congress the “Tipu Sultan party” were mere “bootlickers of the British”. He challenged the BJP to name a single person from Hindutva outfits who had sacrificed for the nation during the freedom movement. Union Minister Pralhad Joshi hit back, saying “Hariprasad is being treated worse than boots in his party.”
Title: K'taka Congress MLC's 'British bootlickers' jibe at RSS sparks row
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Gaurav Bhargava
Content: YESTERDAY, the Chief Minister of Karnataka Siddaramaiah gave a signal that the Order banning the hijab in educational institutions in Karnataka will be withdrawn. When the hijab ban was imposed on pre-university students in Udupi, Karnataka early last year, it had led to a lot of hue and cry. Educational institutions were closed indefinitely in the district.
Title: Has the Karnataka hijab ban, began with a bang, ended in a whimper
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: The BRS’s initial hesitation in contesting the Singareni Collieries Company trade union polls may cost the Telangana Boggu Gani Karmika Sangham dearly. The BRS felt its affiliated union was not fit to contest the polls and to avoid a successive electoral defeat, decided to stay away from the election, but later succumbed to pressure from the trade union.
Title: Singareni Collieries: Pro-BRS TU on a sticky wicket ahead of poll
bottom_headline: KTR releases ‘Swedha Patram’

Author: Gaurav Bhargava
Content: THE government of the north Indian state of Uttar Pradesh has recently launched the Safe City project to ensure safety of women. The project comes with conditions such as installation of CCTV cameras to identify crime hotspots, monitoring of coaching institutes to identify potential troublemakers and most inexplicably, prohibition of late-evening classes for women and girls.
Title: ‘Safe City’ project by UP government: Rhetoric of protectionism
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union Ministers Smriti Irani and Anurag Thakur attended 'Veer Baal Diwas' at Bharat Mandapam in Delhi on Tuesday. The programme aimed to educate citizens, especially the young children, about the life stories and sacrifices of Sahibzades. 'Veer Baal Diwas' marks the martyrdom of Guru Gobind Singh's sons, Sahibzadas Zorawar Singh and Fateh Singh.
Title: PM Modi, Irani, Anurag Thakur attend 'Veer Baal Diwas' in Delhi
bottom_headline: PM flagged off a march-past

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: President Droupadi Murmu on Monday, 25 December, gave assent to the the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, and Bharatiya Sakshya Bills turning them into laws. Parliament cleared the Bills last week to overhaul the criminal justice system by defining various offences and punishments. They will replace the IPC, the CrPC and the Indian Evidence Act.
Title: President Murmu gives assent to criminal justice Bills
bottom_headline: Watershed moment in history, says PM Modi

Author: Rupesh Pandit
Content: India's GDP grew by 7.8% in the first quarter, falling short of the RBI's 8% prediction. Last year's Q1 growth was 13.1%, showing a significant decrease. Key sectors like real estate and finance saw growth, but the overall figure reflects a deviation from the government's bullish outlook. The article discusses implications and expert insights on these figures.
Title: India's Q1 GDP at 7.8%, Below Expectations
bottom_headline: India's GDP Growth: Below Forecasts

Author: Gaurav Bhargava
Content: Tamil filmmaker Karthik Subbaraj tells the story of tribals who fought for their land in Tamil Nadu in the 1970s in a Quentin Tarantino style. AS the final reels of Karthik Subbaraj Jigarthanda Double X flicker by, Raghavendra Lawrence, the South Indian choreographer-turned-actor, delivers a speech as Alliyan Caesar that resonates with the raw truth.
Title: Jigarthanda Double X confronts tribal land struggle
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: The number of active COVID-19 cases rose to 4,170 on Tuesday as 412 new infections were reported in the last 24 hours, government data shows. Among states, Karnataka saw the highest single-day jump as 92 fresh cases were reported. Maharashtra, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh and Rajasthan reported 15, 9, 6 and 5 cases respectively. Delhi's tally increased by 3.
Title: Which states saw jump in COVID-19 cases as India logged 412 cases in last 24 hrs?
bottom_headline: Kerala reported a dip of 32 cases
bottom_text: Tap to see the entire list

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: After Jacqueliene Fernandez called Sukesh Chandrashekhar's letters to her "threatening and intimidating", the jailed conman said the claims were "false". "I am ready to undergo any punishment if even one single letter sent to Jacqueliene proves or covers my content that is threatening," said Sukesh. Jacqueliene had sought to restrain Sukesh from releasing any more letters addressed to her.
Title: Ready for any punishment if any letter to Jacqueliene is found to be threatening: Sukesh
bottom_headline: 'Letters are unsolicited'

Author: News Desk
Content: Hyderabads gearing up for its 83rd Numaish starting Jan 1 to Feb 15! Its not just shopping it's a mix of business and fun, expecting a whopping 25 lakh visitors. Tickets stay at Rs 40, same as last year. From a small start in 1938 with 50 stalls, its now this massive annual event, kicked off by Hyderabad's seventh Nizam.
Title: Exhibition Society set to commence numaish in Hyderabad next week
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: At least three people were killed and three others were severely injured after a truck crashed into several vehicles at Ganesh Ghat in MP's Dhar. "The incident took place on Monday evening after the truck's brakes failed. The truck broke the side railings and fell on the other side and also hit several vehicles," Dhar SP Manoj Singh said.
Title: 3 dead as fire erupts after truck crashes into vehicles in MP
bottom_headline: Fire brigade team doused the flame

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: A tiger entered the Atkona village of Pilibhit district in Uttar Pradesh on Monday. A huge crowd gathered to see it as the tiger climbed and sat on a wall. IFS officer Parveen Kaswan shared a video showing people clicking its visuals. "The most difficult thing in such a situation is to control humans, not the wildlife," he added.
Title: Huge crowd gathers as tiger climbs wall in UP village, IFS officer shares video
bottom_headline: Security cordon created by forest dept

Author: Ankush Verma
Content: UAE and South Korea had the fastest median 5G download speeds globally during Q3 2023 at 592.01 Mbps and 507.59 Mbps, respectively, according to Ookla, which provides free analysis of Internet access performance metrics. The top 10 countries include Malaysia, Qatar, Brazil, Dominican Republic, Kuwait, Macau, and Singapore. India with a speed of 312.26 Mbps has been ranked 10th.
Title: Which 10 countries have the best 5G download speed?
bottom_headline: India, Malaysia were not in top 10 in Q3 2022

Author: Swarna Srikanth
Content: Several appalling videos have hit the internet which have raised serious questions over the situation of hygiene in the government hospitals in Uttar Pradesh. Rats were seen creating havoc by running on patients'bed and healthcare premises at the Rampur District Hospital and District Government Hospital Malkhan Singh in Aligarh.
Title: Rats Create Havoc At Hospitals In UP
bottom_headline: Visuals surface

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: A wedding was called off in Telangana after the bride's family didn't serve mutton bone marrow at the engagement party held in November. The bride was from Nizamabad and the groom was from Jagtial. Reportedly, a fight broke out after guests complained mutton bone marrow wasn't served. The groom's family claimed the dish was not included to "insult" them.
Title: Wedding called off after bride's family didn't serve mutton bone marrow in Telangana
bottom_headline: Local police tried persuading the groom's family

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Hyderabad's first woman SHO took charge at Lalaguda with much media hype on Women's Day, 2022. A few others too were later appointed. More than a year after Madhulatha became the Lalaguda SHO, Hyderabad now has only two such officers. The others were either transferred over political interests or on request.
Title: Curious case of Hyderabad's missing women SHOs
bottom_headline: Cyberabad residents lost over ₹232 crore

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: The Cyberabad police have registered a cheating case against the Sunburn music dance festival organisers for announcing and selling tickets without the necessary permissions. Madhapur ACP N Narshimha Reddy said though the case has been registered, the 31 December show has not been cancelled. Further action would be initiated after getting a probe report, he added.
Title: Cheating case against Sunburn festival organisers
bottom_headline: Fake US immigration consultancy operated in Hyd

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: The Congress is hoping to repeat its Assembly poll success in the Lok Sabha elections next year. It has to implement its six guarantees within 100 days to consolidate the voters' confidence. The BRS will be going for the Congress's jugular if it fails. Additionally, several leaders are competing to win party tickets to run the election.
Title: Telangana Congress faces a 100-day challenge
bottom_headline: Work 18 hours a day to deliver guarantees: CM

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: A Hyderabad-based lawyer has written to President Droupadi Murmu and various Union government officials, alleging corruption and misuse of powers by IAS officer Navin Mittal when he was the chief commissioner of land acquisition in Telangana. Advocate K Rajesh Kumar complained that Mittal violated I-T rules, illegally conducted various Benami transactions, and violated FERA and FEMA regulations.
Title: Hyderabad lawyer complains against IAS officer to President
bottom_headline: Dharani: Pride of BRS, bane for many citizens

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: BJP leader Pradhuman Singh Tomar knelt down and touched Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia's feet before taking oath as a Madhya Pradesh minister on Monday. He's now serving his third term as a state Cabinet minister. Tomar, a Scindia loyalist, was among the MLAs who had followed him out of Congress in 2020, leading to fall of the Kamal Nath-led government.
Title: Pradhuman Tomar touches Scindia's feet before taking oath as MP minister
bottom_headline: Tomar is an MLA from Gwalior

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: The hijab ban imposed in educational institutions in Karnataka has not yet been revoked, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah announced on Saturday, clarifying his earlier statement. Taking to X (Twitter) on December 22, the CM had written, "I have told (officials) to withdraw the hijab ban." The matter was taken to the Chief Justice of India, on which the verdict is pending.
Title: Hijab ban in KA classrooms: Why CM backtracked his statement?
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: The Israel-linked merchant vessel MV Chem Pluto, which was attacked by a suspected drone last week, arrived at Mumbai's outer anchorage on Monday. Subsequently, pictures showing the damage caused to the vessel surfaced. "Indian Navy warships will be further enhancing their patrolling in the region to keep the Indian and other merchant vessels safe in the region," said Defence officials.
Title: Pics showing damage caused to Israel-linked ship after drone attack surface
bottom_headline: US blamed Iran for the attack

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: With PM Narendra Modi skipping the annual Russian meeting, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar reached Moscow for a five-day visit to meet Russian leaders. PM Modi didn't travel to Russia for the annual summit last year too amid Ukraine war. Notably, Russian President Vladimir Putin also didn't attend G20 summit in Delhi. Jaishankar held talks with Russian representatives on Monday.
Title: PM Modi skips annual Russian meet again, Jaishankar attends talks
bottom_headline: 'Arrived in Moscow'
bottom_text: Looking forward to my engagements: Jaishankar

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, who landed in Russia for his five-day-long visit, shared a picture of an entry pass for a 1962 rally in Moscow held to honour Russia's space achievement. "How it started...How it's going," the BJP leader posted on social media. Jaishankar, born in 1955, would have been seven years old at the time.
Title: How it started, how it's going: Jaishankar as he shares pic of 1962 pass for rally in Russia
bottom_headline: 'Look forward to my engagements'
bottom_text: Said Jaishankar about his Russia visit

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: Mohammad Ashraf, who was among the civilians picked up for interrogation and allegedly tortured by security personnel in J&K's Poonch, said he could be seen in a "viral video" being beaten by Army men. "They removed our clothes...beat us with lathis and iron rods, and rubbed chilli powder on our wounds," said Ashraf. Three civilians were found dead later.
Title: I'm in video, they rubbed chilli on wounds: Man allegedly tortured by Army men in J&K
bottom_headline: Murder case filed over incident
bottom_text: Army has ordered a court of inquiry

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: BRS MLA Lasya Nanditha got trapped in a lift due to overloading in Telangana on Sunday. A picture from the incident showed six people posing with the MLA inside the stuck lift. Further, a video showed her staff and locals breaking open the lift door. Nanditha, who won the 2023 Assembly elections from Secunderabad Cantonment, was rescued safely.
Title: BRS MLA Lasya Nanditha gets trapped in overloaded lift, rescued
bottom_headline: Mishap occurred during her visit to an event

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: The Indian Navy on Tuesday said it has deployed three guided missile destroyers in the Arabian Sea "to maintain a deterrent presence". This came after merchant vessel MV Chem Pluto came under attack from a drone near India. Warships INS Mormugao, INS Kochi and INS Kolkata have been deployed in various areas, Navy said.
Title: India deploys 3 warships in Arabian Sea after drone attacks commercial ship
bottom_headline: Gabon-flagged oil tanker attacked in Red Sea
bottom_text: 25 Indian crew members are on board the tanker

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: A plane carrying 276 passengers, mostly Indians, that was grounded in France over human trafficking concerns landed in Mumbai early on Tuesday and pictures of the passengers surfaced online. As per French authorities, 25 persons, including two minors, expressed the wish to apply for asylum and remained in France. Meanwhile, two others were held and produced before a judge.
Title: Plane with 276 Indians held in France over human trafficking lands in Mumbai; 1st pics surface
bottom_headline: The plane was bound for Nicaragua

Author: Shree Lakshmi
Content: A Christmas celebration in Thiruvananthapuram's Poovar area took a distressing turn as a makeshift bridge collapsed on Monday night. The incident resulted in minor injuries to approximately seven individuals, all of whom were promptly taken to the hospital for medical attention. Emergency services responded swiftly to ensure the injured individuals received necessary medical care.
Title: Makeshift Bridge Collapse in Kerala; More Updates
bottom_headline: 7 People Injured

Author: FPJ Online Edit
Content: Indian Immigration at the Mumbai Airport said that 276 passengers were on board the flight that had been sent back by France while 25 individuals, including two minors, sought political asylum. A total of 303 passengers including 11 unaccompanied minors suspected to be illegal immigrants and victims of human trafficking were detained at Vatry airport near Paris on Friday.
Title: Airbus A340 Held In France Lands At Mumbai Airport
bottom_headline: The aircraft landed in Mumbai shortly after 4 am

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: EAM S Jaishankar held a meeting with leading representatives of the Russian strategic community on Monday. They discussed connectivity, multilateralism, big power competition and regional conflicts. They spoke about the importance of rebalancing and the emergence of multipolarity.
Title: Jaishankar meets leading representatives of Russia
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: President Droupadi Murmu gave assent to the three new criminal justice bills passed by Parliament. The Rajya Sabha on Dec 21 passed the three criminal bills–the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, 2023; the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, 2023; and the Bharatiya Sakshya Bill, 2023–replacing the IPC, the CrPC and the Evidence Act. The bills were earlier passed by the Lok Sabha.
Title: Three new criminal Bills get President’s assent
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: After the attack by a suspected drone on merchant vessel MV Chem Pluto on December 23, the Indian Navy deployed multiple Guided Missile Destroyers. They are INS Mormugao, INS Kochi and INS Kolkata in various areas of the Arabian Sea to maintain a deterrent presence. Moreover, long-range maritime reconnaissance P8I aircraft are also being regularly tasked to maintain domain awareness.
Title: IN deploys major warships to counter attacks in Arabian Sea
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A makeshift bridge set up for Christmas celebrations collapsed in Neyyattinkara town in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram on Monday.
