Author: Medhaa Gupta
Content: NCP chief Sharad Pawar has written to Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar, saying that the suspension of Opposition MPs for seeking an explanation about the security breach at the Parliament is "ironic". He claimed that some MPs who weren't involved in the "disruption" have also been suspended. Moreover, he urged Dhankar to set up an urgent inquiry into the matters.
Title: Ironic to suspend MPs; set up probe: Pawar to Dhankar on breach
bottom_headline: Over 140 MPs have been suspended so far

Author: Swati Dubey
Content: After tailing a ship seized by Somalian pirates, Indian Navy warship INS Kochi successfully evacuated an injured crew member from the hijacked commercial vessel MV Ruen. Following permission from the hijackers, Indian Navy personnel treated the sailor onboard before transferring him to an onshore hospital. The incident occurred days after the hijacking on December 14.
Title: Indian Navy saves crew member of ship hijacked by Somalian pirates
bottom_headline: To know more

Author: News Desk
Content: In a distressing sight, hundreds of dead fish were recently seen around the periphery of Durgam Cheruvu. Even though the civic authorities were quick to remove them from the water body, media reports on the dead or dying fish in the lake waters prompted the HC to take suo motu cognizance of the contamination of the water body.
Title: Telangana HC intervenes after dead fish surface in Durgam Cheruvu
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Brijesh
Content: Foreign girl molested in India, man forcibly grips her neck in broad daylight; Viral outrage ensues. Kelly, a South Korean vlogger, faced appalling molestation in India; widely circulated footage sparks outrage. Perpetrator tightens grip on Kelly's neck, hands on shoulders; intervention as two rush to stand by her side.
Title: Foreigner Molested In India, Man Forcibly Chokes Her
bottom_headline: Video has went Viral on Social Media

Author: Medhaa Gupta
Content: The Uttarakhand government has issued an advisory over the JN.1 variant of COVID-19, which has been detected in Kerala, amid a surge in cases in some states. However, it noted that no case of the variant has been detected in the state. The guidelines include testing patients with Influenza like Illness/Severe Acute Respiratory Infection for COVID-19 and influenza, etc.
Title: Uttarakhand issues advisory over COVID-19 JN.1 variant
bottom_headline: 'Spread awareness about respiratory hygiene'
bottom_text: Tap to read what more the guidelines said

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A scooty was seized by police in Bengaluru on Monday night after it was found to be involved in over 600 traffic violations and outstanding fines worth ₹3.25 lakh recorded since February last year. The vehicle owner is a woman from Ganganagar. All the violations are for not wearing a helmet or for talking on the mobile phone while riding.
Title: Scooty owner with over 600 traffic violations fined ₹3.25 lakh in Bengaluru
bottom_headline: The vehicle was bought in 2021

Author: Rupesh
Content: The Congress party's 'Donate for Desh' crowdfunding campaign faced a setback when the BJP and OpIndia swiftly acquired related domain names. This led to redirection of donors to their sites. The Congress, marking its 138th anniversary, launched this campaign for public donations, emphasizing support for marginalized communities. The incident sparked criticism over Congress's planning.
Title: BJP & OpIndia Hijack Congress's 'Donate for Desh' Domains
bottom_headline: Congress's Crowdfunding Drive Faces Hurdles

Author: Medhaa Gupta
Content: A LPG cylinder supplier and a six-year-old girl were injured after a 17-year-old boy rammed into them with a speeding car in Delhi's Shalimar Bagh on Monday, police said. A video of the incident shows the car crashing into a cart, on which the supplier was carrying the cylinders. The teenager was caught on the spot, police added.
Title: 17-yr-old hits girl with car, rams into LPG cylinder cart in Delhi
bottom_headline: The juvenile works in a private company

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Bombay High Court granted bail to journalist and activist Gautam Navlakha in the 2018 Bhima Koregaon-Elgar Parishad case. He was shifted from jail and was put under house arrest last year due to his health condition. He was accused of being an active member of banned outfit CPI (Maoist) and of instigating caste violence that erupted at Bhima Koregaon.
Title: Gautam Navlakha granted bail in Bhima Koregaon-Elgar Parishad case
bottom_headline: Bhima Koregaon is a war memorial in Pune

Author: Rupesh
Content: Serbian song Dzanum has given rise to the 'Moye Moye' trend in India mocking disabilities. Originally about nightmares & depression, the song's Indian adaptation often features parodies ridiculing disabled individuals. This trend involving celebrities & even the Delhi Police has drawn criticism from disability activists for perpetuating harmful stereotypes & insensitivity towards disabled people.
Title: Serbian Song Dzanum Has Given Rise To The “Moye Moye” Trend
bottom_headline: Controversial Trend Mocks Disabilities

Author: Rupesh
Content: Bhashini an AI-driven language translation system was used by PM Modi at Kashi Tamil Sangamam. Launched during Digital India Week, it aims to enhance digital inclusivity in Indian languages. It operates through crowdsourcing data, with features like transcription & translation in various Indian languages. Challenges include data scarcity & digital divide affecting its accessibility & accuracy.
Title: Bhashini: PM Modi's AI Tool for Language Translation
bottom_headline: Exploring Bhashini: Bridging Language Gaps

Author: Debaroti Adhikary
Content: The government has nominated 31 non-official members to the National Startup Advisory Council (NSAC). The list includes Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath, Snapdeal Co-Founder Kunal Bahl, Urban Company Co-Founder Abhiraj Singh Bhal and others. Notably, Ola Cabs CEO Bhavish Aggarwal and BYJU'S CEO Byju Raveendran have been removed from the list following completion of term of two years.
Title: Nithin Kamath, Kunal Bahl among 31 nominated to startup council
bottom_headline: Former TCS CEO Rajesh Gopinathan also on list
bottom_text: Tap to see the full list

Author: Varsha
Content: The internet is exploding with a video of four men in a moving car in Bengaluru hanging out the windows and sunroof. A Honda City sedan with an electric sunroof was spotted in the middle of the traffic. Remarkably, two people were observed standing outside the sunroof, resisting the limited area that was provided.
Title: Viral Video: 4 Men Hang Out of Speeding Car
bottom_headline: Video was uploaded regarding rash driving

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: The AAP on Monday, 18 December, dubbed the Delhi excise policy case fake and bogus after the ED summoned Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal for questioning on 21 December in a related money laundering case. Kejriwal is scheduled to go to an undisclosed location for a 10-day Vipassana meditation course from Tuesday, 19 December.
Title: Political vendetta against us: AAP after ED summons Kejriwal
bottom_headline: Arvind Kejriwal skips ED summons

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: On 12 December, almost all the 55,000 anganwadi centres in Andhra Pradesh have been non-functional and locked up. The reason is that around a lakh anganwadi workers and helpers have been staging a protest against the YSRCP government’s silence over their pending demands for the past decade including inadequate salaries and administrative streamlining.
Title: 55k AP pre-schools closed as anganwadi protests intensify
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: The Madras High Court convicted Tamil Nadu Minister Ponmudy and his wife Visalakshi in a 2016 disproportionate asset case, on Tuesday, 19 December. The sentence will be pronounced on 21 December. The move jolts the DMK government. Another minister Senthil Balaji, allowed to continue in the Cabinet without a portfolio, is already in ED’s custody in a money laundering case.
Title: Madras HC convicts TN Minister Ponmudy in assets case
bottom_headline: HC initiates suo motu proceedings

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: A seven-year-old male lion succumbed to congenital health conditions due to inbreeding at Sri Venkateswara Zoo in Tirupati, a forest official said on Monday, 18 December. The lion was short with chronic health issues. Officers said that inbreeding can lead to congenital conditions in animals. That’s why zoos go for animal exchanges to usher in newer gene pools and bloodlines.
Title: Lion succumbs to congenital issues caused by inbreeding
bottom_headline: Inbreeding is common in zoos

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: In the latest move to have complete control over data and communication, the government introduced the Telecommunications Bill 2023 in the Lok Sabha on Monday, 18 December. This should concern the country’s tech sector deeply, as the new Bill’s broad definitions, licensing requirements and overreaching provisions for the government leave a lot of scope for misuse, mistrust and misalignment.
Title: Telecom Bill 2023: Gambling with the future of India’s tech sector
bottom_headline: Telecom Bill introduced in Lok Sabha

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: The Congress, on Tuesday, 19 December, alleged that a “complete purge” is being executed so that “draconian Bills” are passed in Parliament without any meaningful debate and the BJP MP “who facilitated the entry of the two intruders” into the Lok Sabha on 13 December goes scot-free. INDIA bloc MPs are demanding a statement from Home Minister Amit Shah.
Title: ‘Purge’ in Parliament to pass ‘draconian’ Bills without debate
bottom_headline: 141 Opposition MPs stand suspended

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Forty-nine more Opposition MPs were suspended for protesting the security breach in Parliament and demanding accountability on Tuesday, 19 December, in the Lok Sabha, taking the suspension tally from both houses to 141 — the highest-ever in the history of Indian Parliament. The mass suspension comes when both Houses are to take up key Bills, including revised criminal reform Bills.
Title: Unprecedented: 141 Opposition MPs suspended from LS, RS
bottom_headline: When posturing becomes all-pervasive

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: The Mullaperiyar dam’s water level rose to 138.10 ft on Monday, 18 December, prompting authorities to decide on releasing excess water through the spillway starting Tuesday, officials said in Idduki, Kerala. The Idukki District Disaster Management Authority, chaired by Collector Sheeba George, held a review in response to rising water levels caused by unexpected rains in the catchment area.
Title: Mullaperiyar dam water levels surge; excess water to be released
bottom_headline: The water level of the dam reached 137.50 ft

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: The ex-girlfriend of temple priest Manoj Kumar Shah was arrested for his murder after his body was found with his eye gouged out and his genitals cut off in Bihar's Gopalganj. An aunt and brother of his ex-girlfriend, Neha Kumari, were also arrested, an official said. Shah was blackmailing Neha and threatening to release intimate photos and videos, he said.
Title: Priest's ex-girlfriend held for killing him over threats to leak private pics in Bihar
bottom_headline: 'Neha invited Manoj to her house'
bottom_text: He was killed by accused, dumped in pit: Police

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) has directed the Karnataka police to probe the reported incident where six students, including three Dalit students, were allegedly forced to clean a septic tank. It expressed deep concern over the gravity of the reported incident and sought an action taken report within three days from date of receipt of the communication.
Title: NCPCR:  Probe Dalit students forced to clean septic toilet tank
bottom_headline: Principal engaged students in manual scavenging

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Before being suspended from Parliament, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor shared pictures of him with BJP MP and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari. They were seen smiling while posing. Tharoor wrote in caption, "Took the opportunity, amid the Lok Sabha disruption, to thank…Gadkari for…cooperation in completing work on the NH66 from Kazhakkuttom to Karode [in Kerala]." "I initiated this project," he added.
Title: Tharoor & Gadkari smile as they pose for pics 'amid LS disruption'
bottom_headline: 'Requested his help with few remaining issues'
bottom_text: He has promised to help: Tharoor

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: The TN Forest Department is in the process of preparing a plan to restore mangroves in Ennore Creek where oil spill mitigation activities were progressing, Additional Chief Secretary Supriya Sahu said on Monday, 18 December. The restoration would be taken up with the support of specialised agencies like Centre for Environmental Studies, Anna University, and MS Swaminathan Research Foundation.
Title: Plan to restore mangroves in Ennore Creek: TN Forest Dept
bottom_headline: Oil trapped inside Ennore Creek area

Author: Gaurav Bhargava
Content: ON Tuesday, the Bombay High Court granted bail to journalist and human rights activist Gautam Navlakha. A division Bench of the high court comprising Justices A.S. Gadkari and Shivkumar Dige, however, stayed the bail Order for three weeks to allow the National Investigation Agency (NIA) to appeal in the Supreme Court.
Title: Bhima Koregaon: Bombay HC grants, stays bail to Gautam Navlakha
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Gaurav Bhargava
Content: No Kerala to Kashmir: Citing UN conventions, HC overrules transfer of father with disabled son. IN a significant order, the Kerala High Court last week held that if child with disability is affected by the transfer of his parents and the transfer in no way is in the best interest of the child, then such transfer will be considered illegal.
Title: High Court overrules transfer of father with disabled son
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Gaurav Bhargava
Content: Last week, the Supreme Court asked high courts across the country to ensure that bail applications are listed at the earliest for hearing, observing that delay in hearing bail matters could be detrimental to the liberty of a person. A two-judge Bench comprising Justices C.T. Ravikumar and Sanjay Kumar passed an Order to this effect.
Title: SC directs high courts to expedite hearing of bail applications
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has requested additional relief funds from the Centre in the wake of heavy rains and floods in southern Tamil Nadu. Stalin is in Delhi to attend the INDIA bloc meeting and has sought to meet with Prime Minister Modi. The state BJP on X, however, attacked the Chief Minister using the hashtag “MissingCM”.
Title: Stalin seeks more funds from Centre; BJP calls out ‘MissingCM’
bottom_headline: 39 places recorded extremely heavy rainfall

Author: Shree Lakshmi
Content: A horrific incident in Hyderabad captured on camera shows seven assailants armed with knives, sickles, and sharp-edged weapons hacking a man to death in Ramchandra Nagar. The victim, identified as Mohammed Tariq Ali Quadri alias Baba Khan, a 40-year-old real estate dealer, was brutally attacked in a lane under the jurisdiction of IS Sadan Police Station on Monday night.
Title: CCTV footage of hacking of real estate dealer to death goes viral
bottom_headline: Hacking a man to death!

Author: Gaurav Bhargava
Content: ON Monday, the Calcutta High Court Bar Association passed a resolution urging the Chief Justice of the high court to withdraw judicial work from Justice Abhijit Gangopadhyay after he sent an advocate to civil prison from open court. Justice Gangopadhyay had declared the advocate, Prosenjit Mukherjee, guilty of contempt of court.
Title: Contempt of court Order lands Justice Gangopadhyay in controversy
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: After about 800 passengers were stranded at Srivaikuntam in southern Tamil Nadu on Monday, 18 December, owing to heavy rains in the region, an official told PTI on Tuesday that the work to rescue them is “going on” and the exercise will be completed as soon as possible. Rain has stopped but inundation is still heavy, affecting return to normalcy.
Title: Work on to rescue stranded TN train passengers
bottom_headline: 39 places recorded extremely heavy rainfall

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: A 13-year-old tiger captured from Kerala’s Wayanad district on Monday, 18 December, on the suspicion it killed a farmer 11 days ago, is now becoming a member of the newly-developed Thrissur Zoological Park at Puthoor. Park director R Keerthi told South First that the tiger was released into an isolation ward of the zoo on Tuesday morning for observation.
Title: Wayanad’s ‘man-eater’ is Thrissur zoo’s latest inmate
bottom_headline: ‘Man-eater’ of Wayanad captured alive

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: Active Covid-19 cases in Kerala, on Monday, 18 December, rose by 111 to 1,634, according to Union government data. Commencing Saturday, mask-wearing was made compulsory and the police have been instructed to discourage unnecessary gatherings. Health workers have launched a special drive to identify individuals with fever, and those showing Covid symptoms are being placed under observation.
Title: 111 fresh Covid-19 cases in Kerala
bottom_headline: Masks a must for Karnataka senior citizens

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: Doctors at Delhi's Aakash Healthcare Super Speciality Hospital recently found a chocolate wrapper stuck in the upper bronchus of an eight-year-old girl. She initially developed a cough but later her condition worsened. "The treatment involved two-step process - the initial bronchoscopy successfully removed the foreign body, while additional intervention addressed its reaction," the hospital said.
Title: Doctors find chocolate wrapper in lungs of 8-yr-old girl in Delhi; pic surfaces
bottom_headline: The child is currently stable

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan, on Monday, 18 December, defended his gunman, accused of assaulting protesting Youth Congress workers recently, and said he was taking action when the vehicle the CM and other ministers were travelling in was suspected to be under attack. Opposition Congress alleges the security personnel and LDF workers accompanying the Cabinet’s cavalcade had beaten up protesters.
Title: Pinarayi defends gunman accused of assaulting YC workers
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: TMC MP Kalyan Banerjee, who was suspended for winter session, was seen mimicking Rajya Sabha Chairman and Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar while Rahul Gandhi filmed it. Banerjee was heard saying, "My spine is so straight, I'm so tall!" while mimicking Dhankhar. Reacting to the video, Dhankhar said, "I can only say, 'May good sense prevail.'...How ridiculous, how shameful, how unacceptable."
Title: Video shows Rahul filming TMC MP's mimicry of Dhankhar, Vice President reacts
bottom_headline: 'There should be some limits'
bottom_text: Tap to know what more Dhankhar said

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: A necklace paying homage to Ayodhya's Ram Temple, with around 5,000 American diamonds, was recently unveiled by Surat-based diamond merchant Kaushik Kakadiya of Rasesh Jewels. The necklace took around 35 days to be completed, reports said. Pictures and videos of the necklace, which required the involvement of around 40 skilled artisans, were widely shared online.
Title: Ram Temple-themed necklace with 5,000 diamonds was made in over 30 days
bottom_headline: 'Necklace not made to be sold'
bottom_text: Wanted to gift it to Ram Temple: Kakadiya

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: The INDIA bloc is meeting in New Delhi on Tuesday, 19 December, for a blueprint for a joint campaign, seat sharing and redrawing the strategy to take on the BJP in 2024. Evolving a “core positive agenda” is among the main challenges. The constituents intend to move forward with the theme “Main Nahin, Hum (We, Not Me)” at the meeting.
Title: INDIA bloc meet: Seat sharing, 2024 poll strategy on agenda
bottom_headline: 141 Opposition MPs stand suspended from LS, RS

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: Suspensions and expulsions of MPs is nothing new. Both Houses have rigorous codes of conduct that their Chairs implement strictly. But the issue is the logic of en masses suspensions. Seventy-eight suspensions in a single day is not a record a democratic institution can be proud of. It also raises questions about parliamentary procedures being hijacked by politics of expediency.
Title: 78 MP suspensions in a day: Something wrong somewhere
bottom_headline: 141 Opposition MPs stand suspended from LS, RS

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Amid "We want justice" sloganeering by Opposition MPs in Lok Sabha on Tuesday, Union Minister and BJP MP Pralhad Joshi noted, "They've brought morphed pictures of respected PM (Narendra Modi)." He claimed the MPs are "disrespecting" the PM and action should be taken against them. "I condemn this...People who lost the [recently-concluded Assembly] elections are behaving like this," Joshi added.
Title: Morphed pics of respected PM Modi brought to LS by Opp'n: Joshi
bottom_headline: 'People have accepted PM's leadership'

Author: Farida
Content: Veteran leaders of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), LK Advani and Murli Manohar Joshi, key figures in the Ram temple agitation in Ayodhya, are unlikely to attend the consecration ceremony next month due to health and age considerations, as stated by the Ram Temple Trust in Ayodhya on Monday.
Title: Advani, Joshi Requested to Skip Ram Temple Event: Trust
bottom_headline: ‘mandal puja’ will be conducted from January 24

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A Russian tourist was allegedly harassed by a petrol pump employee in Jaipur when she was travelling with a male friend, a Delhi-based travel vlogger known as 'On Road Indian'. The tourist, who was touched by the employee multiple times, said she didn't believe that it had happened the first two times. The employee said he didn't touch her intentionally.
Title: Russian tourist travelling with Indian friend harassed by petrol pump worker in Jaipur
bottom_headline: Police asked the man to apologise

Author: Debaroti Adhikary
Content: The International Monetary Fund has said India, which has been growing "at a very robust rate", is "one of the star performers" in terms of real growth. "[India is] one of the fastest growing large emerging markets and it's contributing...more than 16% of global growth this year," Nada Choueiri, IMF's Mission Chief for India, said.
Title: India is a 'star performer', contributing 16% global growth: IMF
bottom_headline: 'India has very large, young population'
bottom_text: Tap to know what more Choueiri said

Author: FPJ Online Edit
Content: The Bombay High Court on Tuesday granted bail to human rights activist and journalist Gautam Navlakha in the 2018 Elgar Parishad-Bhima Koregaon case. Navlakha was granted bail against a local surety of Rs 1 lakh. However, a division bench stayed the order for three weeks to allow the NIA to approach the Supreme Court.
Title: Mumbai: Activist Gautam Navlakha granted bail by Bombay HC
bottom_headline: Gautam Navlakha granted bail by Bombay HC

Author: News Desk
Content: The University of Hyderabad's students union and workers rallied against the administration after two contract workers' deaths last week. They attribute the fatalities of Praveen, a sanitation worker who died by suicide on Dec 12, and Vinod, a contractual office attendant who passed away due to a heart attack on Dec 11, to the higher authorities' alleged lack of empathy.
Title: Hyderabad: Protests erupt at UoH following death of 2 workers
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Rupesh
Content: A video from Tamil Nadu's Srirangam temple, showing an injured man after a scuffle with guards, was falsely claimed to depict police brutality against a Sabarimala devotee in Kerala. The incident involved visitors and guards at the Sri Ranganatha Swamy temple clashing. BOOM spoke to Kerala Police who dismissed the misleading claims stating that the video is not from Sabarimala.
Title: Tamil Nadu Temple Clash Falsely Linked to Kerala
bottom_headline: Debunking Misinformation on Temple Clash

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: Gujarat High Court has said that rape is a crime even if it is committed by the husband. The court headed by Justice DA Joshi said, "A man is a man; an act is an act; rape is rape, be it performed by a man, the ‘husband’ on the woman ‘wife’".  A complaint was  filed by a woman from Rajkot.
Title: Guj HC Stresses On Why Marital Rape Can’t Be Ignored Anymore
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Rupesh
Content: Claims of a 5-day workweek for Indian banks are circulating on social media, but they're misleading. No official statement from the Ministry of Finance confirms this change. Currently, banks close on the second and fourth Saturdays, following a 2015 policy. The Indian Banks' Association's proposal for all-Saturday closures remains unapproved by the Ministry or the Reserve Bank of India.
Title: 5-Day Bank Week? Misleading Viral Claims
bottom_headline: Bank 5-Day Week Claims: Unverified

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: Amid grappling with the floods in Tamil Nadu’s Tirunelveli, officials have an important task -- ensuring the safety of 696 pregnant women expecting to shortly deliver their babies. The District Collector and his officials, doctors and panchayat members are doing their best to convince these families to send the pregnant mothers to hospital facilities nearby to ensure their safety.
Title: How Tirunelveli is protecting its 696 pregnant moms amid floods?
bottom_headline: Thoothukudi district receives 95 cm of rainfall

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: A man in Karnataka's Haveri district was abducted, stripped and assaulted on Monday for allegedly helping a couple escape from their village. The woman's family, suspecting the man's relative of helping the couple escape, barged into his house and took him away in a car before assaulting him. The victim was later dumped outside a police station.
Title: Man abducted, stripped & assaulted for helping couple elope in K'taka
bottom_headline: Victim was taken to hospital for treatment

Author: Medhaa Gupta
Content: After the total number of Opposition MPs suspended reached 141, TMC leader Mahua Moitra on Tuesday claimed, "Next Adani Annual Shareholders meeting to be held in Lok Sabha Chamber." This is the highest ever number of MPs suspended in a session. Notably, Delhi High Court has adjourned hearing of Moitra's plea challenging government's order to evict her MP bungalow.
Title: Next Adani shareholder meet in LS: Mahua on 141 MPs suspension
bottom_headline: Earlier in Dec, Moitra was expelled from LS

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: The India Meteorological Department has released minimum temperature of cities in north west India on Tuesday, stating that fog was also observed. While Punjab's Amritsar recorded minimum temperature of 4.9°C, Haryana's Karnal recorded 6.1°C, Delhi's Safdarjung recorded 7.8°C and Chandigarh recorded 6.5°C. UP's Meerut, Bihar's Gaya, Rajasthan's Churu recorded 7.9°C, 6.1°C and 4.8°C, respectively.
Title: Which are the coldest places in north west India today?
bottom_headline: Rewa, Ranchi recorded 6.6°C, 4.2°C, respectively

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Around one-and-a-half hours before suspending 49 MPs from Lok Sabha, Speaker Om Birla told protesting MPs that he was giving them the "last warning". Addressing the MPs who were raising slogans and holding placards, Birla had said, "Sit in your respective seats...You'll be given a chance to speak." "Is this the way you want to run the House?" Birla asked.
Title: Om Birla gave 'last warning' to MPs 1.5 hrs before suspending them
bottom_headline: Shashi Tharoor, Manish Tewari and Sule suspended

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: Minutes before being suspended from Parliament, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor had said he expected suspension. He said he entered the well of the House holding a placard for the first time in his parliamentary career of nearly 15 years. "I did so out of solidarity with my Congress colleagues, who've been unjustly suspended for demanding accountability from government," Tharoor added.
Title: I expect suspension to follow: Tharoor minutes before being suspended from Parliament
bottom_headline: It's a badge of honour: Tharoor

Author: Swarna Srikanth
Content: A car allegedly driven by a minor boy resulted in an accident in Delhi after the speeding vehicle rammed into a hand-pulled rickshaw full of gas cylinders. The incident took place in the Shalimar Bagh area leaving a few people injured. A video from the site showed the rickshaw puller being dragged for a distance after the four-wheeler's forceful hit.
Title: Delhi: Car Allegedly Driven By Minor Boy Rams Into Rickshaw
bottom_headline: Video From Incident Surfaces

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: The Bihar Home Department on Monday suspended a DSP rank officer Faiz Ahmed Khan for sexually harassing a female sub-inspector nearly five months ago. As per reports, he told the victim, "Come sleep with me, I will make you an SHO." The order released by the state government on Monday said he was found guilty after an investigation.
Title: 'Sleep with me, I will make you SHO,' DSP tells junior in Bihar; suspended
bottom_headline: He was suspended with immediate effect

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: Posters featuring Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and carrying the message "'Agar sach mein jeet chahiye toh fir ek Nischay aur ek Nitish chahiye' (If you really want to win, you need a determination and you need a Nitish)" were put up in Patna. The posters were put up ahead of I.N.D.I.A  bloc meeting scheduled in Delhi today.
Title: 'Ek Nitish chahiye' poster comes up in Bihar ahead of I.N.D.I.A meet
bottom_headline: This is 1st meet of bloc after Assembly polls

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: Congress, humbled by defeat in 3 states, and allies, who are unwilling to cede anything more than bare essentials, are huddling for the INDIA bloc meeting. To wade through challenges of seat-sharing, the bloc has classified states into three categories. On the table is also the decision to double down on social justice as plank for 2024 Lok Sabha polls.
Title: INDIA bloc classifies states into 3 categories for LS seat-sharing
bottom_headline: PM face to be decided after LS polls: Mamata

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: Champat Rai of the Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra Trust said Tibetan spiritual leader Dalai Lama, Baba Ramdev, Gautam Adani, Mukesh Ambani, Natarajan Chandrasekaran and SN Subrahmanyan have been invited for Ram Temple's 'Pran Pratishtha' on January 22. Amitabh Bachchan, Rajinikanth, Madhuri Dixit and Arun Govil, who played Ram in Ramanand Sagar's Ramayan TV series, were also invited.
Title: Which prominent personalities have been invited for Ram Temple event in January?
bottom_headline: PM Modi has also been invited for the event
bottom_text: Tap here to know about other guests

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: The Bengaluru Traffic Police arrested four men who were seen hanging out of the sunroof and windows of a moving car and dancing on Bengaluru road. The incident reportedly occurred on Airport Road and the video was recorded by individuals in the vehicle trailing behind. The accused are from Kerala pursuing studies at different colleges in the city.
Title: 4 arrested after video of them hanging out of moving car in B'luru goes viral
bottom_headline: To watch the viral video

Author: Rupesh
Content: A viral video is being shared falsely claiming Rahul Gandhi called himself a tailor. BOOM's investigation reveals the video was cropped from a 2018 speech where Gandhi quoted a designer's words to highlight unrecognized talent in backward castes. The misleading clip omits context, distorting Gandhi's quoting a foreign designer who was talking to him.
Title: Cropped Video Shared As Rahul Gandhi Calling Himself A Tailor
bottom_headline: Context Lost in Cropped Gandhi Video

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Delhi High Court has adjourned the hearing of TMC MP Mahua Moitra's plea challenging government's order to evict her MP bungalow. It said it can't adjudicate her plea until Supreme Court hears her plea against her expulsion from Parliament. The apex court is set to hear the plea on January 3. Mahua allegedly took bribes for asking questions in Parliament.
Title: Can't hear Mahua's eviction plea until SC hears expulsion plea: HC
bottom_headline: Bribes allegedly given by Darshan Hiranandani

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: During the tremendous success of Animal at the box office, there's been an unprecedented level of criticism aimed at the film for its portrayal of misogyny, sexism, and the glorification of toxic masculinity. The account's administrator has openly expressed their views on the criticism the film including film critic Sucharita Tyagi. Yet the film reviewer responded fittingly to the criticism.
Title: Is Critic Sucharita Tyagi Being Targetted By Animal's X Account?
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: Forty-nine Lok Sabha MPs of the Opposition were suspended on Tuesday amid protests in the Parliament over the recent security breach. The total number of MPs suspended during the ongoing winter session has now reached 141. Congress leaders Shashi Tharoor, Manish Tewari, Karti Chidambaram, NCP MP Supriya Sule, and National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah were among those suspended today.
Title: Tharoor & Sule among 49 more MPs suspended for winter session, total reaches 141
bottom_headline: 95 suspended from Lok Sabha, 46 from Rajya Sabha

Author: Farida
Content: During the Bharatiya Janata Party parliamentary meeting in New Delhi on Tuesday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi asserted that the conduct of the Opposition in Parliament would lead to a decline in their numbers in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, while the BJP is expected to see an increase in its parliamentary strength.
Title: PM Modi: Opposition Shaken by Assembly Poll Defeats
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: BJP veterans LK Advani and Murli Manohar Joshi, who were at the forefront of the agitation for Ram temple in Ayodhya, are asked not to attend the temple's consecration ceremony. Temple Trust said they were requested to refrain owing to their health. PM Modi, who drove Advani's Rath Yatra, will be in attendance on 22 January, ahead of LS polls.
Title: Advani, MM Joshi asked not to attend Ram Temple consecration
bottom_headline: Preparations are in full swing

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: The Post Office Bill, that seeks to replace the 125-year-old Indian Post Office Act, 1898, was cleared by the Parliament on Monday. It authorises post office employees to "intercept, open or detain any item" in the interest of state security, public safety and order, emergency, contravention of laws, etc. Officials can hand over suspected banned postal items to customs authorities.
Title: What is the Post Office Bill, cleared by the Parliament to replace a 125-yr-old Act?
bottom_headline: Post office employees exempt from liability
bottom_text: Tap to know more about the Bill

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Union Minister Rajeev Chandrasekhar was asked during Moneycontrol Global Conclave about a "unique" clock in his office that runs in reverse. He recalled that he installed the "countdown" to show his officers how many days were left till next elections. He told his officers that he remains in a hurry because he has to "finish work before time runs out".
Title: In hurry to finish my work: IT Minister on reverse clock in office
bottom_headline: 'You guys can stay on over and over'
bottom_text: I don't know if I'll have job, he told officers

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: The palm-sized 'stone balls' which were worshipped by villagers in Dhar and adjoining districts of Madhya Pradesh for years turned out to be fossilised dinosaur eggs, TOI reported. Professor Mahesh Thakkar, from Lucknow's Birbal Sahni Institute of Palaeosciences, said he was informed that around 256 dinosaur eggs have been found in a stretch of 120 km in the Dhar district.
Title: 'Stone balls' being worshipped by villagers turn out to be dinosaur eggs in MP
bottom_headline: The team visited the area recently

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi made an irresistible offer to a woman who impressed the people of Varanasi with her compelling speech. Chanda Devi, a member of a self-help group and beneficiary of the 'Lakhpati Didi' scheme, won PM Modi's praise with her presentation about how she was able to leverage the loan schemes introduced by the government.
Title: Why Chanda Devi's Rally Speech Caught The Attention Of PM Modi?
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: Jacqueline Fernandez has filed a petition with the Delhi High Court, aiming to dismiss a money laundering case in which she's implicated. The case involves an alleged Rs 200 crore extortion scheme with con artist Sukesh Chandrashekhar, and Fernandez is challenging the Enforcement Directorate's complaint and additional charge sheet naming her as an accused.
Title: Jacqueline Fernandez Goes To Delhi HC Against ED Case
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: The Madras High Court convicted Tamil Nadu minister K Ponmudy and his wife P Visalakshi, who are accused of amassing ₹1.79 crore disproportionate to their known sources of income. Their quantum of sentence hasn't been decided. Ponmudy was earlier acquitted in 2016. The high court has now overturned his acquittal, claiming the trial court had erred in acquitting the accused.
Title: K Ponmudy, wife convicted in ₹1.8-cr disproportionate assets case
bottom_headline: HC ordered accused to appear before it on Dec 21

Author: Jay Pandya
Content: The Centre on Monday asked states and union territories to maintain constant vigil amid an uptick in COVID-19 cases and the detection of the first case of the new JN.1 variant in India. Recently, a few states like Kerala have reported a slight increase in the number of COVID-19 cases.
Title: Centre writes to states over detection of 1st case of JN.1 variant
bottom_headline: To read Union Health Secretary's letter

Author: Rupesh Pandit
Content: Leading fashion brands H&M and Zara are revamping their Indian stores, emphasizing aesthetics and space. Their redesigned outlets, like Zara's expansive Mumbai store, aim to offer an enhanced shopping experience. This shift towards more immersive, experience-driven retail reflects a broader trend in the industry, integrating omnichannel strategies and aligning with international store standards.
Title: Retail Revamp: Zara & H&M Redesign Stores for Enhanced Experience
bottom_headline: Fashion Giants Reinvent Retail Spaces

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: Principal and teachers of Morarji Desai Residential School in Kolar were arrested for forcing six students into manual scavenging. Three of the six, forced to clean the septic tank of the school, hailed from Dalit families. Probe into the incident also led officials to book another teacher under POCSO Act, uncovering more horrors in the school meant for underprivileged children.
Title: Students forced to clean school spectic tank in Karnataka
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: A video of two female TTEs misbehaving with a woman on UP's Bareilly station has been widely shared online, with people demanding action. The woman was seen being slapped repeatedly by one of the TTEs who also pulled on her jacket, while another TTE was seen attempting to drag her. The exact reason behind the altercation is not known yet.
Title: Woman slapped, dragged by female TTEs at railway station in UP, video surfaces
bottom_headline: Woman seen arguing with the TTEs

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: Uday Kumar Ujjwal, a senior official of the state education department in Bihar, was allegedly kidnapped by six men while he was going from Hajipur to Patna on Saturday. The accused, who threw his driver out of the car, drove with him for nearly two hours. Ujjwal escaped as the kidnappers drove the car into a drain, the FIR said.
Title: Kidnapped govt officer escapes as kidnappers drive car into drain in Bihar
bottom_headline: Kidnappers demanded Ujjwal's ATM pin

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: The National Investigation Agency, on Monday, 18 December, raided 19 locations across four states and arrested eight operatives of the Ballari module of the banned terror outfit the ISIS, including its leader Minaz. NIA teams raided 19 locations spread across Ballari and Bengaluru in Karnataka, Amaravati, Mumbai and Pune in Maharashtra and Jamshedpur and Bokaro in Jharkhand apart from Delhi.
Title: NIA arrests 8 with suspected ISIS links in multi-state raids
bottom_headline: NIA raids at 44 locations in Karnataka, Maha

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: The Allahabad High Court on Tuesday rejected a batch of petitions by Muslim side challenging the Hindu side's request for restoration of temple and right to worship at the Gyanvapi Mosque site. The petitions were filed by Sunni Central Waqf Board and Anjuman Intezamia Masjid Committee. HC also asked Varanasi court to complete hearing on the suits within six months.
Title: Muslim side's pleas against suits seeking 'restoration of temple' at Gyanvapi rejected
bottom_headline: 'Gyanvapi can't have a dual religious character'
bottom_text: Tap to know what else the court said

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: Breakups, when conveyed via text, lack the emotional depth and nuances found in face-to-face conversations. SheThePeople asked people to share their most unforgettable and unpleasant breakup text experiences. These accounts shed light on the lasting impact and emotional turmoil caused by receiving such messages. Here are a few worst break-up texts people ever received.
Title: People Share Brutally Honest, Worst Break-Up Texts They Received
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: Himani Gupta posted a picture in a graduation robe with her degree from Amity University in hand, as her father embraced her from the side. While this sounds like the recipe for a heartwarming moment where nothing could go wrong, Gupta's followers began mocking Gupta for attending Amity University, saying things like, "Amity? Sad yaar."
Title: How Celebrating Graduation on Social Media Got This Woman Trolled
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Farida
Content: The Karnataka government has imposed mandatory face mask requirements for individuals aged 60 and above, as well as those with comorbidities. Additionally, individuals showing symptoms of fever, cold, and cough must also wear masks, according to an announcement by Health Minister Dinesh Gundu Rao in Madikeri on Monday.
Title: Karnataka Mandates Face Masks for 60+ Amid JN.1 Virus Concerns
bottom_headline: Face masks and other guidelines

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: A controversy erupted on the first day of winter session of Madhya Pradesh Assembly as a portrait of former PM Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru was replaced with BR Ambedkar's poster. Congress MLA Ajay Singh called it BJP's "conspiracy" to change history. As per reports, there had been portraits of Mahatma Gandhi and Pandit Nehru on wall behind Speaker's seat since 1996.
Title: Pt Nehru's portrait replaced with BR Ambedkar's poster in MP Assembly
bottom_headline: 'The posters were in a bad shape'
bottom_text: Vidhan Sabha's Principal Secretary AP Singh said

Author: Ankush Verma
Content: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued dense to very dense fog warning for Punjab for the next five days. "Dense fog conditions in isolated pockets are very likely over Haryana during next five days and over Assam and Meghalaya on 20th and 21st December," it said. IMD predicted heavy rainfall in Tamil Nadu and light to moderate rainfall in Kerala.
Title: Dense fog, heavy rainfall warnings issued for several states; list released
bottom_headline: Heavy rainfall also predicted in Lakshadweep

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: BJP MP Brij Bhushan Singh visited native village of late Karni Sena chief Sukhdev Singh Gogamedi. During his visit, he said, "I swear to family members that if a surgical strike can happen, if Kashmir issue can be resolved...then (Gogamedi's murderers) will also be brought to justice." "I can promise that revenge for Gogamedi's killing will be done," he added.
Title: Promise that revenge for Gogamedi's killing will be done: Brij
bottom_headline: Gogamedi was shot dead on December 5

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: Five men, including a 19-year-old, were arrested for allegedly raping a 30-year-old woman in Hyderabad, police said on Monday, 18 December, 11 days after the crime was committed. The woman was waiting for a bus when the main accused noticed her and offered her a lift on his two-wheeler. He took her to an abandoned place and called his associates.
Title: Teen among 5 held for gang-rape of Hyderabad woman
bottom_headline: 7 arrested after Hyderabad minor gang-rape

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: TMC spokesperson Kunal Ghosh has stated that Mamata Banerjee would remain the Chief Minister of West Bengal till 2036, following which she would be succeeded by TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee. "Under [Mamata's] leadership, Abhishek will lead the poll battle as the general," Ghosh added. Notably, 36-year-old Abhishek is the Chief Minister's nephew. Earlier, Ghosh had called the duo a "team".
Title: Nephew Abhishek to replace Mamata as WB CM after 2036: TMC spokesman
bottom_headline: 'It is not about Mamata versus Abhishek'

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: While continuing to hear the suo-moto petition on the stripping and assault case in Belagavi district, the High Court of Karnataka on Monday, 18 December, called for fixing collective responsibility on the society. It is ‘beta padhao’ to save the girl child, the court said, adding it is for boys to be told to respect and protect women.
Title: ‘Beta Padhao, Beti Bachao,’ says K’taka HC in Belagavi case
bottom_headline: K'taka HC limits visitors to Belagavi victim

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: Jacqueliene Fernandez has moved the Delhi High Court seeking quashing of the case filed by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) against her in connection with the ₹200 crore extortion case involving conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar. She said Sukesh 'trapped her', adding that the money laundering allegations against her are false. Jacqueliene has been accused of receiving proceeds of the alleged extortion.
Title: Conman Sukesh 'trapped me', Jacqueliene tells court; seeks quashing of FIR against her
bottom_headline: Fortis Healthcare ex-promoter's wife extorted
bottom_text: Tap to know more about the case

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: Stand-up comedian Sundeep Sharma, who alleged that a gun-wielding man stopped his car in Noida at night, rejected police's claim that the man may have been holding a mobile phone. "No, I never said that it could be a mobile phone, I disagree with it. The police are trying to brush the matter under the carpet," he posted on X.
Title: Comedian Sundeep rejects police’s claim that he said gun pointed at him could be a mobile
bottom_headline: He was travelling with comedian Saurab Pandey

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: PM Narendra Modi on Monday interacted with women beneficiaries of government schemes in Varanasi. During the interaction, PM lauded a woman's speech delivery and asked, "Have you ever contested an election or will you contest one?" Reacting to it, the woman said, "I get inspired by you. This is my good luck that I am speaking in front of you."
Title: PM lauds woman over speech delivery, she says 'inspired by you'
bottom_headline: 'I am Inter-pass'
bottom_text: Tap to watch what else woman beneficiary said

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: In response to the rise of Covid-19 cases in Kerala and other states, the Karnataka government has made masks compulsory for senior citizens and those with comorbidities. The health minister said this recommendation comes as a precautionary measure following the detection of the JN.1 sub-variant of Covid-19 in a woman in Kerala. Increased testing and inter-state border monitoring are recommended.
Title: JN.1 sub-variant: Masks must for senior citizens in K’taka
bottom_headline: Karnataka to begin testing symptomatic patients

Author: FPJ Online Edit
Content: The city was inundated with rumours that the notorious 67-year-old don Dawood Ibrahim, who is holed up in Karachi, has been poisoned, and that he is in critical condition in a local hospital. There was even intense speculation that he was dead. Dawood's most trusted aide, Chhota Shakeel, rubbished the rumors and claimed that his boss was in "good health."
Title: Dawood Ibrahim poisoning: Chhota Shakeel denies claims
bottom_headline: 'Boss in good health,' says Chhota Shakeel

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: Total 92 members of Parliament have been suspended during the ongoing winter session, marking a new record in terms of the number of MPs suspended during a single session. While 78 Opposition MPs were suspended on Monday, another 14 were suspended last week. The MPs faced action for disrupting House proceedings over the Parliament security breach.
Title: Record 92 MPs suspended during Parliament's winter session
bottom_headline: 33 MPs suspended from Lok Sabha on Monday
bottom_text: 45 suspended from Rajya Sabha in a day

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: A charred body was recovered as three shanties were gutted in fire in Delhi's Shakarpur area on Monday night. A 62-year-old man named Nathu Lal, who was sleeping inside a shanty during the incident, was rescued with nearly 30% burn injuries, police said. According to preliminary investigation, some tyres caught fire initially, following which the flames engulfed the shanties nearby.
Title: 1 killed, sleeping man suffers 30% burns in Delhi shanty fire
bottom_headline: The injured man was hospitalised
bottom_text: Charred body was taken to mortuary

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: BJP veterans LK Advani and Murli Manohar Joshi, who were at the forefront of the agitation for the Ram Temple in Ayodhya, have been requested to not attend the temple's inauguration next month. "Considering their age, they have been requested not to come, which both have accepted," said Champat Rai, the General Secretary of the Ram Mandir Trust.
Title: Advani & Joshi requested not to come to Ram Mandir event due to their age: Trust
bottom_headline: Both are elders in the family: Rai

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: Lt General RC Tiwari has been appointed as the new Eastern Army Commander. The officer was commissioned into the Kumaon Regiment; he would be succeeding incumbent Lt Gen RP Kalita in the Kolkata-headquartered Eastern on December 31, Army officials said. Lt Gen Kalita is superannuating on December 31.
Title: Lt Gen RC Tiwari to be next Eastern Army Commander
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: Union Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal met with Oman’s Minister of Commerce, Industry and Investment Promotion, Qais Bin Mohammed Al Yousef. They discussed bilateral trade and investment relations between the two countries. The leaders expressed satisfaction at the pace of ongoing negotiations for signing an India-Oman Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA).
Title: Piyush Goyal meets Oman Minister Qais Bin Mohammed Al Yousef
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: Sri Lankan Parliament Speaker Mahinda Yapa Abeywardana, who is currently leading a Parliamentary delegation to India, called on Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Monday. Birla emphasised that Sri Lanka continues to be an important partner in India’s growth story.  As a strategic neighbour, Birla stressed the importance of Sri Lanka in the Indian context.
Title: “Sri Lanka continues to be an important partner..." Speaker Birla
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: Chief of Army Staff, General Manoj Pande, welcomed Chief of the Tanzanian People’s Defence Force, General John Mkunda, on Monday. They discussed ways to further strengthen existing military relations between the two defence forces. Both officials interacted and discussed aspects related to bilateral defence cooperation.
Title: Indian and Tanzanian chiefs discuss ways to boost military ties
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Brijesh
Content: A biker was immediately killed in a tragic hit-and-run when a speeding car collided with the bike on Gwalior-Jhansi road. The horrific incident was caught on CCTV. The victim was struck by a white car while trying to cross the street. The biker was then propelled into the air by the impact and fell to the ground.
Title: Hit-and-Run Incident - Biker Tossed In Air, Falls To Death
bottom_headline: The entire incident was captured on a CCTV

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: At least six cars collided with each other on the Bengaluru airport road on Monday. No casualties were reported, but several cars were damaged in the incident that took place on Chikkajala flyover near Doddajala. Pictures that surfaced from the spot showed several people gathered near the collision site.
Title: 6 cars pile up on Bengaluru airport road, visuals surface
bottom_headline: More details are awaited

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: Seven drivers deployed at the construction site of Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train project were arrested for allegedly stealing 400 litres of diesel. The accused complained about running out of fuel faster than expected, after which they were put under watch on suspicion of theft, the FIR said. Containers filled with diesel worth ₹36,000 were recovered from the accused drivers, police said.
Title: Drivers working on bullet train project steal 400 litres of diesel, pics surface
bottom_headline: Drivers were deployed by Larsen & Toubro
bottom_text: L&T had won contract for bullet train project

Author: Disha Jana
Content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday extended his congratulations to Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi on his re-election for the third time. "Look forward to working with you to further deepen India-Egypt Strategic Partnership," PM Modi wrote on X. El-Sisi won the elections with over 89% of the votes and was competing against three other candidates.
Title: PM Modi congratulates El-Sisi as he secures 3rd term as Egypt Prez
bottom_headline: Polling was held between December 10 and 12

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: After alleging that a man with a gun stopped his car in Noida, stand-up comedian Sundeep Sharma told police that it might be a mobile phone, not a gun. "This man was holding a mobile in his hand and suddenly he came in front of my car on the road. Due to which my friend...got scared," Sharma said.
Title: It might be a mobile phone: Comedian Sundeep Sharma on being held at 'gun-point'
bottom_headline: He was travelling with comedian Saurab Pandey

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: While attending an event in Varanasi, PM Narendra Modi asked a woman if she would want to contest elections. Reacting to the woman's speech, the PM said, "You speak so well...have you ever fought elections?" PM Modi asked the woman about her educational qualifications and said his dream is to make 2 crore village women 'lakhpatis'.
Title: Will you fight polls? PM asks woman speaking at event in Varanasi
bottom_headline: Are your kids studying well? PM Modi

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: A diamond merchant from Surat has unveiled a necklace on the theme of the Ram Mandir in Ayodhya, Uttar Pradesh. The necklace was made using 5,000 American diamonds and two kg of silver. It also features idols of Lord Ram, Lord Lakshman, Goddess Sita, and Lord Hanuman. It took 40 artisans a period of 35 days to craft the necklace.
Title: Ram Mandir-themed necklace made using 5,000 diamonds & 2 kg silver in Surat
bottom_headline: 'We want to gift the necklace to the Ram Mandir'
bottom_text: Director of company that made the necklace said

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A picture of a railway track hanging and surrounded by floodwater in Tamil Nadu's Tuticorin has surfaced online. The track was hanging as the ballast has been washed away.  Around 800 passengers were stuck at the Srivaikuntam railway station in the district after the station was surrounded by water on all sides.
Title: Railway track left hanging, surrounded by floodwater in Tamil Nadu, pic surfaces
bottom_headline: The release of surplus water from dams continued

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: A series of earthquakes jolted Ladakh and Jammu and Kashmir within an hour on Monday, according to the National Center for Seismology. Regions in Ladakh were hit by earthquakes of 5.5 magnitude, 3.8 magnitude and 3.4 magnitude between 3.48 pm and 4:44 pm. Meanwhile, regions in Jammu and Kashmir were hit by 4.8 and 3.6-magnitude earthquakes.
Title: 5 earthquakes hit Ladakh and J&K in 1 hour
bottom_headline: Some tremors were felt in nearby states

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: Surveillance has been stepped up in Maharashtra and district health authorities have been directed to evaluate hospital readiness amid a rise in COVID-19 cases in Kerala. "So far, we have not reported any case of JN.1 sub-variant," said Dr Pratapsingh Sarnikar, Joint Director of Health, Communicable Diseases. Isolation wards have been established in government hospitals in Maharashtra.
Title: Surveillance stepped up in Maha as COVID-19 cases rise in Kerala
bottom_headline: Masks to be made mandatory for elderly in K'taka

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: In an advisory issued for states amid rising COVID-19 cases in some states, the Centre advised states to take measures to minimise risk of transmission. "Considering the upcoming festive season, states were advised to put in place requisite public health measures...to minimise risk of increase in transmission of the disease by adherence to maintenance of respiratory hygiene," it stated.
Title: For festive season, states should take steps to reduce COVID-19 risk: Govt as cases rise
bottom_headline: There are 1,828 active COVID-19 cases in India

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: The Centre on Monday asked states to monitor and report district-wise influenza-like illness and severe acute respiratory illness cases in all health facilities on a regular basis. This comes amid rising COVID-19 cases in some parts of the country and the detection of the first case of the new JN.1 variant in Kerala. India reported 260 COVID-19 cases on Monday.
Title: Report influenza-like illness: Centre to states as COVID-19 cases rise
bottom_headline: States advised to increase RT-PCR tests

Author: Mansi Agarwal
Content: Delhi Police have written to Meta to access the social media accounts of the six people arrested in the Parliament security breach case, PTI reported. WhatsApp chats are among the details sought by the police, the report said. Authorities have reportedly also sought details of a now-deleted Facebook page 'Bhagat Singh Fan Page' where the accused allegedly met each other.
Title: Police ask Meta for details of Parliament breach accused: Report
bottom_headline: The breach took place last week

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A total of 78 MPs were suspended from Rajya Sabha and Lok Sabha for creating ruckus on Monday. This is the highest number of MPs suspended from Parliament in a day. Rajya Sabha suspended 45 MPs and Lok Sabha 33 MPs. In 1989, 63 Opposition MPs were suspended from Lok Sabha in a single day during the Budget Session.
Title: 78 MPs suspended from Parliament, highest in a day
bottom_headline: 'Murder of democracy,' said Opposition leaders

Author: Varsha
Content: In a case of road rage, a middle-aged taxi driver was thrashed to death by two cousins in west Delhi area, said an officer, adding that the accused youths have been arrested. According to police, on Sunday evening, at around 5:30 p.m., a road rage incident took place near Tagore Garden Metro Station in the Rajouri Garden police station area.
Title: Delhi Taxi Driver Thrashed to Death; 2 Held for Road Rage
bottom_headline: The car was tracked and the CCTV were examined.

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: The Karnataka High Court on Monday invoked the mythological character Draupadi from the Mahabharata while hearing the case of assault of a woman in Belagavi. "Listen Draupadi! Pick up your weapons; now Govind will not come," the court said. The woman was assaulted, paraded naked, and tied to an electric pole after her son eloped with a girl.
Title: Listen Draupadi, pick up your weapons: HC as woman paraded naked in Karnataka
bottom_headline: It is collective cowardice: HC

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: A hippopotamus in Lucknow's Nawab Wajid Ali Shah Zoological Garden has killed one 40-year-old zoo employee and injured another while they were clearing its cage on Monday. Zoo director Aditi Sharma said an inquiry into the incident is being conducted. The hippopotamus had recently been shifted to the Lucknow zoo from Kanpur, according to reports.
Title: Hippopotamus kills man in Lucknow zoo
bottom_headline: Deceased survived by wife and 2 kids

Author: News Desk
Content: The Auto & Taxi Drivers Association of Hyderabad has launched an ONDC powered ride booking application Yaary. This is perhaps the only application which offers a driver-centric approach to auto-hailing services with plans for further expansion in Hyderabad. With ONDC protocols, drivers are offered complete control over their business operations without any commission fees.
Title: Commission-free ride-hailing app on ONDC launched in Hyderabad
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: The Centre has issued an advisory to states in view of the recent surge in COVID-19 cases in some states and the detection of the first case of the new JN.1 variant. The new variant of COVID-19 was detected in a sample taken from a 79-year-old woman with mild symptoms from Kerala. India reported 260 COVID-19 cases on Monday.
Title: Centre issues advisory to states as new COVID-19 variant JN.1 found in Kerala
bottom_headline: India has 1,828 active COVID-19 cases

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, on Monday, 18 December, said that he will be meeting Prime Minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi on Tuesday, to discuss the drought situation. He will also be meeting the Congress leadership during the visit to discuss preparations for Lok Sabha polls and the appointment of party legislators and workers to state-run boards and corporations.
Title: Siddaramaiah to meet PM on Karnataka drought
bottom_headline: Karnataka announces interim relief for farmers

Author: News Desk
Content: Telangana's Kamareddy district is shaken by a chilling case of suspected serial murders involving six members of a single family, including two minors, orchestrated over a period of two weeks. Police have filed a case into the incident and investigations are underway. Kamareddy SP, Sindhu Sharma, said, We have registered a case. However, no arrests have been made so far.
Title: Telangana: Six of a family killed in bid to usurp house
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: Kerala’s Wayanad district is witnessing a protest, on Monday, 18 December, after the Forest Department captured a tiger, suspected to have killed a dairy farmer 10 days ago. The Forest Department is yet to establish if the same tiger had killed a dairy farmer 10 days ago and yet residents are baying for the big cat's blood.
Title: ‘Man-eater’ of Wayanad captured, locals want tiger killed
bottom_headline: Life in the shadow of sabre-toothed predators

Author: Rachel
Content: A study spanning more than three decades shows that one in five Indian girls marry below the legal age—i.e 18. The rate for boys is one in six. Overall rate of child marriage for girls has declined from 49% in 1993 to 22% in 2021. The rates are highest in Bihar, Bengal, Uttar Pradesh and Maharashtra.
Title: Data on child marriage in India

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Dubai authorities have restricted the movements of Mahadev gambling app creator Sourabh Chandrakar, ANI reported. An officer reportedly claimed that Sourabh has been put under round-the-clock surveillance to prevent him from fleeing UAE. The ED is probing the betting syndicate case. Sourabh, who earlier used to sell juice in Chhattisgarh, spent ₹200 crore on his wedding in Dubai in February.
Title: Dubai restricts movements of Mahadev gambling app creator Sourabh
bottom_headline: Ravi Uppal was detained in Dubai recently
bottom_text: He is the co-creator of the app

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Congress leader Sam Pitroda said 2024 Lok Sabha elections are important for India's future, adding, "We're at the crossroads." He added that people will have to decide whether they want to build a Hindu Rashtra or a "truly secular" nation. Pitroda further said that people will also have to decide whether they want a dictatorial leader or a public servant.
Title: People to decide if they want Hindu Rashtra or secularity: Pitroda
bottom_headline: 'Are we going to divide our people?'
bottom_text: Or are we going to unite our people?: Pitroda

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: A plane destined for Nicaragua carrying 303 Indians, suspected of human trafficking, touched down in Mumbai on December 26 after days of being grounded in France. This began with Indian authorities responding to an alert, flying to France for an investigation. On Monday, after receiving the all-clear, 276 passengers were flown back, with 25 seeking asylum in France.
Title: Is a Hyderabad man mastermind behind Nicaragua 'donkey flight'?
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content:
Karnataka government has made seven days home isolation mandatory for COVID-19 positive patients amid surge in JN.1 variant cases. "There are 34 cases of JN.1 variant...We are well prepared. There is nothing alarming," Karnataka Health Minister Dinesh Gundu Rao said.
"The majority of the cases are in Bengaluru. We are advising people to maintain physical distancing," he added.
Title: K'taka mandates 7-day home isolation for COVID-19 patients
bottom_headline: K'taka reported 74 new COVID cases on Tuesday

Author: Gaurav Bhargava
Content: Of the new trinity that will lord over Indian criminal law landscape, Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, replacing the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973, has received the least attention, because procedure is an unholy ghost not necessarily discernible to the layman. In the first part of this series, Nipun Saxena makes manifest what is deliberately hidden in plain sight.
Title: The unconstitutional trinity—1:Examining the unholy ‘ghost’of BNSS
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: Rajinikanth's wife Latha Rajinikanth reacted to the cheating case filed against her by a Chennai-based ad firm after a Bengaluru court granted her bail on Tuesday. "It's a case of humiliation and harassment and exploitation of a popular person. This is the price we pay for being celebrities," said Latha. The case pertains to the rights of the movie 'Kochadaiiyaan'.
Title: It’s a case of humiliation, harassment: Rajinikanth's wife on cheating case against her
bottom_headline: SC restored charges against Latha in case in Oct

Author: Varsha
Content: In an extraordinary event, roughly seventy-four criminals classified as history-sheeters entered the Ataria police station in the Hardoi district of Uttar Pradesh, carrying signs pledging to refrain from committing crimes, and they turned themselves in. Tuesday was the date of the incident.
Title: Mass Surrender: 74 Criminals Walk Into UP Police Station
bottom_headline: Increased police awareness

Author: Ankush Verma
Content: Kerala reported a drop of 142 in active COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the latest data by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Active cases in Tamil Nadu, Jharkhand and Goa dropped by 4, 3 and 1, respectively. Union Territories Puducherry and Delhi also reported a drop in active COVID-19 cases.
Title: Which states have reported a drop in active COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours?
bottom_headline: Kerala has highest active cases at 2954

Author: Debaroti Adhikary
Content: Raghuram Rajan, when asked who was India's best Finance Minister in a recent interview, replied former finance ministers Yashwant Sinha and Manmohan Singh. "Singh did the big liberalisation...which set the pace for growth," he said. "I think Sinha...kept pushing, saying 'we need to do more'...[however] to some extent he didn't get the political support that Singh got," he added.
Title: Manmohan Singh, Yashwant Sinha were two of India's best FMs: Rajan
bottom_headline: 'Chidambaram did a dream budget as the FM'
bottom_text: Tap to know what more Rajan said

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Protests erupted in Ennore after many were hospitalised as ammonia gas leaked from an undersea pipeline of a private fertiliser company in Tamil Nadu's Chennai. The leak was noticed and stopped subsequently. Company officials said five people, who felt uneasy and were shifted to health facility, are fine now. Joint Commissioner of Avadi, Vijayakumar, claimed there's "no need to panic".
Title: Many hospitalised as ammonia leaks from Chennai pipeline, protests erupt
bottom_headline: 'People are reassured and are back home'

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: Robert Vadra renovated and stayed at a London property classified as 'proceeds of crime' in a money laundering case against arms deals middleman Sanjay Bhandari, Enforcement Directorate (ED) said. Bhandari held various undisclosed foreign assets, including a property at 12 Bryanston Square, London, where Vadra stayed, ED said. This is the first time ED has named Vadra in the case.
Title: Vadra renovated, stayed at London property linked to arms dealer Bhandari: ED
bottom_headline: 'Vadra, arrested aide bought land in Faridabad'
bottom_text: Tap to know what more ED said

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday met Bajrang Punia and other wrestlers amid a row over the now-suspended Wrestling Federation of India (WFI). Rahul met with the wrestlers at the Virender Arya Akhara in Haryana's Jhajjar, with visuals of the meeting being shared online. "He (Rahul) came to see our wrestling routine...He did wrestling," said Punia.
Title: Rahul Gandhi meets Bajrang Punia, other wrestlers at Haryana akhara, pic surfaces
bottom_headline: Punia returned his Padma Shri over WFI poll
bottom_text: Brij Bhushan's aide Sanjay was elected chief

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Ex-MLA Shakil Aamir's son Raheel escaped after crashing his BMW into police barricade in Hyderabad on Christmas Eve. As per a report, Raheel had consumed liquor. Later, an SHO was suspended for falsely implicating another person after FIR was registered against a man who works for Raheel's family. In 2022, Raheel was sitting in a car which killed a toddler.
Title: Ex-MLA's son crashes BMW into barricade in Hyd on Xmas eve, escapes
bottom_headline: He was with friends during the recent accident

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: Dense fog engulfed Delhi-NCR on Wednesday morning as the visibility dropped to 50 metres, Safdarjung Observatory reported. Meanwhile, Delhi Airport issued an advisory stating that while landing and takeoffs continue, flights not compliant with CAT III (Category III) standards may face disruptions. Several trains were cancelled due to foggy conditions in the national capital, reported PTI.
Title: Dense fog in Delhi-NCR brings down visibility to 50 metres; pics surface
bottom_headline: To watch visuals from Akshardham

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: Most of the around 300 Indian passengers, on the Romania-based Legend Airlines flight that was recently grounded in France, had return tickets, the airline's lawyer told NDTV. The 'donkey flight' to Nicaragua was grounded for days over 'human trafficking' suspicions. "They had hotel reservations and return tickets...I don't know for when...But not for next day," said the lawyer Liliana Bakayoko.
Title: Most flyers on 'donkey flight' grounded in France had return tickets: Airline's lawyer
bottom_headline: 'Client was responsible for checking papers'
bottom_text: They had hired the plane, crew: Lawyer

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: The Israeli National Security Council (INSC) has issued a travel advisory for its citizens in India following an explosion near Israeli embassy in Delhi on Tuesday. Calling it a "possible terror attack", the INSC warned Israeli nationals against visiting crowded places and openly displaying Israeli symbols in India. It also told Israelis to avoid posting travel itineraries and pictures online.
Title: Israel calls blast near embassy in India 'likely terror attack', issues travel advisory
bottom_headline: 'Incident being probed by local authorities'
bottom_text: Tap to know what more the INSC said

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: EAM Jaishankar said that while there have been ups and downs in relationships between all countries, the only constant in global politics has been the ties between India and Russia. He also emphasised that countries only cooperate with those with whom they have a “high degree” of trust. He confirmed that he will hold a meeting with his Russian counterpart.
Title: India-Russia relationship the only constant in world politics
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: In a joint operation at Panzu and Gamiraj in Pulwama district, the Indian Army and J-K Police arrested three individuals with two pistols and other war-like stores. According to the information from the Chinar Corps, a Joint Cordon & Search Operation was launched by the Indian Army. Jammu and Kashmir Police at Panzu and Gamiraj in Pulwama on Dec 25.
Title: J-K: Indian Army recover arms, arrest three in Pulwama
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: The Chief of Naval staff, Admiral R Hari Kumar on Tuesday introduced the Indian Navy’s latest stealth-guided missile destroyer ‘INS Imphal’. The first warship to have been named after a city from the northeast. Warship Imphal, which can fire extended-range supersonic BrahMos missiles, was commissioned into the Indian Navy in Mumbai in the presence of Defence Minister Rajnath Singh.
Title: “INS Imphal, India’s first warship named after northeast city
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Anmol Sharma
Content: Conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar's WhatsApp messages to actress Jacqueliene Fernandez from jail have been leaked. In one of the messages, he told Jacqueliene a prominent filmmaker will approach her soon as part of a "deal" with him. In another message, he asked Jacqueliene to wear a "black kurta" for "court date". "You are going to be a superstar," read another message.
Title: Wear black kurta for court date: Sukesh to Jacqueliene in leaked WhatsApp chats from jail
bottom_headline: Sukesh is main accused in ₹200-cr extortion case

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A man ran over a couple after a fight broke out between them at a party in Jaipur, Rajasthan, on Tuesday. The girl was declared dead when she was rushed to a hospital, while the man was injured. The accused, who was allegedly drunk, passed comments on the girl, which led to the fight.
Title: Couple run over by man after fight at party, girl dies in Jaipur
bottom_headline: Visuals from the spot have surfaced

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw shared a video showing the look and features of the first Amrit Bharat train and wrote, "Amrit Bharat train of Amrit Kaal." He said the train will save at least two hours on long routes due to its advanced technology and improved acceleration. "Every seat has charging points...The train features newly designed toilets," he added.
Title: Govt shares look of 1st 'Amrit Bharat' train
bottom_headline: To watch the video of the train

Author: Saurabh Pandey
Content: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has announced a three-year age relaxation for candidates applying for recruitment of 60,244 police constables in the state. Yogi Adityanath on X said, "Your government is fully committed to interests of youth and their bright future." The application process for the recruitment would begin on December 27 and continue till January 16.
Title: CM Yogi orders 3-year age relaxation for UP Police recruitment
bottom_headline: 29 people had filed petition for age relaxation
bottom_text: Tap to read more about it

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: Actor Jay Bhanushali has criticised Akasa Air after his flight from Goa to Mumbai was delayed by three hours without any communication. "Dear Akasa Air, just wanted to wish you get well soon, because mismanagement is the second name of Akasa airline...You have lost me as a customer," he said. The airline said the delay was due to bad weather.
Title: You've lost me as a customer: Jay Bhanushali to Akasa Air after being stuck in Goa
bottom_headline: An SMS & email has been sent: Airline

Author: Anmol Sharma
Content: A 40-year-old Gujarati film actor and producer has been arrested for allegedly molesting a 17-year-old girl at a hotel in Mumbai. As per reports, the accused committed the crime on the pretext of offering the girl an opportunity to work in a film. A case has been registered against him under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act.
Title: 40-year-old Gujarati actor-producer molests 17-year-old girl in Mumbai hotel, arrested
bottom_headline: Further investigation is underway

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A letter addressed to the Israeli ambassador has been found near the country's embassy in Delhi where a blast was reported on Tuesday evening. As per reports, the letter is typed and "abusive" in nature. The embassy has confirmed that a blast was reported near its premises in Chanakyapuri area at around 5.10 pm.
Title: Abusive letter found near Israel Embassy in Delhi after blast: Reports
bottom_headline: A search team is on the spot

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A four-year-old boy, who was kidnapped and sold for around ₹3 lakh to a couple, was rescued on Christmas in Jharkhand's Hazaribag district. Six people have been arrested in this connection. The couple who bought him allegedly wanted a child. A Special Investigation Team was formed to trace the boy.
Title: 4-year-old boy kidnapped & sold for ₹3 lakh, rescued on Christmas in Jharkhand
bottom_headline: 6 mobile phones were found from the accused

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: Delhi Police on Tuesday received a call that a blast had been carried out near the Israel Embassy in the Chanakyapuri area this evening. However, officials said that nothing as such was found at the spot of the incident. The call was received by the Delhi Fire Services at around 6 pm.
Title: Delhi Police receives call of ‘blast’ near Israel Embassy
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: The Israel Embassy has confirmed that a blast was reported near its premises in Chanakyapuri area at around 5.10 pm on Tuesday. "Delhi Police and the security team are still investigating the situation," it added. The police team present at the spot said that they have not found any explosives so far.
Title: Israel Embassy confirms blast near its premises in Delhi
bottom_headline: Search operation is still on

Author: Sumavarshak
