Author: Swarna Srikanth
Content: This Christmas, the Mumbai Police shared festival greetings in their quirky style. They uploaded two posts online wishing people a Merry Christmas. While one showed Santa riding his vehicle with a helmet and reflected on road safety, the other threw light on cybersecurity and password protection.
Title: Mumbai Police Wishes Merry Christmas In Santa Style
bottom_headline: "Keep your gifts & passwords a secret"
bottom_text: Tap to know what more Mumbai police said

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: A case was registered after a woman's Instagram account was hacked and obscene photos of her were made public before her marriage in Uttar Pradesh. According to the complaint, the photos were edited and a message posted from her account demanded ₹500 for viewing the videos. The woman's fiancé claimed it was a deliberate attempt to malign his would-be wife.
Title: Woman's Instagram account hacked, obscene pics posted before wedding in UP
bottom_headline: The case was filed under the IT Act

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: A notice has been installed outside Shree Ramnath Devasthan in Goa's Ponda about dress code for visitors. The board said people wearing shorts, mini skirts, sleeveless tops, low-waist jeans and short T-shirts won't be allowed to enter the temple. Notably, most temples in Ponda are likely to provide 'uparne' and 'lungi' to those not dressed as per their dress codes.
Title: Those wearing shorts, mini skirts can't enter: Board at Goa temple
bottom_headline: Dress codes to apply from January 1: Reports

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: AIMIM president Asaduddin Owaisi expressed concern over the alleged custodial torture of civilians in Jammu and Kashmir. What happened to Home Minister Amit Shah’s claim that after the repeal of Article 370  “everything has been sorted and that there is no terrorism?”, he asked. The Army has ordered a probe into the three alleged custodial civilian deaths in Poonch.
Title: AIMIM's Owaisi questions Shah over J&K custodial torture
bottom_headline: India united against scourge of terrorism

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: People's Democratic Party (PDP) claimed that party's chief Mehbooba Mufti has been put under house arrest ahead of her visit to J&K's Surankote where four soldiers were killed in a militant ambush on Thursday. On Sunday, Mufti took to social media platform X and said that the "ground reality" punctured the narrative of peace in Jammu and Kashmir.
Title: Mufti under house arrest, not allowed to visit terror attack site Surankote: PDP
bottom_headline: 3 soldiers were injured in the terror attack

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) released a list of coldest cities in northwest India on Christmas Day, with Churu in Rajasthan recording the lowest minimum temperature of 6.4°C. MP's Rajgarh recorded 7 degrees, Punjab's Amritsar saw 7.2 degrees and Haryana's Hisar recorded 7.3 degrees. Chandigarh, Meerut, Kota, Udaipur, Ambala, Karnal, etc are also among the coldest cities today.
Title: IMD releases list of coldest cities in northwest India today
bottom_headline: MP's Gwalior, Khandwa also coldest today

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Mysuru-Kodagu MP Pratap Simha's brother Vikram Simha has been booked for illegally felling several scheduled trees in Hassan district. The MP has been on the defensive after he reportedly issued passes to two men, who breached Parliament security on 13 December. Karnataka's Forest Minister Eshwar Khandre said he has ordered a detailed investigation, and assured prompt legal action.
Title: BJP MP Pratap Simha's brother booked for axing trees
bottom_headline: Congress stages protest for Simha’s arrest

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy on Sunday, reminded district collectors and police superintendents of the need to work 18 hours a day to deliver the Congress’s six guarantees to the beneficiaries. He offered to transfer any official unwilling to meet his expectations to remote places and warned the police against laxity in maintaining law and order.
Title: Work 18 hours to deliver guarantees: Revanth Reddy
bottom_headline: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy taunts KTR

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: BRS working president KT Rama Rao on Sunday presented a Swedha Patram, a “White paper” on the state’s progress under the BRS’s rule. Releasing the document in response to the White Papers by the government, Rao said the Congress has to implement all its assurances in 100 days. He also added that the BRS will form a shadow Cabinet.
Title: BRS to form shadow Cabinet in Telangana
bottom_headline: BJP dilemma in Andhra Pradesh

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: The BJP is in a dilemma over whether to ally with ruling YSRCP or the Opposition TDP in Andhra Pradesh ahead of the 2024 polls. The party that garnered less than 1 percent votes in the previous Lok Sabha polls, feels an alliance with either of parties would better its prospects. However, its leaders are divided on the possible partner.
Title: Hamletian dilemma for BJP in Andhra
bottom_headline: Prashant Kishor meets Chandrababu

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Anupama Chandran, whose baby was given in adoption — and later reunited — without her knowledge two years ago by her father and a few Kerala CPI(M) leaders, has petitioned the government to keep its promise of taking action against those who had taken away her son. However, she was prevented from meeting the chief minister in person.
Title: Illegal adoption: Young Kerala mother demands action
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: 'Bombay Begums', a Netflix drama series, has caught the attention of a group of Indian researchers for its masterful depiction of women's problems, including their physical and mental health. The scholars found the series holding a mirror up to the double lives of urban women and published an article on the educational takeaways from the show.
Title: 'Bombay Begums' — a window to women's health
bottom_headline: Women less serious about heart health

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy ordered financial assistance of ₹2 lakh for the family of Mohammaed Rizwan, a Swiggy delivery partner, who fell to his death from a Banjara Hills apartment in January. Rizwan was delivering a food packet when the customer's dog charged at him, leading to the fall. Reddy also announced a comprehensive plan for gig workers.
Title: Telangana announces relief for gig workers
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: PM Narendra Modi on Monday paid tribute to former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee on his 99th birth anniversary at the 'Sadaiv Atal' memorial in Delhi. "His dedication and service towards Mother India will remain a source of inspiration even in his immortal age," PM said. PM Modi was joined by other leaders including JP Nadda and Rajnath Singh.
Title: PM Modi pays tribute to ex-PM Atal Bihari on his birth anniversary
bottom_headline: Atal Bihari served as PM of India for six years

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: President Droupadi Murmu and PM Narendra Modi extended Christmas greetings on Monday morning and separately asked people to recall the teachings of Lord Jesus Christ. "Let's celebrate the spirit of harmony and compassion that Christmas symbolises, and work towards a world where everyone is happy," PM Modi said. Meanwhile, the President said, "Let's resolve to work…for well-being...of one and all."
Title: Recall the teachings of Lord Christ: President, PM Modi on Xmas
bottom_headline: 'May your hearts be filled with love'

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: Sena Medal recipient Lieutenant Colonel Karanbir Singh Natt has passed away eight years after he slipped into a coma after being seriously injured during a gunfight with terrorists in J&K's Kupwara. Lt Colonel Natt was shot in the lower jaw during a counter-insurgency operation in 2015. He breathed his last at the Military Hospital in Jalandhar on December 23.
Title: Lt Colonel in coma for 8 years after being shot by terrorists in J&K passes away
bottom_headline: Lt Col Natt was part of 160 Infantry Battalion
bottom_text: He was second in command during incident

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: Kerala reported the biggest jump in active COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours at 128, followed by Karnataka at 73, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Other states which saw an increase in active COVID-19 cases are Maharashtra (50), Rajasthan (11), Tamil Nadu (9) and Telangana (8). Total number of active cases in India stand at 4,054.
Title: Which states reported an increase in COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours?
bottom_headline: Kerala reported 1 death due to COVID-19

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: Tamil Nadu BJP chief Annamalai shared screenshots of Tamil Nadu minister TRB Rajaa's purported old posts against Biharis. One of the purported posts read, "Biharis will remain at the bottom as long as the literacy rate remains [low]." Another post read, "Problem IS IN THE ENTIRE UP/BIHAR...Society & not just individuals." Annamalai claimed DMK continues to use such language today.
Title: Annamalai shares TR Rajaa's old 'Biharis will stay at bottom' post
bottom_headline: This comes after DMK MP Maran's video went viral

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: India on Monday recorded 628 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, of which 312 are active, Health Ministry data showed. Active COVID-19 cases in India have gone up to 4,054, whereas one death was reported in the last one day. Kerala recorded the most new infections with 128 new cases logged by the state.
Title: India records 628 new COVID-19 cases, active cases cross 4,000
bottom_headline: Karnataka recorded 73 new cases

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: A thick layer of fog engulfed the Delhi-NCR on Monday morning affecting flight services at Indira Gandhi International Airport as the visibility dropped to zero. The airport authorities asked passengers to contact airlines for assistance. Visibility in various parts of the city remained at 125 meters, as per IMD and the mercury dipped to 9.4 degrees Celsius.
Title: Flight operations affected at Delhi airport as fog brings down visibility
bottom_headline: Air quality remained in 'very poor' category

Author: Shree Lakshmi
Content: The unfortunate event happened on Sunday, affecting two elderly devotees, one from Sitapur (Uttar Pradesh) and the other from Jabalpur (Madhya Pradesh). Even though the police said there was no link between the deaths and the crowd at the temple, sources revealed that both women felt unwell inside the temple.
Title: Two Elderly Women Devotees Pass Away During Vrindavan Temple Visit
bottom_headline: Both women felt unwell inside the temple

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara said that state government will take a decision on Hijab issue after looking into the matter "deeply". "We have not made any orders regarding hijab," Parameshwara added. Parameshwara's remark comes after BRS leader KT Rama Rao said that Siddaramaiah government hasn't lifted ban on hijab yet and behaviour of Congress change after coming into power.
Title: Govt will decide after looking into it deeply: K'taka Min on Hijab issue
bottom_headline: 'We are thinking of withdrawing the decision'

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: PM Narendra Modi called Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin to inquire about floods in the state. Stalin said PM assured Centre's support and conveyed that he has deputed Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to assess the flood situation. This comes after state minister Udhayanidhi Stalin, while asking for disbursal of funds by Centre, said, "We're not asking for anyone's father's money."
Title: PM calls MK Stalin, deputes Sitharaman to assess Tamil Nadu floods
bottom_headline: 'Asking for share of tax paid by TN people'

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: A flight carrying 303 passengers including mostly Indians, that was grounded in France over suspected 'human trafficking', was allowed to leave on Monday, reports said. It's not yet clear if the Nicaragua-bound charter plane will return to India. The plane was grounded after authorities were reportedly alerted about the passengers likely being human trafficking 'victims' in an organised gang.
Title: Flight with Indians, grounded in France over 'human trafficking', allowed to leave
bottom_headline: 'Ten of the passengers requested asylum'

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: J&K police recovered arms and ammunition, including six IEDs and one grenade from a package that was dropped from a drone near LOC in the Akhnoor sector. The mortar shell was found lying in a field in Regal, a border village in Samba. Acting on the information, the bomb disposal squad reached the spot and recovered the mortar shell.
Title: J-K police recover arms, IEDs from drone-dropped package near LOC
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: EAM S Jaishankar is set to travel to Russia from December 25 to December 29. During his visit, he will meet his Russian counterpart Sergey Lavrov and Russian Deputy Prime Minister Denis Manturov. During the meeting, EAM Jaishankar and Russian Deputy PM and Minister of Industry and Trade Denis Manturov will meet to discuss matters related to economic engagement.
Title: EAM Jaishankar to visit Russia from December 25-29
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Disha Jana
Content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar recently said that there are a lot of complications involved in according dual citizenship to Indian nationals settled abroad. "There are security and economic challenges [in providing dual citizenship]...The OCI (Overseas Citizenship of India) [status] is the step to bridge the demand. But the debate [on dual citizenship] is still alive," he added.
Title: Dual citizenship poses challenges but debate still alive: EAM
bottom_headline: OCI card holders can't vote in India
bottom_text: They cannot contest elections here too

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A 25-year-old man was allegedly stabbed to death in Delhi's Nizamuddin and the body was set on fire using dry grass and clothes by three teenagers. One of the accused has alleged that the deceased had repeatedly tried to sexually assault him. The accused boys are aged between 16 and 17 years.
Title: 3 boys kill 25-year-old man, burn body to take revenge of sexual assault in Delhi
bottom_headline: A sharp-edged weapon, stones, sticks seized

Author: Varsha
Content: The Delhi Vigilance Secretary requested that the Health Secretary take out all non-standard medicines from the hospitals supply. The Vigilance Secretary referred to multiple lab reports from Delhi Drugs Testing Laboratory as well as additional reports from government-approved private laboratories concerning the Not of Standard Quality Drugs in his letter to the Delhi Health Secretary.
Title: Vigilance Secy Urges Seizure of Non-Standard Medicines
bottom_headline: The officer had previously been taken to court

Author: Varsha
Content: The most recent stealth guided-missile destroyer to join the Indian Navy, called Imphal, is scheduled to be placed into service on December 26 in front of Defense Minister Rajnath Singh. According to the Ministry of Defence, on October 20, Imphal, the first warship named after a northeastern city, was handed over to the navy.
Title: Indian Navy to Commission Stealth Destroyer ‘Imphal’
bottom_headline: The ship is equipped to fight

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: Sanjay Singh, the newly elected chief of Wrestling Federation of India that was suspended by the Sports Ministry on Sunday, has said he would speak to PM Narendra Modi over the decision. "We're seeking time from the Sports Minister and request that the suspension be lifted. If the issue isn't resolved through dialogue, we could explore legal options," he added.
Title: Will speak to PM, see legal options if issue not resolved: Sanjay Singh on WFI suspension
bottom_headline: Singh is ex-WFI chief Brij Bhushan's close aide

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: A video showing a man driving his car with the doors open, while a person could be seen hanging from the other door on Manali-Atal Tunnel road amid traffic jam went viral on social media. Reacting to the video, Kullu Police shared a picture of ₹3,500 challan issued against the car owner for the offence.
Title: Video shows man driving with open doors amid jam in Manali; police posts pic of challan
bottom_headline: To see the video

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: A massive traffic jam was seen outside the newly-opened Phoenix Mall of Asia in Bengaluru due to a huge influx of visitors on Christmas Eve. Traffic police advised airport-bound commuters to plan accordingly due to the heavy congestion. Several people took to social media to share pictures of the traffic chaos, with some getting stuck in the jam for hours.
Title: Pics show massive traffic outside new mall in Bengaluru on Christmas Eve
bottom_headline: Mall's parking can only fit about 3,500 vehicles
bottom_text: It has a footfall of 50,000-60,000 on weekends

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: Wrestler Bajrang Punia, who left his Padma Shri honour on a footpath near Kartavya Path, has said he won't take the honour back until justice is delivered. Wrestler Sakshee Malikkh quit wrestling after former WFI chief Brij Bhushan Singh's aide, Sanjay Singh, was appointed as the WFI chief. Notably, the newly elected body was suspended on Sunday by Sports Ministry.
Title: Won't take Padma Shri back until justice is delivered: Bajrang
bottom_headline: 'Haven't seen anything in writing'
bottom_text: Tap to read what Sakshee said

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: An assistant doctor and an associate doctor have been suspended after 18 patients' death in a hospital in Maharashtra's Thane in August. CM Eknath Shinde had ordered the constitution of a high-level committee to probe the matter. The report was tabled during the recent winter session of the assembly, an official said.
Title: 2 doctors suspended months after 18 patients died in a day in Maha hospital
bottom_headline: Thane is the home turf of Shinde

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: During a press conference, former WFI chief Brij Bhushan Singh claimed that a reporter was sent to such conferences to ask "inciting" questions. When asked to comment on Bajrang Punia leaving his Padma Shri honour on a footpath near Kartavya Path, Brij said he didn't want to comment on someone who had constantly "abused" him.
Title: You're sent to ask inciting questions, Brij Bhushan tells reporter
bottom_headline: PM will rule India for another 20 yrs: Brij

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: Regional Meteorological Centre, Chennai has said that the loss of lives in Tamil Nadu amid cyclone Michaung was averted due to world-class equipment. This comes after Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin had said that the India Meteorological Department failed to predict the accurate amount of rainfall in its forecast for several districts that witnessed 'historic' rains, which led to waterlogging.
Title: Loss of lives averted due to world-class tech: RMC Chennai on Stalin’s remark
bottom_headline: 'Such a remark hurt sentiments of employees'
bottom_text: Tap to read what RMC Chennai said

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: A 25-year-old female software engineer was chained and burnt to death allegedly by her lover, identified as a trans man, near Chennai. Blade injuries were found on her neck, hands and legs. Police said the duo had developed a friendship but a few months ago, the victim started seeing another man, following which the accused killed her on her birthday.
Title: Woman techie chained, cut with blade & burnt to death by lover on birthday near Chennai
bottom_headline: The accused has been arrested

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: More than 37,000 women from Ahir community performed Maha Raas in Dwarka, Gujarat, on Sunday. An aerial view of the women, who were dressed in traditional red attire, dancing in sync in huge circles around Lord Krishna's idol has gone viral. The event was organised in the honour of Usha, the daughter of Banasur and wife of Lord Krishna's grandson.
Title: Aerial view of thousands of women dancing in sync to perform Maha Raas in Gujarat goes viral
bottom_headline: To watch the video

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: Sanjay Singh, who was elected as the WFI President, has reacted to the newly elected body being suspended by the Sports Ministry. "Brij Bhushan Singh has retired, Sakshee Malikkh announced her retirement as well...the accused and the complainant have retired...they should let the federation run peacefully," Singh said. Sakshee announced her retirement following Singh's appointment as WFI chief.
Title: Sakshee & Brij have retired, both should let WFI run: Sanjay Singh
bottom_headline: Brij and I aren't relatives: Sanjay Singh

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan shared pictures of black tigers found in Odisha's Similipal National Park and wrote, "There are pseudo-melanistic tigers found in Simlipal. They are such due to genetic mutation & highly rare. Such beautiful creature." "The rare tigers were first officially discovered in STR in 2007. With time more were documented," he added.
Title: Pics of 'highly rare' black tigers in Odisha shared by IFS officer
bottom_headline: To see other pictures shared by the IFS officer

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: Thousands of people reached Manali for Christmas and New Year celebrations and pictures of the crowded market have surfaced on social media. Long queues of vehicles were also witnessed from Manali to Atal Tunnel. Meanwhile, snowfall was witnessed near the Atal Tunnel in Rohtang and its adjoining areas as well as in Keylong of Lahaul and Spiti.
Title: Thousands of tourists reach Manali for Christmas, pic from market surfaces
bottom_headline: People complained of traffic on social media

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: Students of a government school in Bengaluru were made to clean toilets, with a video of the incident also surfacing online. The video showed two students using a broom and other materials to clean a toilet barefoot. Parents of the students protested outside the school after the video went viral. The headmistress of the school was suspended following the incident.
Title: Students in B'luru made to clean school toilets, video goes viral
bottom_headline: We shouldn't misuse kids: Karnataka Deputy CM

Author: Brijesh
Content: An incredible event occurred at a Bihar railway station when a mother and her two kids narrowly avoided being hit by a fast-moving train. Social media users have taken to sharing a video of the terrifying incident, which shows the mother doing a heroic job of protecting her kids from the approaching train.
Title: Viral Video: Woman Shields Children from Speeding Train
bottom_headline: Husband took a daring leap from the moving train

Author: Mansi Agarwal
Content: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy has announced a ₹5 lakh accident insurance cover for gig workers such as food delivery executives and cab and auto drivers. Additionally, the state government will provide ₹10 lakh health cover to gig workers under the Rajiv Aarogyasri scheme, he stated. He added that the government would study the existing policy for gig workers in Rajasthan.
Title: Telangana to give ₹5 lakh accident insurance to gig workers: CM
bottom_headline: To know more

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: Sports Ministry has requested the Indian Olympic Association to constitute ad-hoc committee to manage and control affairs of the Wrestling Federation of India (WFI), hours after suspending the newly-elected body. BJP MP Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh's close aide Sanjay Singh was appointed as the new WFI chief on Thursday. "I've nothing to do with the sport now," Bhushan said.
Title: Sports Ministry requests IOA to form ad-hoc panel to manage WFI affairs
bottom_headline: To read more details

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: A 2019 video of DMK leader Dayanidhi Maran’s speech has pitted Opposition INDIA bloc parties against each other. The viral video showed Maran saying that people who learnt only Hindi in Bihar and Uttar Pradesh were engaged in menial jobs like cleaning toilets in Tamil Nadu. He was speaking against the imposition of Hindi at a party meeting.
Title: Dayanidhi's 2019 anti-Hindi speech riles INDIA bloc parties
bottom_headline: The controversial statement is from June 2019
bottom_text: Tap here to watch the video

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: A CCTV footage showing two thieves coming to a temple on a horse in UP's Kanpur and attempting to uproot the donation box of the temple surfaced. In the video, one thief can be seen sitting on horse, while the other attempts to steal donation box. Locals rushed to the spot hearing commotion following which the thieves fled the spot.
Title: Thieves arrive at temple on horse, attempt to steal donation box in UP; video surfaces
bottom_headline: No formal complaint registered yet: Police

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: Bengaluru is witnessing a wave-like situation, wastewater surveillance revealed. The positivity rate of SARS-CoV-2 from wastewater samples from 26 sewage treatment plants between 11 and 22 December was around 96 percent. The SARS-CoV-2 copies per ml which were 2,000 between 10 and 15 December, increased to over 3,000. In some South Bengaluru areas, viral load is more than 30,000 copies.
Title: Bengaluru wastewater tests reveal wave-like Covid situation
bottom_headline: More information about how it works

Author: Arshiya Chopra
Content: Uttar Pradesh Police have arrested a school van driver who allegedly raped a 12-year-old Class 6 girl inside his vehicle on the way to school in Kanpur on Friday morning, officials said. He later picked up other students from their houses. Police have also booked the school principal, manager and two teachers for allegedly trying to conceal the rape incident.
Title: Driver rapes Class 6 girl in school van in UP
bottom_headline: Girl's parents are speech and hearing impaired

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: A 35-year-old man allegedly killed a 65-year-old woman in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, police said. An argument ensued between them after the woman's dog allegedly barked at the man continuously while he was going home after closing his shop. The man allegedly kicked the woman in her abdomen and she fell on road, following which she died at a hospital.
Title: Dog barks at MP man, he kills 65-yr-old female owner amid argument
bottom_headline: Case of murder has been registered

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: The BRS is gearing up for a comeback in the upcoming Lok Sabha elections. Having reviewed the Assembly election results, the party is recalibrating its strategy for the polls. It plans to capitalise on instances of the Congress government faltering in implementing its six guarantees. A higher vote stare in the Assembly polls, too, has made the party optimistic.
Title: BRS gears up for Lok Sabha electoral battle
bottom_headline: KTR releases BRS’ ‘Swedha Patram’

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: Karnataka BJP has a whole new team of office-bearers to help the party prepare for the electoral battle. State BJP president BY Vijayendra, on Saturday, appointed state-level office-bearers, including 10 vice-presidents. While in Delhi attending the two-day BJP national office-bearers meeting, Vijayendra was hopeful of getting the high command's clearance for the new team.
Title: Vijayendra revamps Karnataka BJP unit
bottom_headline: Vijayendra appointed 10 vice-presidents

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: The Cyberabad Police Commissionerate recorded a quantum jump in money lost in cybercrime cases registered in 2023, while pegging the total reported loss at ₹232.34 crore. The police said 2023 saw a year-on-year increase of 248.52 percent in money lost to cyber fraudsters. The recovery rate, too, was higher in 2023, with the police taking back more than ₹46 crore.
Title: Cyberabad loses ₹232.34 crore to cybercriminals
bottom_headline: 5,342 cases in the current calendar year

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin ordered cash assistance ranging between ₹7,500 and ₹12,500 to 9,001 families affected by the oil spill in north Chennai. He also directed authorities to disburse ₹10,000 to each of the 787 affected boats. Due to Cyclone Michaung-triggered rains and floods, oil spillage surfaced in the Kosasthalaiyar River.  The oil spill affected 9,001 families.
Title: Oil spill: TN CM Stalin announces ₹8.68 crore aid
bottom_headline: CM directed to issue ₹10,000 to affected boats.

Author: Fazil Muhammed
Content: Political strategist-turned-politician Prashanth Kishor visited Vijayawada along with TDP scion Nara Lokesh and met party chief N Chandrababu Naidu on Saturday. The former I-PAC advisor was a strategist to YSRCP's Jagan Mohan Reddy during the last elections. I-PAC clarified on X that it will continue to work with the YSRCP for the upcoming elections.
Title: Ahead of Andhra polls Prashant Kishor meets Chandrababu Naidu
bottom_headline: The meeting gained political significance

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: Wrestler Bajrang Punia said government took the "right decision" by suspending the newly-elected Wrestling Federation of India (WFI). He said he'd take his Padma Shri back 'if government keeps Brij Bhushan and his aides away' from WFI. Punia had left the honour on a footpath near Delhi's Kartavya Path after he was stopped from returning it to PM Narendra Modi.
Title: Will take Padma Shri back if Brij Bhushan & his aides are kept away: Punia
bottom_headline: Trolls are calling us 'desh drohi': Punia

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A clerk working at the Chief Medical Officer's office in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia has been suspended after he allotted duty to a deceased employee during Governor Anandiben Patel's visit. The Chief Medical Officer said that the clerk also did not assign someone to test the food meant to be served during the event. Disciplinary action has been initiated against him.
Title: Dead employee assigned duty for Guv Anandiben's visit in UP, clerk suspended
bottom_headline: Patel had visited Ballia on November 26

Author: Nidhi Sinha
Content: A 34-year-old Bengaluru-based Keralite ran barefoot on streets of Dubai to raise awareness about climate change. Ultramarathon runner Aakash Nambiar, also known as 'Barefoot Mallu', covered 104 km in 17 hours and 20 minutes. His journey started from Love Lake and ended at Burj Khalifa at around midnight. He said he ran barefoot except for "last few stretches at night".
Title: 34-year-old Indian man runs 104 km barefoot in Dubai in 17 hours
bottom_headline: 'Why Dubai? Because COP28 just got over here'

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: The 1998 batch of IIT-Bombay has donated record ₹57 crore to the institution. More than 200 alumni contributed to this fund, which will be used to create hostels, set up a new AI lab, and to give scholarships. This is the highest combined contribution by a single class, breaking the previous record of ₹41 crore set by Class of 1971.
Title: IIT-Bombay gets ₹57 crore from Class of 1998, highest-ever by a single class
bottom_headline: Top global executives contributed to the fund
bottom_text: Tap here to know more about them

Author: Anmol Sharma
Content: IMD has issued dense to very dense fog warning for several states for next few days. It's very likely over Punjab and Haryana from December 25 to 28. It's likely over Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh on December 25 and 26. Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura may witness dense to very dense fog from December 26 to 28.
Title: Dense to very dense fog warning issued for several states, list released
bottom_headline: To view the full bulletin issued by IMD

Author: Swarna Srikanth
Content: Gone are the days when people believed that parties were boring without alcohol. These days, people continue to say cheers and chug a beer, however, to celebrate sober. There's a twist in the drinking trend that you need to know about. It's about people wanting to sip and dance with wine and whiskey but in a non-alcoholic way.
Title: Non-alcoholic beer, wine & mocktails set Gen Z party trend
bottom_headline: Here's what mixologists & tipplers say

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: The Haryana Police on Friday filed a case against Sameena Dalwai, a professor at privately-run OP Jindal Global University after she exhibited dating profiles of female students in class. In the complaint, the Haryana State Commission for Women Renu Bhatia accused her of outraging the modesty of students. The incident happened in September and no one has been arrested.
Title: Professor shows dating profiles of female students in class in Haryana, booked
bottom_headline: Bhatia visited campus in Nov over the incident

Author: Sakshita Khosla
Content: IIT Kanpur Dean of Students Affairs Sameer Khandekar was delivering a lecture on good health when he collapsed on the stage and passed away of a cardiac arrest on December 22, reports said. Professor Khandekar's final words were, "Take care of your health", Hindustan Times reported, citing people present there. He had reportedly been battling health issues since 2019.
Title: 'Take care of your health,' said IIT Kanpur professor moments before collapsing, dying
bottom_headline: 'We mourn the loss of a humble soul'
bottom_text: IIT Kanpur said on Khandekar's demise

Author: Nakul Ahuja
Content: Indian wrestler Sakshee Malikkh has reacted to the suspension of the newly elected WFI body, saying she hadn't seen anything in writing yet. "This has happened for the betterment of the wrestlers. We had been saying this was the fight of daughters and sisters," she said. Sakshee had announced her retirement from wrestling after Sanjay Singh was appointed WFI chief.
Title: Haven't seen anything in writing: Sakshee on WFI's suspension
bottom_headline: 'Have nothing to do with newly elected WFI body'
bottom_text: My focus is on 2024 LS polls: Brij Bhushan Singh

Author: Subhangi Singh
Content: Younger brother of retired SSP Mohd Shafi who was shot dead while he was praying at a mosque in Baramulla said that Shafi was a regular at mosque for Aazan. "This morning, Shafi stopped suddenly in between his call for Aazan. At first, we thought microphone had stopped working. However, later we learnt....he had been fatally shot," Shafi's brother said.
Title: He stopped in between his Aazan call: Kin of ex-SSP shot in J&K
bottom_headline: 'Heard loud noise between Aazan call'
bottom_text: Tap to know what else the family members said

Author: Arshiya Chopra

Kedar has been sentenced to five years of rigorous imprisonment and ₹10-lakh fine has been imposed on him. Five other people were given same punishment in the case which dates back to 2002.

Content: A team of Election Commission of India officers on Saturday reviewed Andhra Pradesh's preparedness for next year’s elections and directed officials to ensure that the electoral rolls are free of any errors and maintain transparency while conducting polls. Content: The Kerala Police have registered a case against state Congress chief K Sudhakaran, Opposition leader VD Satheesan, and senior party leaders in connection with the violence in Thiruvananthapuram on Saturday, during the party’s march to the DGP office. bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Satarupa Dhar
Content: Security forces have been deployed in the Bafliaz area of Poonch district as search operations are underway to nab terrorists in the forest area in the Rajouri sector. The Indian Army is conducting an inquiry into the deaths of three civilians in the Poonch-Rajouri sector. Militants launched an attack on army personnel on Dec 21 killing four soldiers.
Title: J-K: Security forces deployed in Poonch
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A video of a train passing over a woman and her two children at Barh Railway Station in Bihar has surfaced online. All of them are safe. They were pushed off the platform and fell on the track when people began boarding the Delhi-bound train. In the video, the mother could be seen crouching over the children on the track.
Title: Train passes over woman & her 2 kids who fell on track in Bihar, video surfaces
bottom_headline: All of them were pulled back to the platform

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A 20-year-old student allegedly died by suicide by hanging herself in her room in Kamla Nagar and a note has been found. The woman was pursuing graduation from Delhi University and lived with her mother. The student's mother works with the IB after her husband died by suicide around five years ago.
Title: 20-year-old Delhi University student dies by suicide, note found
bottom_headline: The body has been handed over to her family

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: Dr. Sameer Khandekar, a professor of mechanical engineering at IIT-Kanpur, died on stage while delivering a speech on Friday. He reportedly suffered a heart attack and collapsed while urging people to take care of their health. "We mourn the loss of a humble soul & pray that God gives his family & friends strength to bear this loss," IIT-Kanpur said.
Title: IIT-Kanpur professor Sameer Khandekar dies on stage while delivering speech
bottom_headline: He was the Dean of Student Affairs

Author: Brijesh
Content: A 45-year-old Gujarati man named Vijay Pandey is charged with the murders of his mentally ill daughter and sick wife in the Umargam community. The tragedy started on a fateful Wednesday afternoon when they were pushed into the Varoli river, which is close to Humran village, by Pandey.
Title: Man Pushes Ailing Wife and Mentally-Ill Daughter into River
bottom_headline: Pandey reportedly confessed to his heinous crime

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: Pictures showing a merchant ship after it was attacked by drone near the Indian coast on Saturday have surfaced. The vessel MV Chem Pluto, carrying crude oil, was going towards Mangaluru from a port in Saudi Arabia. The drone strike caused an explosion and fire on the merchant ship with around 20 Indian crew members, but no casualties were reported.
Title: Pics show ship after it was attacked by drone near Indian coast
bottom_headline: 'MV Chem Pluto to reach Mumbai by December 25'
bottom_text: ANI said quoting Indian Coast Guard officials

Author: Anmol Sharma
Content: A video surfaced online wherein DMK MP Dayanidhi Maran said people from UP and Bihar who know only Hindi migrate & clean roads and toilets in Tamil Nadu. Maran's remark came while he compared people who learn English and who only learn Hindi. "Do Nitish Kumar & Lalu Yadav agree with their...coalition partner's opinion?" BJP MP Giriraj Singh tweeted.
Title: People from UP & Bihar who know only Hindi migrate & clean roads, toilets in TN: DMK's Maran
bottom_headline: To watch the video that surfaced online

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: Huge traffic jam was reported on the Mandi to Manali highway on Saturday as several people reached Himachal Pradesh for Christmas and New Year celebrations. People shared videos of the traffic congestion on social media. "Please do the needful. We are stuck in traffic from Atal tunnel to Manali for past 5 hours," a user said.
Title: Video shows massive traffic jam in Manali ahead of New Year celebrations
bottom_headline: 'Elderly people, women also stuck,' said a man

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: BJP leader Ramdas Puri, who had vowed in 2017 not to wear footwear till BJP formed a government in Madhya Pradesh, started wearing shoes in the presence of former CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan. Chouhan shared a video of Puri on X (formerly Twitter) and said that even after BJP came back to power in 2020, Puri didn't start wearing shoes.
Title: BJP's Ramdas wears shoes after 6 years, Shivraj Singh Chouhan shares video
bottom_headline: To watch the video

Author: News Desk
Content: Telangana chief minister A Revanth Reddy will be holding a meeting on Sunday, December 24 with district collectors and SPs to instruct them about the steps to be taken for implementation of Congress six poll guarantees. The party had promised to implement these guarantees within 100 days of coming to power.
Title: Revanth to hold meeting with officials on six guarantees
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: A Delhi court extended till 5 January the police custody of Mahesh Kumawat, who was arrested in connection with the 13 December Parliament security breach case. Custody of six accused in the case has been extended to 5 January. The custody was required "to find the actual motive behind the attack and his association with enemy country and terrorists organisations."
Title: Parliament breach: Accused Mahesh Kumawat custody extended
bottom_headline: Mysuru man Manoranjan maybe the mastermind

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: The BJP strongly reacted to Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah’s announcement of withdrawing the ban on wearing hijab in educational institutions in the state. Several BJP leaders accused the ruling Congress of carrying forward the British policy of “divide and rule”. The saffron party also stated that the move raises concerns about the “secular nature” of educational spaces.
Title: Siddaramaiah is dividing society: BJP on hijab ban withdrawal
bottom_headline: No more hijab ban, says CM Siddaramaiah

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Tension prevailed in Thiruvananthapuram after the police allegedly fired teargas shells unprovoked at a Congress rally taken out against the recurring instances of police attacking those waving black flags at CM Pinarayi Vijayan and his Cabinet colleagues. KPCC chief Sudhakaran, Jebi Methar, Anvar Sadath, Chandy Oommen were taken to a nearby private hospital after reported uneasiness.
Title: Kerala Police lob teargas at Congress rally; leaders in hospital
bottom_headline: CM justifies police booking woman journalist

Author: Anmol Sharma
Content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has officially been relieved as AICC in-charge of Uttar Pradesh as Congress announced several organisational changes on Saturday. Avinash Pande has been appointed AICC in-charge of Uttar Pradesh, while Priyanka is now general secretary without portfolio. Sachin Pilot has been made AICC in-charge of Chhattisgarh, while Randeep Singh Surjewala has been assigned Karnataka.
Title: Priyanka Gandhi relieved as UP Congress in-charge, Pilot appointed Chhattisgarh in-charge
bottom_headline: To view the full list of changes

Author: News Desk
Content: A major fire has been reported in Ankura Hospital situated near Pillar No. 68 of PVNR Expressway in the Jyothinagar area of Mehdipatnam on Saturday, December 23.According to early reports, the fire started at around 5:30 pm from a flexi on the rooftop of the hospital building. No casualties have been reported.
Title: Video: Major fire at Ankura Hospital in Hyderabad
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A massive fire broke out at the Ankura Hospital in Hyderabad's Gudimalkapur area on Saturday. There are no reports of any casualties in the incident. The blaze started on the top floor of the hospital apparently due to a short circuit. Five fire tenders rushed to spot and brought the blaze under control.
Title: Massive fire breaks out at Ankura Hospital in Hyderabad, visuals surface
bottom_headline: More details are awaited

Author: Anmol Sharma
Content: Multiple-time Deaflympics gold medallist Virender Singh said he'll return his Padma Shri Award to PM Narendra Modi to protest the appointment of Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh's close aide Sanjay Singh as WFI President. This comes after Bajrang Punia returned his Padma Shri Award to PM Modi on Friday. Virender also urged Sachin Tendulkar and Neeraj Chopra to voice their opinion.
Title: After Bajrang, Deaflympics gold medallist Virender to return Padma Shri Award to PM Modi
bottom_headline: Sakshee Malikkh quit wrestling on Thursday
bottom_text: It was after Sanjay was elected WFI chief

Author: News Desk
Content: The VHP urged Telangana police to cancel a 'Tablighi Jamaat' meeting near Parigi, alleging it aimed to harm Hindu culture and spread COVID-19. They met with Telangana DGP, seeking cancellation and withdrawal of a government grant. Failure to comply might lead to VHP-led agitation.
Title: VHP demands Telangana police to not permit Tablighi Jamaat event
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: Vivek Bindra, accused of assaulting his wife hours after wedding, is a motivational speaker and social media influencer with 21.4 million subscribers on YouTube. He is the founder and CEO of ed-tech firm Bada Business Private Limited. His LinkedIn profile says that he has set 12 World Records, including 9 Guinness World Records, for the largest webinars on distinct topics.
Title: Who is Vivek Bindra, the motivational speaker accused of assaulting wife?
bottom_headline: He got married on December 6

Author: News Desk
Content: 81 female students from Kakatiya University were suspended for ragging their juniors at the Padmakshi hostel. The incident was reported to the university registrar, who notified anti-ragging committee and the commerce principal. After counseling, the students were suspended from hostel accommodations for a week. No police complaint was filed, and the university aims to curb ragging at its onset.
Title: Kakatiya University suspends 81 girl students for ragging
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: News Desk
Content: Vice President of India, Jagdeep Dhankhar, will visit the city on December 27 for the first time since his election in 2022. State chief secretary Santhi Kumari reviewed security arrangements and bandobast for the visit. A police band will be present, and officials were instructed to follow traffic and security regulations from the Blue Book for a smooth visit.
Title: Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar to visit Hyderabad on Dec 27
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Anmol Sharma
Content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Saturday clarified the state government hasn't revoked the hijab ban that the previous BJP-led government had imposed in the state. "We haven't done it yet. I was responding to a question when I said that we are contemplating on lifting the restriction on wearing hijab...The matter will be discussed with government officers first," Siddaramaiah added.
Title: Haven't revoked hijab ban yet, matter to be discussed with govt officers first: K'taka CM
bottom_headline: 'What to wear & what to eat is personal choice'

Author: Varsha
Content: On Saturday night, there was a massive fire at a hospital in Hyderabad. The multi-story Ankura Hospital building in the Gudimalkapur neighbourhood has been mostly destroyed by fire. Whether there are any casualties was not immediately apparent. Massive flames spread throughout the building's upper story.
Title: Tragedy Strikes as Huge Fire Hits Hyderabad Hospital
bottom_headline: Patients are currently being evacuated.

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A man and his wife have been arrested for allegedly beating his 64-year-old mother to death in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain. The couple beat up the woman with a cricket bat and a metal pipe when she refused to give them her property. The victim suffered serious injuries on her legs and hands and died during treatment in hospital.
Title: 64-year-old woman beaten with cricket bat by son, daughter-in-law in MP, dies
bottom_headline: The man was addicted to alcohol

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: After saying that menstruation is not a handicap, Union minister Smriti Irani said, "Why should a woman's menstrual cycle be known to her employer?" She said that by making menstrual leave a mandate, she does not want women to face discrimination and harassment at the workplace. "Imagine a floor with 20,000 women...we're creating new barriers for discriminating women," she added.
Title: Why should a woman's menstrual cycle be known to her employer?: Irani on period leaves
bottom_headline: Irani is Minister of Women and Child Development

Author: News Desk
Content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Saturday slammed Karnataka CM for his contemplating hijab ban remark after mentioning that the state would revoke the decision to ban hijab in educational institutions. It has been over 6 months since you came to power. What is there to contemplate on whether Muslim girls should have a right to education or not, Owaisi asked.
Title: Owaisi slams Siddaramaiah for ‘contemplating’ remark
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: News Desk
Content: The Cyberabad Commissionerate zone witnessed a spike in cybercrime cases in 2023, with 5,342 registered cases. Victims of these crimes were duped of Rs 232.34 crore by the cybercriminals. While the police booked 4,850 cases last year, they said that cybercrimes are increasing due to the increased use of the internet in today's society.
Title: Cybercrime cases spike in 2023, victims lose Rs 232.34 cr
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: Union Minister Smriti Irani has said her father was affiliated to Congress but he left active politics after former PM Rajiv Gandhi died. "My mother is Sanghi...We had a lot of friction within the family because my parents were from different political ideologies," she said on ANI podcast. Notably, Irani is an MP from Amethi, which Rajiv Gandhi also represented.
Title: My father was a Congress man, my mother is a Sanghi: BJP's Smriti Irani
bottom_headline: Rajiv Gandhi died in 1991

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: Delhi High Court said that fasting or not fasting on Karwa Chauth may be an individual choice and may not be termed as an act of cruelty. The court was hearing a woman's plea that challenged a family court's verdict granting divorce to a couple. The woman's husband said she got annoyed and decided not to fast in 2009.
Title: Not fasting on Karwa Chauth is not an act of cruelty: Delhi High Court
bottom_headline: Delhi HC upheld the family court's decision

Author: Farida
Content: On December 23, mobile internet services were suspended in the Jammu and Kashmir Poonch and Rajouri districts as security forces conducted an extensive search operation to locate terrorists responsible for the recent ambush on two Army vehicles, resulting in the death of five soldiers.
Title: Jammu & Kashmir internet suspended during anti-terror operation
bottom_headline: Terror Ambush 5 Soldiers Killed, Search Ongoing.

Author: Dharini Mudgal
Content: Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) dismissed allegations by cattle owners that impounded stray cattle are mistreated by them. "[When] a cattle passes away...my officers tell me that they, who're salaried employees of the corporation, carry out a puja," AMC counsel GH Virk told the Gujarat High Court in response to these allegations. "That's...the extent to which they take care," he said.
Title: We perform puja when cow dies: AMC to Guj HC; denies mistreatment
bottom_headline: '20 to 25 cows die everyday'

Author: Anmol Sharma
Content: An 11-year-old Class 5 boy from Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur district died after accidentally hanging himself while copying a 'suicide prank' he saw on social media. "He tried to emulate...suicide prank after seeing the reels. The noose tightened around his neck. We rushed him to a nearby hospital where doctors declared him dead," his father said.
Title: 11-year-old boy copies 'suicide prank' after seeing it on social media in UP, dies
bottom_headline: The incident happened on Thursday

Author: Hiral Goyal
Content: A video of motivational speaker Vivek Bindra's wife Yanika showing her bruised face and hands has surfaced after he was booked for assaulting her days after their marriage. Bindra allegedly locked Yanika inside a room and abused her after she tried to mediate a fight between him and his mother. "She has wounds all over her body," police complaint said.
Title: Pics show bruised face, hands of motivational speaker Vivek's wife after alleged assault
bottom_headline: Bindra allegedly also broke Yanika's phone
bottom_text: Videos given to police, Yanika's brother said

Author: Ankush Verma
Content: British maritime security firm Ambrey has said that the merchant ship attacked in Indian Ocean was Israel-linked. The fire on the Liberian-flagged chemical products tanker was extinguished without crew casualties, it added. "The ship had last called Saudi Arabia and was destined for India at the time," it further said.
Title: Merchant ship attacked in Indian Ocean was Israel-linked; was heading to India
bottom_headline: Some structural damage reported: Ambrey

Author: Farida
Content: A drone strike damaged a merchant ship in the Indian Ocean near Gujarat's Veraval coast on December 23. The vessel, associated with Israel, was a Liberia-flagged chemical/products tanker, according to UK Maritime Trade Operations and Ambrey. The attack, unclaimed so far, caused a fire but resulted in no casualties. The Indian navy has responded to the incident.
Title: Drone Hits Ship near India's Coast: Agencies Confirm
bottom_headline: The drone strike  structural damage

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: A Nicaragua-bound plane that took off from UAE carrying 303 Indian passengers has been grounded in France over suspected “human trafficking”, French authorities were quoted on Friday, 22 December. The national anti-organised crime unit JUNALCO has taken over the investigation. Special investigators are questioning all those aboard and two people are in custody pending further examination.
Title: France grounds flight with 303 Indians; human trafficking?
bottom_headline: Man arrested in US for trafficking, slavery

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed a closed-door meeting of the BJP’s national office-bearers on 22 December, as the party took stock of its organisational preparedness and chalked out upcoming programmes for the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. Sources said the general message to the party leaders was to intensify their outreach around the government’s good works.
Title: BJP’s national office-bearers hold 2-day meet with eye on LS polls
bottom_headline: Congress gets into poll mode

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Justifying the registration of a case against a woman journalist concerning the hurling of shoes at the bus he and his Cabinet colleagues were travelling, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said the police action was based on evidence. There won’t be any hindrance for any journalist to perform their duty but conspiracy could not be entertained, he said.
Title: CM Vijayan justifies booking woman journalist in shoe-hurling case
bottom_headline: Opposition disturbed over Nava Kerala Sadas: CM

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: Motivational speaker Vivek Bindra has been booked for assaulting his wife. Recently, YouTuber Sandeep Maheshwari accused him of a ₹500-crore scam by running a course like marketing for students. In 2018, IMA filed a case against Bindra for using defamatory language against doctors. Sikhs criticised him over an animated depiction of Guru Gobind Singh in a video in 2022.
Title: What are the past controversies surrounding Vivek Bindra?
bottom_headline: Bindra got married on December 6

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has insulted the people of Tamil Nadu, who were in the grip of a calamity, by “discourteously declining” to provide funds as requested by CM MK Stalin, state Finance Minister Thangam Thenarasu said. He expressed disappointment that Sitharaman had not called for the briefing to announce the disbursal of funds for TN.
Title: Nirmala Sitharaman insulted TN in grip of calamity: State govt
bottom_headline: CM Stalin seeks ₹2,000 crore interim relief

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Congress MP Karti Chidambaram appeared before the Enforcement Directorate in Delhi on Saturday, 23 December, in a money laundering case linked to visa issuance to some Chinese nationals in 2011, sources said. ED’s case pertains to the allegations of ₹50 lakh being paid as kickbacks to Karti and close associate S Bhaskararaman by someone at Talwandi Sabo Power Ltd. (TSPL).
Title: Karti appears before ED in money laundering case
bottom_headline: Karti Chidambaram calls the case ‘most bogus’

Author: Dharini Mudgal
Content: Delhi L-G VK Saxena has recommended a CBI inquiry into the alleged procurement and supply of "non-standard" drugs in Delhi government hospitals, Raj Niwas officials said. Speaking on the matter, Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai said the government will come out with a detailed response. He alleged there's an attempt to obstruct the work of the government through such inquiries.
Title: Delhi L-G seeks probe over non-standard drugs' supply in hospitals
bottom_headline: To read more

Author: Dharini Mudgal
Content: Madhya Pradesh BJP leader Ramdas Puri, who'd vowed in 2017 not to wear footwear till BJP forms a government in the state, started wearing it again on Saturday, days after BJP won the elections. BJP's Anuppur district president Puri did so in the presence of ex-CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan. "For six years, Puri remained barefoot in every season," Chouhan said.
Title: BJP leader wears footwear after 6-year gap as party wins MP polls
bottom_headline: A video of the same has surfaced online

Author: Anmol Sharma
Content: The 12 rat-hole miners who were involved in rescue of 41 workers trapped inside the partially collapsed Silkyara-Barkot tunnel have refused to encash ₹50,000 cheques given to them by Uttarakhand government. "[It's] too paltry a sum to acknowledge our role....A permanent job or a house to live in would have been more appropriate," one of the rat-hole miners said.
Title: Rat-hole miners who rescued tunnel workers refuse to encash U'khand govt's ₹50,000 cheques
bottom_headline: 'We have made India proud'
bottom_text: Vakil Hassan, who headed their team, said

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: Alexis Rivas, CEO of US-based Cover, said terminal 2 of Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru is the most unique airport he has visited. "I'd love to see more...boldness like this in airport designs. It's a great way to make a strong first impression," Rivas said, adding that India is leapfrogging in many areas. He also shared the airport's pictures.
Title: Most unique airport: US CEO Alexis Rivas as he shares pics of Bengaluru's new terminal
bottom_headline: The airport is stunning at night: Rivas
bottom_text: Tap to see the pics he shared

Author: News Desk
Content: The TSRTC made a special request to women who travel shorter distances to use the Palle Velugu instead of the Express buses to save time for commuters travelling farther. "Some women are pressuring the staff to stop buses at unpermitted stops. This increases the travel time. So, Express buses will be stopped only at the permitted stages," TSRTC MD said.
Title: TSRTC makes special request to women who travel short distances
bottom_headline: To Read the full story

Author: Ankush Verma
Content: A drone attacked a merchant ship in the Indian Ocean, two maritime agencies said according to multiple reports. The United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations (UKMTO) said the attack caused an explosion and fire. "Vessels are advised to transit with caution and report any suspicious activity to UKMTO," it further said.
Title: Drone attacks ship in Indian Ocean
bottom_headline: For more details

Author: Dharini Mudgal
Content: BJP leader and Assam Chief Minister (CM) Himanta Biswa Sarma on Saturday participated in the 'International Gita Mahotsav' in Haryana's Kurukshetra. During the event, he addressed a gathering and said, "Lord Krishna is our son-in-law because he married Rukmini, daughter of Assam. Therefore our relationship with Lord Krishna is that of a son-in-law."
Title: Our relationship with Lord Krishna is that of a son-in-law: Sarma
bottom_headline: To know what else he said

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A video that claimed to show YouTuber Elvish Yadav and his friend being attacked by a mob during his visit to Vaishno Devi temple has gone viral. However, journalist Pardeep Singh, who was present there, said this was a fake news to defame Elvish. "We engaged in a verbal spat but it was sorted out immediately," the journalist added.
Title: Viral video claims to show mob attacking Elvish Yadav in J&K, journalist clarifies
bottom_headline: Elvish visited Vaishno Devi temple on Dec 20

Author: Saurabh Pandey
Content: Internet services have been clamped down in Jammu and Kashmir’s Rajouri and Poonch after three locals were found dead on Friday evening under mysterious circumstances. The deceased belonged to the village, located close to the DKG-Bufliaz forest area, where terrorists carried out the ambush. As many as five soldiers were martyred near the same site by terrorists in Poonch.
Title: Internet suspended in Rajouri & Poonch after 3 locals found dead
bottom_headline: 7-8 men were picked up for questioning: Reports
bottom_text: Tap to know more about it

Author: Farida
Content: A video has surfaced on social media capturing Elvish Yadav's recent visit to the Vaishno Devi temple in Jammu where the Bigg Boss OTT 2 winner was attacked by a mob. Elvish, accompanied by producer and close friend Raghav Sharma, made the visit to the Vaishno Devi temple on December 20.
Title: Elvish Yadav Attacked: Viral Assault on BB OTT 2 Winner in Jammu
bottom_headline: Viral Clip Sparks Concern

Author: Deepika Bhatt
Content: A man and his three-month-old daughter were burnt alive after a fire broke out in their home due to a room heater in Rajasthan's Khairthal-Tijara district. The man's wife received injuries. The incident took place after a quilt caught fire due to the heater. They were rushed to a hospital where the father and his daughter were declared dead.
Title: 3-month-old girl, father burnt alive in fire caused by room heater in Rajasthan
bottom_headline: The man worked as a driver

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: Amid the ongoing debate about menstrual hygiene policy, Union Minister Smriti Irani asked, "Which gay man without a uterus has a menstrual cycle?" Her remark came after RJD's Manoj Jha asked whether government plans to introduce a menstrual hygiene policy and whether it would extend to LGBTQIA+ community. "The question was intended either to shock, provoke or...attract attention," Irani added.
Title: Which gay man has menstrual cycle: Smriti Irani amid menstrual hygiene policy debate
bottom_headline: The question did provoke controversy: Irani

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: Minister of Woman and Child Development Smriti Irani has made another bizarre statement on paid menstrual leave. Defending her claim that women should not get paid menstrual leave, Irani said that why should employers know about women's menstrual cycle?  Irani made this statement adding that she doesn't want women to face discrimination in the workplace because of their periods.
Title: Smriti Irani: Employers Shouldn't Know Women's Menstrual Cycles
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Ankush Verma
Content: Madhya Pradesh's new CM Mohan Yadav has said, "Our government is working to prove that Ujjain is the global Prime Meridian and we will push to correct the world time." While questioning the beginning of a new day at 12.00 am, Yadav said, "No one begins their day at midnight. People either wake up with sunrise or some time later."
Title: Prime Meridian runs through Ujjain, we will push to correct the world time: MP CM Yadav
bottom_headline: To know what else he said

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: India’s maiden solar mission Aditya-L1 will reach its destination, the Lagrangian point (L1), which is located 1.5 million km from Earth, on 6 January, Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) chairman S Somanath said. The mission, the first Indian space-based observatory to study the Sun from halo orbit L1, was launched by the ISRO on 2 September from Sriharikota.
Title: Aditya-L1 will reach destination on 6 January: ISRO chairman
bottom_headline: Aditya-L1 nearing its final phase: ISRO chief

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: The Infopark in Kochi and Kochi Metro Rail Limited (KMRL) have entered into an agreement to build IT workspaces in Kochi Metro station. The MoU was signed between KMRL MD Loknath Behera and Infopark CEO Susanth Kurunthil to set up flexi workspaces in 39,880 square feet of built-up space across six floors of the Ernakulam South Metro Station.
Title: Infopark-KMRL tie-up for flexi workspaces in Kochi Metro station
bottom_headline: Sabarimala Greenfield Airport takes off

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: The successful soft landing of India’s ambitious Chandrayaan-3 mission on the lunar south pole was admired by a large part of the world, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said on Friday, 22 December. India’s strategy is to maximise the opportunities and minimise the risks as technology holds immense potential for leapfrogging development, he said at an event.
Title: Large parts of the world admired India’s Chandrayaan-3: EAM
bottom_headline: No hope of waking up Vikram Lander and Pragyan

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: Hyderabad witnessed a 2 percent increase in overall crimes in 2023 compared to the previous year, according to the police. Hyderabad also saw an increase in the number of cybercrime cases. There were 2,735 cases registered in 2023 as against 2,249 in 2022. The total cases registered were 24,821 cases in 2023 against 24,220 in 2022, the police said.
Title: Hyderabad saw 2% rise in crimes in 2023
bottom_headline: Police arrest 8 for murder of man near his home

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: After the Swaminarayan Mandir Vasna Sanstha in US' Newark was vandalised, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said, "Extremists, separatists and such forces should not be given space." He added that the Indian Consulate complained to the US government and an inquiry is underway. A picture showed pro-Khalistani slogans written on the walls of the temple.
Title: Extremists shouldn't be given space: Jaishankar after Hindu temple vandalised in US
bottom_headline: Sentiments of Indian community hurt: MEA

Author: Swapnil Tripathi
Content: On Monday, the Parliament passed the Post Office Bill which empowers the government to intercept any item. However, in 1987, President Zail Singh refused to grant his assent to a similar Bill passed by Rajiv Gandhi's government. The President must sign a Bill passed by the Parliament, however, there is no time period stipulated. Singh acted on this constitutional ambiguity.
Title: When the President vetoed the Post Office Bill
bottom_headline: Tap to read more.

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: Meet Nisha Pahuja, an illustrious Indo-Canadian filmmaker who emerges as the brilliant mind behind the compelling documentary To Kill A Tiger, which has recently secured a coveted spot on the shortlist for the 2024 Oscars in the Documentary Feature Film category. Pahuja's cinematic prowess and storytelling finesse have propelled her to the forefront of the film industry.
Title: Who Is Nisha Pahuja? Doc- Filmmaker Shortlisted For Oscars
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: On Friday, 22 December, the Indian Medical Association extended its gratitude to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah for "exempting medical professionals from criminal prosecution" under 304(a) of the IPC, now 26 of BNS (death by rash or negligent act). Shah announced in Parliament about excluding the provision from the new Bill — Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.
Title: New Bill differentiates medical negligence from criminal offence
bottom_headline: Takeaways from Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, on Friday, December 22, said the restrictions on wearing hijab (head scarf) in educational institutions in the state would be lifted from Saturday. He also observed that the choice of dress and food was personal for a citizen, adding no one should indulge in vote-bank politics. Hindutva outfits and BJP have lodged protests.
Title: No more hijab ban, says Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah
bottom_headline: Banning outfits involved in hate politics

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Former Karnataka chief minister and JD(S) state president HD Kumaraswamy on Friday, 22 December, met Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, a day after he along with his party’s president HD Deve Gowda held a meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Kumaraswamy said on Thursday his party and the BJP will complete their talks regarding 2024 seat-sharing by January end.
Title: JD(S) Karnataka president HD Kumaraswamy meets Rajnath
bottom_headline: JD(S) to ‘claim winnable seats’ from BJP

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: The Karnataka HC has quashed a bribery case pending against former BJP MLA from Channagiri, Madal Virupakshappa. The Karnataka unit of Aam Aadmi Party on Friday, 22 December, demanded that Chief Minister Siddaramaiah immediately refer the Karnataka Soap and Detergent Factory bribery case to the Lokayukta to re-investigate Virupakshappa. The case crushed BJP’s electoral prospects in the last polls.
Title: AAP urges Lokayukta probe into KSDL bribery case
bottom_headline: HC quashes bribery case against ex-BJP MLA

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: Olympic medallist grappler Bajrang Punia on Friday, 22 December, returned the Padma Shri award in protest over the election of Sanjay Singh, a Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh loyalist, as the president of the Wrestling Federation of India (WFI). On Thursday another Olympian, Sakshi Malik, quit wrestling over election of Sanjay Singh, a Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh loyalist, as WFI Chief.
Title: Olympic medallist Bajrang Punia returns Padma Shri
bottom_headline: Sakshi Malik quits wrestling

Author: Sumavarshak
Content: The Hyderabad police said on Friday, 22 December, they had apprehended eight people in connection with the murder of Mohd Thariq Ali on Tuesday. The victim was a real estate professional. He was killed early on Tuesday in front of his home in Ram Chandra Nagar area of Hyderabad. They seized knives, scooters and mobiles from the accused.
Title: Hyderabad police arrest 8 for murder of man outside his home
bottom_headline: 5 police teams to probe murder of Hyderabad man

Author: Dharini Mudgal
Content: West Bengal BJP leader Agnimitra Paul has dared West Bengal Chief Minister and TMC chief Mamata Banerjee to contest against Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. Speaking with news agency ANI, Agnimitra questioned, "Why does not Mamata Banerjee contest from Varanasi? You want to become Prime Minister, right? Then she should contest against our Prime Minister."
Title: BJP leader dares Mamata, says 'Contest against PM from Varanasi'
bottom_headline: To know what else Agnimitra Paul said

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: French police grounded a Nicaragua-bound plane carrying 303 Indians following an anonymous tip suspecting human trafficking. Two men have been detained and taken for interrogation by a unit specialising in organised crimes. Indian authorities also flew to France for the investigation. The Airbus A340 had landed at Vatry airport in eastern France for a technical stopover.
Title: Why France Grounded Plane With 303 Indians?
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) on Thursday seized nine ball pythons and two corn snakes at the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport in Mumbai. The snakes were found concealed inside biscuits/cake packets from a person who arrived in Mumbai from Bangkok on Thursday, the agency informed. "The carrier of these exotic species has been arrested," it added.
Title: 9 ball pythons & 2 corn snakes hidden inside biscuit packets seized in Mumbai
bottom_headline: Pictures of the seized snakes surfaced online

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: Vivek Bindra, a well-known motivational speaker and social media personality, faces allegations of domestic violence against his wife, Yanika, as confirmed by the police in Noida's Sector 126. The complaint was filed by Vaibhav Kwatra, Yanika's brother, stating that the incident occurred at the Supernova West Residency in Noida's Sector 94, where the couple lives.
Title: Eight Days After Wedding, Vivek Bindra Accused Of Assaulting Wife
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: The hijab ban imposed in educational institutions in Karnataka will soon be withdrawn, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah announced. Taking to X (Twitter), he wrote in Kannada, "I have told (officials) to withdraw the hijab ban." The hijab ban was imposed in early 2022 by the BJP government, restricting students from donning the religious scarf on state-run campuses.
Title: Why Did Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah Revoke Hijab Ban In Classrooms?
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Shree Lakshmi
Content: The Gujarat government has taken a step to foster a stronger connection between students and India's cultural heritage by introducing a supplementary textbook on the 'Bhagavad Gita.' This textbook, based on the revered scripture, will be incorporated into the curriculum for classes 6 to 8, starting from the next academic year.
Title: ‘Bhagavad Gita’ to be introduced in Gujarat School Curriculum
bottom_headline: Textbook on the Bhagavad Gita

Author: Prakash Priya Karan
Content: A woman from Rajasthan filed a FIR against former MLA Mewaram Jain and eight others, alleging them of raping her and a minor friend, as well as molesting her teen daughter, for years. The names of Minister Girdhar Singh Sodha and Rajasthan Police Officers, including Anand Singh Rajpurohit, Barmer Station House Officer Gangaram Khawa are included in the FIR.
Title: Rajasthan: Nine Including Ex-MLA, Ministers, Cops Accused Of Rape
bottom_headline: To Read More

Author: Ankush Verma
Content: India saw 752 coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The number of active cases in the country has increased to 3,420. The COVID-19 death count was recorded at 5,33,332 with four new deaths - two from Kerala, one each in Rajasthan and Karnataka.
Title: 4 COVID-19 deaths, 752 cases reported in India
bottom_headline: 4,44,71,212 people have been discharged so far

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: The Indian Army said an infiltration bid was foiled in the international border sector of Khour in Jammu's Akhnoor on the intervening night of Friday and Saturday. It added that the suspected movement of four terrorists was spotted through surveillance devices following which firing was launched. "Terrorists were seen dragging one body back across the IB," the Army said.
Title: Terrorists seen dragging body back as infiltration bid foiled in J&K: Army
bottom_headline: The terrorists were heavily armed: Officials

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: The wife of popular motivational speaker Vivek Bindra is not able to hear properly after being allegedly assaulted by him days after their wedding on December 6, Yanika's brother Vaibhav said in the FIR as per reports. The alleged incident happened in Noida. Vaibhav alleged that Bindra locked his sister in a room, hurled abuses and physically assaulted her.
Title: Motivational speaker Vivek's wife can't hear properly after being beaten up by him: Reports
bottom_headline: She has injuries all over her body: Vaibhav
bottom_text: Case registered at Sec 126 police station

Author: Dharini Mudgal
Content: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge wrote to Rajya Sabha Chairman and Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar and said the suspension of MPs from the Parliament was "painful, frustrating and disheartening". The Congress chief said the government "will have its way" but the Opposition must have a say. Notably, I.N.D.I.A bloc on Friday protested at Jantar Mantar against the suspension of the MPs.
Title: Witnessing MPs' suspension was painful: Kharge to VP Dhankhar
bottom_headline: To know what else Mallikarjun Kharge said

Author: Ankush Verma
Content: Kerala saw an increase of 266 active cases in the last 24 hours, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Karnataka, Maharashtra and Tamil Nadu saw an increase of 70, 15 and 13 active cases, respectively. Gujarat's active cases rose by 12 to 44. Active cases have also increased in Andhra Pradesh, Goa, Rajasthan and Telangana.
Title: Which states have seen an increase in COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours?
bottom_headline: Punjab and MP reported decrease in cases
bottom_text: Tap to see the full list

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: The Swaminarayan Mandir Vasna Sanstha in Newark, US, was defaced, following which the Newark Police said a thorough investigation would be conducted. One of the pictures shared by the Hindu American Foundation showed pro-Khalistani slogans written on the temple's walls. "The mention of...Bhindranwale, who targeted Hindus for murder is...meant to traumatise temple-goers," the foundation said.
Title: Pro-Khalistan slogans written on Hindu temple in US, pic surfaces
bottom_headline: 'This should be investigated as hate crime'
bottom_text: Tap to see the foundation's post

Author: Shalini Ojha
Content: After a Nicaragua-bound plane carrying 303 Indians was grounded in France on Friday, two people were taken into custody pending further examination, the Paris prosecutor's office said. The plane was grounded over suspected "human trafficking" and special investigators reportedly questioned all passengers. Meanwhile, MEA said it has obtained consular access and is investigating the situation.
Title: France detains 2 people as plane with 300 Indians grounded over 'human trafficking'
bottom_headline: We are ensuring wellbeing of passengers: MEA

Author: Shree Lakshmi
Content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has declared the withdrawal of the hijab ban order introduced by the previous BJP government. Speaking at the inauguration of new police stations in Mysuru, Siddaramaiah stated that students are free to start wearing hijab to educational institutions.
Title: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah Announces Withdrawal of Hijab Ban Order
bottom_headline: Withdrawal of Hijab Ban Order

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: Anganwadi workers and helpers in Andhra continued their protest on 22 December, despite the government announcing it would release ₹80 crore to meet their demands. The protesters dismissed it as a “mere PR exercise” and continued their agitation. The Anganwadi Workers and Helpers’ Union has been demanding an increase in wages, enhanced budget allocation, ₹5 lakh retirement benefits, among others.
Title: Anganwadi workers dismiss govt's ₹80-cr announcement as PR stunt
bottom_headline: Anganwadi protests: 55,000 AP preschools closed

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: The Delhi Police Special Cell suspects Mysuru resident Manoranjan D to be the mastermind behind the breach, said a source privy to the probe. According to the police, Lalit Jha, another accused, has revealed to the interrogators that Manoranjan was the one who motivated other members "to do something big" and planned the breach in the Parliament.
Title: Manoranjan maybe mastermind: Police on Parliament security breach
bottom_headline: Manoranjan's father Devaraju condemns act

Author: Kamna Revanoor
Content: The single-day spike in Covid-19 went past the 150 mark in Karnataka on 22 December, as opposed to Thursday’s 106. With one more death reported in the 24 hours preceding 8 am, the toll in the recent spike went up to four. Of the 2,366 samples tested during the reporting period of 24 hours, 78 returned positive.
Title: Single-day Covid-19 spike crosses 150 mark in Karnataka
bottom_headline: No Covid guidelines for New Year: Siddaramaiah

Author: Kamna Revanoor
